loans.name: Esinely

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Esinely S.. She is widowed with four children, ages 9, 11, 16, and 22. In 2005 Esinely established a business selling shoes, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock of shoes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Furaha 2 Group

texts.en: Scholstica is single and 29 years old with no children. She is a soft-drink seller.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira J., who is 34, has a high school education, is married, and has 4 children. She lives in the village Yangikurgan in the Shahristan region. Mohira doesn't work outside of home. At home, she takes care of the cattle. Her older son also helps her with this business. In the morning, he pastures cattle in the mountain plains with neighboring children. In the evening, he comes back home. Mohira's husband works in a farm. He has only seasonal profit. That makes their cattle business their single source of income during the winter time. Mohira has been a client of MicroInvest since the middle of 2007. Using the first credit, she was able to buy a cow, and using the second one, she bought 2 young bulls. She plans to use this new credit to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Жумабоева Мохира Шарифовна - 34 лет, образование среднее, замужем имеет 4-х детей. Мохира живет в селе Янгикурган Шахристанского района. Мохира не работает. Дома занимается откормом скота. Ее в этом деле помогает старший сын. Утром он пасет скот на горных равнинах с соседскими детьми а вечером приходит домой. Муж Мохири работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Его доход сезонный. Зимой единственный источник дохода это скот. Мохира кредитуется в МЗФ «Микроинвет» начиная с середине 2007 года. На полученный она купила корову а на второй кредит 2-х бычков. На новый кредит она планирует купить телят .

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle

loans.name: Rohadiah

texts.id: Usaha mengumpulkan barang bekas sudah sejak lama dilakoni oleh Rohadiah.  Ia biasa berangkat 2 kali sehari, dari pukul 06.00 sampai 09.00. Setelah istrahat sebentar Ia mulai menyortir hasil krongsokannya karena harus dipisahkan antara kaleng, kertas dan gelas/botol air mineral. Sore hari Ia berangkat pukul 15.00 sampai 17.30. Dari hasil menjual rongsokan Ia bisa menyambung hidupnya di bali bahkan dikirim untuk orangtuanya yang ada di Jawa dan juga dipakai untuk biaya pendidikan anak yang sekarang duduk di bangku SMP.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
A. Jane buys maize in large quantities and sells smaller quantities to her customers. She is not yet married.

Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of stock. So she is requesting a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
A. Alisher is 26 years old. He is married and has a wonderful daughter who was born six month ago. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their daughter. Alisher is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a young boy. He has eight years of experience, and has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season.

He is producing such crops as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber and others. Each year he is growing the yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income, and requires considerable funding. Thus, now Alisher shall need to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for planting. He’s asking for a loan of $700. Alisher would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production. This would increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 12 months. With your help, he will get ahead. He thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is a businesswoman of Balikuddembe women's group in Lugazi. She is into the business of buying sacks of dry maize from all surrounding villages then taking them to the grain milling factory to make flour. After that, she sells the flour to shops at double price.

Josephine is married with nine children, seven of them still in school. She also looks after four grandchildren. Her husband is a farmer and together they would like to see their children grow into responsible citizens.

Josephine says the loans have been so helpful for the last five years that she has been with Pearl Microfinance. She has been able to educate her children and take care of her home as well as paying her workers on time (she has people who help her in her business).

Now she needs a loan to help her with buying more sacks of maize for her business. This time she is taking a small loan because of her health (she had an accident) and would not want to leave a lot of money with her workers; but she says with the next cycle, God willing, she will be able to take her usual amount of $1200 and above.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of maize.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya D. is a 38 year old widow and the mother of five (5) children. Her business is selling pagnes (decorative cloth) in Avetonou, a village located about 100 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this second loan from FECECAV she would like to increase the size of her business by acquiring a greater number of customers and increasing her revenues. This will assist with improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Eya D. est âgée de 38 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient le commerce de pagnes à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroîitre la taille de son activité pour attirer beaucoup plus de clientèle et dégager ainsi beaucoup de bénéfice. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of Pagnes (Decorative cloth) for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Sarin's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which is comprised of 22 people, is located in Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province. Most of the group members are married, and they will use their portion of the loan proceeds for different purposes.

To illustrate, Mrs. Sim S. is the village bank president, though she also sells fruit at the local market. Since her business has been doing well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demands. Mrs. Sim S.'s husband, Mr. Chea Sun, is a construction worker who makes approximately $3.50 per day to support their family. Mrs. Sim S. is 45 years old, and she is the mother of five children. One of her children is employed at a garment factory and earns approximately $65 per month, three of her children attend school, and her youngest child (a 2-year-old) is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To expand a fruit-selling business by purchasing a variety of fruit to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Osarieme

texts.en: Osarieme E. is 48 years old, and she is married with five children. Osarieme sells palm oil, foodstuffs and "pure" drinking water. The demand for her pure water is high, and she wants to retain her customers, so she is seeking a loan of 700 USD to buy a deep freezer. She says that the deep freezer will enable her to keep her pure water cold and therefore meet the demands of her customers. In the picture, she is standing in the middle between her two daughters. She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer for pure water

loans.name: Mafunda's Group

texts.en:
Mafunda S. has been selling food in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for several years. She is now hoping to take out her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can open a new cosmetics shop. She repaid her first loan successfully and on time. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 85 each month.

Mafunda is 32 years old, married, and has two children, aged 16 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members who have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad works as a plumber. He installs lavatories and does maintenance. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to do some engine work on his car. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Thanks to one of his good friends, Ahamd has been working on a big project, where he knows the owner and they have a good reputation. He plans in the future to sell his old car and purchase a newer and bigger one.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan to do some engine work on his car.

loans.name: Leyla Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Leyla Evangelina López tiene la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es viuda Doña Leyla tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ninguno de sus hijos dependen de ella ya que todos trabajan por cuenta propia, sus deseos son mantener su negocio activo por lo que todavía necesita mantener a su Mama que todavía esta a su cargo, sus propósitos son de superar la calidad de su producto para lograr obtener la afluencia de clientes y así proporcionar mas ingresos para ella y para su familia que ocupan su mayor prioridad como también lo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que puedan vivir mejor en un futuro.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica el de destace de cerdo y el la elaboración de nacatamales y de frito, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 23 años, ella inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que ella tenia el oficio de costurera y por la poca afluencia de clientes decide establecer el negocio de la venta de nacatamales y la elaboración y mas tarde decide quedarse con este negocio y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas productos como: Maíz, leña y los diferentes ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Leyla Evangelina L. is 56 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children none of whom depend on her as they all work. Her wish is to keep her business active as she needs to support her mother who is still in her charge. Her intention is to increase the quality of her product so that she can obtain an influx of clients and thus provide more income for herself and for her family who are her biggest priority. She also wants to provide for improvements to her home so that they can liver better in the future. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is butchering pork and making "nacatamales" (traditional Nicaraguan food). She has had her business for 23 years. She started this business because she needed to work as she could no longer work as a seamstress because there were few clients. She decided to establish her business selling and making nacatamales and later decided to keep this business and started buying pork. With the influx of clients she decided to invest more in her business. This loan will be used to purchase more products such as corn, wood and the different ingredients used to make nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as corn, wood and the different ingredients used to make nacatamales.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. E. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Bati, in the province of Takeo. Since 2002, she and her husband together have been weaving scarves to earn a living, and are able to make $3 a day. This couple still live with their parents and other sisters and brothers. Mrs. Chea S. E. is asking for a loan to purchase more silk to weave scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to weave scarves.

loans.name: Exaucée Group

texts.en:
Mado is 45 years old and the mother of 6 children between the ages of 13 and 28, of whom three go to school and three  are already independent. Mado runs a cement store and also sells 10kg sacks of corn flour. She has been in business since 1994. She began her business with US$ 60, selling palm oil from 1994 to 1995. In 1996, her business slowed down because of the deterioration of her health. 

In 1998, Mado decided to change her business by starting to sell rice, semolina and vegetable oil. Most of her working capital was focused on semolina because of the profit it was generating. Unfortunately, in 1999 many companies closed in DRCongo due to the war and insecurity, including those that were producing Mado’s goods. So her business regressed until 2007 when she re-launched it, offering new types of products. She began selling women’s slippers, vegetable oil, and corn flour. 

After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in May 2008. Mado has already received two loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. Currently, her working capital is about $170. With her next loan she is planning to purchase 28 10kg sacks of corn flour to increase the inventory of her business. Mado’s dream is to do corn and manioc farming and be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchase 28 10kg sacks of corn flour

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo vive en casa alquilada con su mamá en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Tacahua de la ciudad de La Paz; Reynaldo trabaja en un taller pero al mismo tiempo trabaja individualmente reparando puertas y ventanas a domicilio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina para soldar y de esta manera continuar con su trabajo individual y así poder cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y otros.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro; la actividad que desarrolla lo califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in a rented house with his mother on Inca Roca Street in the Tacahua area of the city of La Paz. Reynaldo has a job in a workshop and also works individually repairing doors and windows in people's homes. He is soliciting this loan to buy a welding machine for his individual work, which will allow him to cover the costs of necessities such as food. This is his first loan from Impro; his developing business qualified him for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding machine for door and window repair business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Mrs. Adelaida T., 41, has been a loyal client of HSPFI for many years. She wants funds amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase trays of eggs, bags of rice and assorted RTW (ready-to-wear) for her established customers.  Her neighbors are sugarcane planters, banana and pineapple plantation workers in their village. Adelaida is maximizing her stock due to the entry of various plantation workers.

loans.use: Purchase trays of eggs, bags of rice, assorted items for sale.

loans.name: Abdugufron

texts.ru: Абдугуфрон занимается редким по нынешним временам делом – он изготавливает национальные сундуки. Это ремесло передалось ему от его отца, с которым он и продолжает его. Национальные сундуки у таджиков является обязательным подарком дочери, когда она выходит замуж, поэтому сундук постоянно находится в большом спросе. На постройку сундука используются доски которые высушиваются в течении 3 лет, специальная жесть для украшивания и красится с помощью краски произведенной из натуральных красителей. Сундуки Абдугуфрона прочные и красивые и поэтому не задерживаются долго. Сейчас у Абдугуфрона заканчиваются сырье и материалы и поэтому, чтобы восполнить их запас, он подает заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Abdugufron has an unusual profession for this modern age, he makes traditional chests. This trade was passed on to him from his father, and together they continue it. A Tajik chest is traditionally given to one's daughter when she marries, therefore the chests are continually in high demand. Wood that has dried for three years is needed for construction of a chest, special tin for decoration and they are painted with paints made from natural dyes. Abdugufron's chests are strong and beautiful and sell quickly. He is currently out of materials, and therefore to increase their supply, he is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. owns 1.2 hectares of land in their village. Her main crop is rice and she sells all her harvest to her neighbor to earn a living. She is 34 years old, married to a farmer named Renato S. and has six children. School is quite expensive nowadays, so Joy and her husband do their best to provide for the needs of their children.

The purpose of Joy S.'s loan from CEVI is to buy fertilizers and seeds. This will help her whole family increase their crop's yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is 45 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Currently all her children are in school. Gifty belongs to the village bank called "Yesu Tease."

Gifty has been selling frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, sausages etc. in the local market of Dorma for seven years. Gifty also prepares and sells food like banku and cooked yams. Banku is prepared from ground maize and it is eaten with different sauces.

She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With this loan, she wants to purchase more frozen foods, such as fish, chicken, pork and meat, so she can raise enough income to expand her sales. She wants to save part of the proceeds to invest in her children's education. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods and cereals

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon, 45, is a widow. She has one son (shown in the photograph) who is married, but lives in the family house. She also has her daughter-in law and one grandchild living with her. The family lives in a small village of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pon has been cutting grass for sale as cow fodder for two years. Her son has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 2006. He drives from his village to Takhmao market which is about four kilometers from his village and back. But, his old motorbike doesn’t work properly which has upset his business. Therefore, Pon is requesting a loan of $300 in order to replace the old motorbike so that her son is able to continue his business.

loans.use: To replace her son's old motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Maria Jamileth

texts.es: Doña Maria Jamileth S., tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, lo cual espera lograr ya que su casa es de zinc y ya esta muy viejo e insegura. Su negocio es la venta de fritanga y destace de cerdo, que desde hace seis años inicio con préstamos. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de piedra y su cocina lo cual desea con mucho anhelo para tener una casa digna. a futuro es poder ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los créditos y por las mejoras que ha logrado.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Jamileth S. is 47 years old and a resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has three adult children who live on their own. Her plans include completing the renovations to her zinc house, which is quite old and unsafe. Her business involves butchering pigs and preparing fried pork dishes for sale. She started her business six years ago with the help of loans.

This current loan will be used to purchase building materials to complete the stone walls of her kitchen, which will give her the decent home she greatly desires. In the future, Doña Maria would like to expand her food business. She thanks AFODENIC for supporting her with the loans and helping her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Fredrick Obuya

texts.en:
Fredrick is thirty years old and married with three children, ages seven, five and one.  Fredrick does small-scale charcoal dealing. A large truck comes by his house regularly, from which he buys the charcoal in bulk. He then re-sells it to his neighbors when they come by his house.

Fredrick will use this loan to buy more charcoal. Sometimes he does not have enough when customers come to buy it. The loan will ensure that he has a complete supply. Fredrick hopes someday to have a big business so that he can pay his children's school fees. His children are not in school now because he does not have the funds.

Someday, Fredrick hopes to buy a motorbike, and to have a motorbike business to supplement his family’s income that way, as well.

K-MET, the NGO providing Fredrick’s loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional micro-finance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya.  For more information about K-MET, click on “About the Field Partner” on the right-hand side of the web page.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
N. Ibrohimjon is 33 years old. He is the loving husband and father of three children. Ibrohimjon has been selling different kinds of paints in the market for the past 6 years. For these years he had acquired the knowledge and skills required for his business. Since Ibrohimjon started his store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with a good service, he is requesting a loan of $1500 USD, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment. With your help Ibrohimjon will get ahead.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Baldé,58 ans, mariée, et des enfants adultes, a 3 ans et demi d'expérience dans le Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 pour y avoir contracté 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. l'objet de son crédit est de développer une activité de vente de tissus teintés. Avec les bénéfices de son commerce elle soutiendra son mari pour l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille

loans.use: Renforcer sos capital

loans.name: Women's Wing Group

texts.en:
The Women’s Wing group is a group of small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, which is in northern Sierra Leone.

The leader of the group is Mabinty G., pictured on the right. Mabinty was born in Makili village in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children. Two of Mabinty’s children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools.

Mabinty has a restaurant where she sells cooked rice, meat, and vegetables. She also has a small box at the corner of her restaurant where she sells cigarettes, mints, matches, biscuits, lollipops, etc. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for more than five years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business.

The Women’s Wing group is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Leone (SLL) in order to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they would be able to add more goods, increase sales, and make better profits. Consequently, they could better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and educating them.

loans.use: To invest in their woman-owned businesses.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maria D. los Ángeles inicia su cuarto ciclo con 21 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, salchipapas, verduras, comidas, golosinas, artesanías, cereales, quesos, ropa, medicamentos.
Sus ventas los realizan en sus casas, en locales alquilados, en mercados D. la ciudad y D. manera ambulatoria.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, carne, cereales, quesos, artesanías.
Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener local estable, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, carne, cereales, quesos, artesanías.

loans.name: Silvia Yessenia

texts.es: Silvia Yessenia C. G. reside en San José Villanueva en el departamento de La Libertad. Silvia tiene 29 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija Andrea de 5 años de edad. Silvia posee su propio negocio con tan solo dos año de experiencia, donde vive Silvia en San José Villanueva es un pequeño cantón donde no hay muchos comercio, ventajas que le permiten mantener sus ventas estables; a pesar que Silvia y su esposo invirtieron sus ahorros para poner su negocio no alcanzaron a cubrir productos necesarios y de gran demanda por sus clientes, es por eso que solicita de un crédito que utilizara para comprar nueva mercadería para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Yessenia C. G. lives in San José Villanueva in the department of La Libertad. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and their daughter Andrea, who is 5 years old. Silvia has managed her business with only two years of experience. San José Villanueva is a small town with few businesses, an advantage that allows Silvia to have steady sales.

Silvia and her husband have invested their savings into their business, so they are not able to buy basic necessities and other products highly demanded by their customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise in order to keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 60 year old businesswoman in Kajiado. She runs a grocery that sells potatoes, onions, sukumawiki (kale), maize, peas, beans and cabbage, among other things. She has been in this business for twenty years and hopes to expand her business and teach her grown up children how to run the business themselves. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy more stock for her stall. A mother to two adult male children, Monica describes herself as hardworking, intelligent and calm.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing them with financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company. This will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: purchasing stock for her stall

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia M. is married, 37 years old, and has 6 school-aged children. Her husband is an employee at PEO (Provincial Engineering Office) and they are currently living at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

In 2004, Lucrecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP as additional capital for selling cosmetic products. This will be her 13th loan through PMPC. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs so she is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.use: purchase cosmetic products to be sold in the neighborhoods

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
La socia EMMA es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijas mujeres. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una  chacra donde cultiva pasto (comida para cuy) y distribuye a señoras que venden en su propio domicilio. La socia también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más semilla y aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda comprando mas comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Emma is a humble mother. She belongs to the Virgen Purificada – Angostura Communal Bank. She is 47, married, and has four daughters. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is south of the city of Cusco. She has a farm where she grows grass (food for guinea pigs), and she distributes it from her own home to the women who sell it. She also has a small grocery store. She has worked in the business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs a loan to buy more seeds and to increase her business capital in the store. She will buy more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more seeds and buy more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet S. is 32 years old. He lives in Lusadzor village, Ijevan area with his wife and two children. Hamlet works as a machine-operator and he works on his farm. He has two cows and three pigs. Hamlet thinks that the most profitable farm work is pig feeding and selling. Hamlet’s works is very hard, and at the same time, it is very profitable. He needs a loan of 800.000 AMD to buy fodder for his farm animals and to buy four or five pigs to fatten and sell. With the future income, he intends to build a big cowshed and pigsty for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder and four or five pigs

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michille B. is from the village of Northern Pob. Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Michille is married and has three young children. To make a living, Michille runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as powder soap for laundry, coffee (in sachets), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Michille has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Michille joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michille is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Michille from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana, de 48 años, hace mucho tiempo ya, sus hijos son independientes y tienen sus propias familias. Ella vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila.
En las afueras de la ciudad se encuentra su horno de ladrillos. Cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para amasar y moldear los ladrillos, los cuales posteriormente hará secar por 10 días y los meterá en su horno. 
Esta actividad le ha generado los ingresos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, es por eso que ella todavía continua realizándola.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus ladrillos y ver que su trabajo es bien recompensado. Lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con el barro, ya que en las temporadas de frió el barro se torna muy helado, haciendo que se enferme y no pueda trabajar normalmente. 
Con el tiempo, desea contratar unos ayudantes para que su negocio aumente su producción y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Damiana con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer sus ladrillos, ya que los que actualmente usa están deteriorados por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Damiana is 48 years old and her children have been independent and have had their own families for a long time. She lives in her own house and what she desires the most is to live in her old age in peace. She has a brick oven located in the outskirts of the city. Each morning she gets up very early to mix and mold the bricks, those of which afterward will dry for 10 days and she will put in her oven. This activity has generated an income for her that allowed her to give the best to her three children. It’s for this reason that she is still doing it. On the other hand, what she likes the most about her job is selling her bricks and seeing that her work is well worth it. She has been doing this for 10 years and she thinks the most difficult thing about it is working with the mud, since in the cold season the mud is very frozen, causing her to get sick and not be able to work normally. This is Damiana’s third loan with MFP. She hopes to be very punctual in her payments, since she does not want to harm the other members of her community bank, where she is very well-liked and respected. With the 500 nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy new molds to make her bricks, since the ones she uses now are deteriorating as time passes.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of molds for bricks

loans.name: Silifat

texts.en:
Silifat is 47 years old, widowed, and has three children. She lost her husband some years ago, and works very hard to care and provide for her fatherless children. To make a living, Silifat sells motorcycle parts in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for some years and is doing fine.
In the future, Silifat hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle parts to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Chhiv's Group

texts.en: Chhiv N., age 38, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is with the agriculture sector of raising animals at home, earning approximately US $5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially her children’s education. She has been in this business since 2000. Her husband is a farmer who earns an income of US $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since N.’s husband started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand his business. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to grow more mushrooms for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: grow more mushrooms for sale

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Lorie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lorie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Lorie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Nubia G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de primaria en la escuela de la comarca San José a unos 5 km de la parte urbana, tiene 25 años de impartir clases a los niños. Ha recibido tres créditos de ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y tener una vida digna. Su último crédito fue solicitado para gastos médicos para realizarse una serie de exámenes para mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Nubia G. is from the El Sauce municipality. She works as a primary school teacher at a school in the San José region, which is 5 kilometers from the urban area. She has been teaching children for 25 years. She has received three loans from Ceprodel. These were to improve her home and to have a decent life. She requested the last loan for medical expenses for a series of exams to improve her health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carla Patricia D. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Analista de Presupuesto  es soltera  y tiene un hijo a su cargo y en edad escolar  habita carretera a León.

La señora Carla Patricia D. lleva ya  tres años trabajando con CEPRODEL  y ha demostrado ser una persona de principios y emprendedora, ella solicito financiamiento para cambiar laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Patricia works for the Chinandega mayor's office as a budget analyst. She is single and has a school-age son in her charge. They live on the highway to León. Carla has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 years and has demonstrated herself to be an enterprising person of principles. She is requesting financing to install rafters and new zinc sheeting for the roof of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RAFTERS AND ZINC SHEETING, AND PAYING FOR INSTALLATION

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma P. is a 37 year old married woman with 6 children, and they all live in Sitio Canalum, Brgy Nangka, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Elma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 2 years now and earns a living by running a networking products business.

She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Juana,  ella tiene 37 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sus últimos hijos tienen 5 años y 8 meses de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende verduras y frutas en el mercado local de la comunidad; La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor para la semana y algunas frutas que llegaron a la comunidad en camiones.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy community bank. Our member lives in the community of Llullucha, in the Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, in Cusco. Our member is Juana. She is 37 years old, is married and has four children. The youngest are 5 years old and 8 months old. Our member alternates her work in the home with retail. She buys and sells produce and fruit in the community's local market. She is requesting a loan to buy produce at wholesale for the week and some fruit that arrived in the community in trucks. She is thankful and values the support provided in this manner and promises to meet her debt payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy produce at wholesale.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.fr: I. Augustine  est née le 01 Septembre 1966 à Porto-Novo capitale administrative du BENIN. Augustine est mariée à KINTOHOUAN Emmanuel un transitaire. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Kpakpakanmè un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, depuis sept ans. Augustine subvient avec son mari aux différents besoins de la famille. Augustine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Augustine  mène comme activité la vente des produits vivriers et des céréales (maïs, mil, haricot, soja, etc.) depuis dix ans. Augustine s’approvisionne à HOUEGBO, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin. Augustine  sollicite un premier  prêt auprès de ALIDé  pour augmenter son  capital et en même temps son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux divers besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
I. Augustine was born on September 01, 1966 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of BENIN. She is married to KINTOHOUAN Emmanuel, a forwarding agent. The couple have five children, all enrolled in school. They have been living in Kpakpakanmè, a district of the town of Cotonou, for seven years. Augustine helps her husband support their family. Augustine never went to school. To support herself, she has been selling groceries and cereals (maize, millet, dried beans, soybeans, etc.) for 10 years. She buys her goods at HOUEGBO, a foodstuffs market in Bénin. Augustine is requesting her first ever loan from ALIDé to grow her working capital and at the same time, her stock of goods, which will allow her to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals (maize, dried beans, soybeans, millet, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two children. In 2000, he opened his own pastries store. His customers come from the surrounding areas.
He is now requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase needed goods for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase needed goods

loans.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira T. was born in Chaldovar (Panfilov region, Kyrgyz Republic), where she still lives. She is 57 years old. She was the third child in a large, low-income family. Because she had to help her mother in the household from early childhood, she left secondary school after the 7th grade. Damira got married at the age of 22. Soon she gave a birth to a son and two daughters. At that time Damira’s husband started breeding sheep. It was not a very profitable activity and additional earnings were required in order to support their family. That’s why, without education and practical knowledge, Damira decided get into sales.

Damira started, as do many people in her situation, selling at a local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts. Starting with a capital of only 2,000 Kyrgyz Som, she managed to multiply her investments within one year. After five years of selling groceries in the market, Damira managed to purchase a sales stall and open up a small grocery store near her house. From this moment the shop became a family business. Her grown up children started to help their mother in the shop. 

In 2009, Damira obtained her first loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Som from Bai Tushum and Partners. She used it to construct a shop on her own land. Her activity started to bring in permanent profit and her clientele increased.

Then a tragic accident happened: her only son had a car accident. He needed expensive medical treatment. At the same time, Damira’s granddaughter was born, which further increased the family’s expenditures.

Damira wants to take a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Som to expand the range of products in her shop. She hopes that this will help her increase her revenue. In the future, Damira plans to buy an apartment for her son in Karabalta and marry her daughters off well. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

loans.use: to purchase flour, vegetables, and household articles

loans.name: Guljamila

texts.en:
Guljamila D. is 58 years old. She lives in Bakai-Ata village, in the heart of Kyrgyzstan, with her family. She has four children; two daughters are married and live with their own families, her elder son lives in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan), and her younger son lives with Guljamila and helps his parents in farming. Guljamila graduated as an accountant and worked in a local market, where she earned a reputation as a punctual, hard working and thrifty woman.

In 2001, however, starting with an initial capital of 30'000 Kyrgyz Soms, Guljamila's family began to cultivate land and grow apple and plum trees. In addition, they started breeding cows, which allowed them earnings from selling the milk. Her husband helps Guljamila in farming and selling their products.

Guljamila will use her loan of 135'000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by buying four cows, fertilizer for her apple and plum gardens, as well as to rent a plot of land to cultivate beans. This will allow her a better harvest next year. Also, she plans to construct a winter barn for her cattle. With the revenues from these investments she will be able to raise her family's living standards.

In the future, Guljamila plans to further augment the number of cattle. To better control the ongoing expansion of her farm, she plans to buy a computer to implement an electronical system of accounting. She also would like to acquire a drying machine to process her apples and plums and the ones of other farmers. The revenues from the current loan will help her achieve these goals.

Bai-Tushum's Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to cultivate land.

loans.name: Hendayen

texts.en: Hendayen R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old, married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Hendayen owns and operates a business selling lumber and wood-related products in the local community. Hendayen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Hendayen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hendayen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional lumber to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Hendayen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional lumber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extraction and sale of coconut oil

loans.name: Patrick Maina

texts.en:
Patrick Maina W. is 27 years old and he supports a family of two. His spouse is Lucy Kemunto, who is a businesswoman contributing an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Patrick is a businessman running an electronic shop in Narok town. He sells electronics, such as mobile phones, and also does some repairs and battery charging. He has been in this business for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD. through a friend who is already a registered member with KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more electronic goods to increase his stock.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another shop.

Patrick’s dream is to become a wholesaler and distributor of electronic goods in Narok town.

He is a hardworking man and with the right resources, he can do great.

loans.use: To buy more electronic goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Day Break Mouth Open Group

texts.en:
Mary M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Day Break Mouth Open. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 18 years, all of whom are in school. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.

For ten years, Mary has been selling biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap, etc., in Duport Road Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 18,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 76,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap, etc.

Mary describes herself as a God-fearing woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Madame Nanou Koné est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville de Koutiala.  
Madame Nanou Koné n’a pas fréquenté l’école (victime de l’époque où les filles n’avaient pas l’assentiment  des parents d’aller à l’école).  Nanou s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus  en l’occurrence le commerce qu’elle appris auprès de sa maman. Elle  s’est spécialisée dans l’achat vente du Sounbala (un condiment alimentaire très prisé en Afrique de l’Ouest) depuis plus de  30 ans. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle et peut vendre plus de 20 cartons dans le mois.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Madame Nanou a décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 ans. Elle a pris 3 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 6 eme prêt individuel dont les cinq précédents ont été payés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 gros paniers de Sounbala avec des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Koutiala. Elle vend à Bamako à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes  et au comptant.
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement du prêt   et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nanou Koné is 54 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lvies in a polygamous family with her husband, her husband’s other wife and their children in the Kouloukoro district of the town of Koutiala.

Mrs. Nanou Koné has not attended school (victim of an age when parents wouldn’t allow their daughters to go to school). Nanou quickly developed an interest in earning a living and learned her trade from her mother. She is purchasing and reselling sounbala (a food condiment very popular in West Africa) for over 30 years. Her business is very popular with customers, and she can sell over 20 boxes per month.

In order to increate her working capital so as to expend her business and meet her clients’ needs, 6 years ago Mrs. Nanou decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. She had taken out three group loans (solidarity loans), all duly repaid; she is now on her 6th individual loan, having repaid the previous five without any issues.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase ten big baskets of sounbala from  village sellers at the big weekly marked at the town of Koutiala. She sells in Bamako, to a coustomer based composed essentially of women, for cash.

She plans to achieve a monthly income of 125,000 West African Francs, which she  intends to use for repaying her loan and contributing to improving the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing sounbala, a traditional condiment

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn T. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old and separated with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Marlyn joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to provide working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and to provide working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Ret Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twenty-six people who live in Preaek Ta Ong Ti Muoy village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sok R. is the village bank president and her age is 62. She has been selected by the other members who will each use their loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Nguon Khut, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice,  not to sell but to support their family. She is also a mat weaver while her husband is a construction worker. 

She faces a problem because it is time to grow crops on her field but she does not have money to support the crops. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sok R. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and gasoline. With any remainder of the loan she is going to hire farming laborers and oxen to plow her field. Through this activity they support three children, two of whom are employed in an organization, while the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and gasoline

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe K. has a family of three children ranging in age from seven to eleven years. He is a resident of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya. Wycliffe does mixed farming, producing milk, tea and maize that he sells in the local market. He has been farming for over ten years and employs three farmhands on his farm.

Wycliffe plans to use his loan to purchase a motor vehicle for transport purposes. He believes his loan will improve his income level and give the family a better standard of living. He holds the opinion that insufficient capital is the main undoing of him and other businessmen and appeals to Juhudi Kilimo to enlighten more people about their loans.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Karen Gissela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Karen, ella tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres, estudio en la Universidad de Manta en donde obtuvo el título de Ing. En Comercio Exterior. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y el compañerismo que hay en el grupo.

Ella desarrolla muchas funciones en su vida diaria tiene una heladería, además de eso trabaja en Ciudad Alfaro, pero este trabajo no le impide que ella se dedique a lo que ella le gusta que es la atención de su negocio, dice que ya tiene su heladería por tres años y que esta le sirvió mucho para sus estudios, con los créditos que ha recibido ha logrado ampliarla y adecuarla cada día mas, en ella trabaja en las tardes y noches, los sábados y domingos trabaja todo el día. Sus productos los compra en Manta y Portoviejo directo de los distribuidores.

Este crédito es para comprar helados, dos mesas y seis sillas para mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Sus sueños son comprar un carro y poder viajar para conocer  muchos lugares.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria Monserrate meets every two weeks in the district of Montecristi.  The region is known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its nationally and internationally renowned artisans. This region is where the famous straw hats come from. 

Here we meet Karen. She is 24 years old, she is single, and she lives with her parents. She went to Manta University where she achieved a degree in International Commerce. This is the third loan cycle in which she has participated together with her community bank. She enjoys partaking for the support and collegiality within the group.

She takes on various jobs in her daily life. She has an ice cream shop, and she also works in the city of Alfaro. But this work doesn't stop her from what she enjoys most: her business. She has had her ice cream shop for three years and it helped her get through her studies. With the loans that she has received she has managed to expand and furnish her business more each day. She works in the afternoons and in the evenings. On Saturdays and Sundays she works all day. She purchases her products in Manta and in Portoviejo directly from the distributors.

This loan will be used to purchase ice cream, two tables and six chairs to improve her service to the clients. Her dream is to purchase a car to be able to travel and see many new places.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth vive en la zona del Plan 3000, vive en casa de sus padres y se dedica al bordado de chinelas con piedras de colores y de fantasía, a pesar de su corta edad es una persona responsable y proactiva que todas las semanas entrega por docena y también por unidad las chinelas que borda, las entrega en la feria de Barrio Lindo, una zona muy comercial que sólo se abre los días miércoles y sábados, lo que le da tiempo entre semana para poder terminar el bordado para cada feria. Cuando tiene demasiado pedido sus hermanas menores le colaboran con el bordado de las chinelas. Ella aprendio este oficio desde hace unos 3 años. Es la segunda vez que accede a un crédito en Emprender, ella necesita del capital para incrementar su mercadería, comprar chinelas, piedras, perlas e hilos, ya que en esta temporada es lo más vende debido a la temporada de calor.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Plan 3000 neighborhood in her parents' house. She embroiders sandals with colored stones and other decorations. Though she is young, she is a responsible, proactive person who sells her sandals by the dozen and also by the pair. She sells her wares at the Barrio Lindo market, a very commercial fair that is only held on Wednesdays and Saturdays, which gives her time to finish her embroidery work before each fair. She learned this trade three years ago. 

This is her second loan from Emprender. She needs the money to increase her merchandise by buying sandals, colored stones, pearls and thread, since this is the season in which she sells the most due to the hot weather.

loans.use: Buy sandals, colored stones, pearls and thread

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Gemma works hard to increase her harvest. She hopes to earn better.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Zoila Amalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila S. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, vive en la comunidad de Pitcadeleg que le pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, hay una gran vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y también mucha de su población sale a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada por un familiar.

Doña Zoila se dedica a la cría de animales como son pollos, cerdos y cuyes, los que vende en su comunidad.

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y este es su crédito 17, el cual lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con este negocio. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila S. is a member of the Zhidmad Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Pitcadeleg which belongs to the parish of Zhidmad. They have a great view of nature. The people of this community raise animals and farm. A lot of its population leaves for the city in search of a better job.

Zoila is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are 10 and 3 years old. Her first daughter goes to a school in the community. Her husband works in construction. They don’t own their own house, which is why they live in a house borrowed from a relative.

Zoila works raising animals such as chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in the community.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and this is her 17th loan, which she will invest in the purchase of chickens to continue this business. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar T. 26 let. On rodilsya i jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Azar ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Azar oknchil shkolu i posle cheqo po nachalu pomoqal svoyemu dyade po rabote v magazine a potom reshil sam nachat rabotat i stal taxistom. 
On uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas Azar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  nujniye zapchasti ldya yeqo mashini.
texts.en: Azar T. is 26 years old. He was born and lives in the city of Baku together with his parents. Azar is not married and does not have children. Azar graduated from high school and at first was helping his uncle with work in the store and later decided to start working as a taxi driver. He has been driving taxi for five years now. At this time Azar needs 2000 AZN to buy the necessary spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the car

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store, selling rice and selling BBQ. She lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1988 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General Store, Rice Retailing and BBQ Vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Betty is borrowing PHP 22,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Betty aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nayme

texts.en:
Nayme is a 27-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  sawali making (woven bamboo mats used for walls), fish vending and a general store.  She lives in the municipality of Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sawali making, fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,800. Nayme is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund the operation of her business.  This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nayme aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives with her husband who is a gardener by profession. They do not have children, and they live at a rental house. Her business is fresh water supply, which she has had for 3 years. She sells water from home to her local residents.

She is requesting a loan because she needs to start another vegetable stall business, and purchase vegetables, fruits, potatoes and onions for sale. This loan will help her expand her business and earn more profits to enable her to meet her family's needs.

Her plan for the future is to use the income from the business to be able to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to start a vegetable stall and to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: Adelaide is 45 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  They live in the Adogleta district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. For the past 15 years, Adelaide has run her stall selling various foods and household goods. This is her eighth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. This loan will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock items to sell

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with two children.  One attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Mwanamkuu faces a major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a more secure business premise in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La señora Asunta tiene 39 años está casada con el señor Alba Sergio, juntos tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 8 años , los cuales están estudiando , son una familia de escasos recursos económicos pero son muy unidos y felices , doña Asunta solo tiene una preocupación cuidar y ayudar a su madre. La madre ya es de tercera edad y está a cargo de la Sra. Asunta. Asunta vive en la comunidad de la maica, la principal actividad de Asunta es la producción de la leche cruda, el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, y el esposo presta sus servicios de mecánica, los dos trabajan para poder salir adelante, el destino del préstamo es para la compra de forraje, ya que se está preparando para la temporada de sequía, para lo cual recolectan mucho forraje.

Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar la cantidad de producción de leche y que sus tres hijos estudien una carrera profesional para tener un mejor nivel de vida
texts.en:
Asunta is 39 years old and she is married to Alba  Sergio. Together they have three children of 16, 13, and 8 years old who are all studying. They are a family of scarce economic resources but are very united and happy. Asunta only has one job, and that is to take care of and help her mother. Her mother is older and Asunta is in charge of helping her. Asunta lives in the community of Maica. Asunta's primary business is production of milk. She delivers the product to a company that makes milk-based products. Her husband works as a mechanic, and the two work to be able to get ahead. The loan will be used to purchase food for the cattle, since they are preparing for the drought season and because of this they collect a lot of food.

Among her dreams and goals is to increase the quantity of milk production and that her three children study a professional career in order to have a better level of life.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina P. lives in the village of Poblacion Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, married and has four grown children. For the last 33 years, she has made a living by selling clothing to people in her community. She earns about 15,300 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Monina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 30,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce sells Fish. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. Only one of her children goes to school.

Joyce borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María tiene 41    años de edad, ella es  casada y reside en casa de padres la cual  esta ubicada en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Chiclayo , dicha zona  cuenta  con  los servicios básicos, como agua y luz y está ubicada a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad.

María, cuenta con negocio en  el exterior de un colegio en el cual se ha instalado con un pequeño puesto de comida al paso el cual atiende en dos turnos  de lunes a viernes, con mas de 03 años de experiencia en el rubro, ella a conseguido clientela fija para su negocio.
