María desea ampliar su negocio comprando un carrito sanguchero (puesto ambulatorio con ruedas, acondicionado para vender papas fritas con pollo) lo cual generará mayores ingresos para su negocio, por consiguiente mejor calidad de vida, gracias a un nuevo ingreso económico, por ello a creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder cunplir su deseo.

María cuenta con buenas referencias,  la describen como una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la  conocen la consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old, married, and lives with her parents which is located in a marginal urban area in the district of Chiclayo.  This area has basic services, such as water and electricity, and it is located 20 minutes from the center of the city.

María has a business outside of a high school where she sells food.  She works there in two shifts from Monday to Friday.  She has more than three years of experience in the field.  She has a loyal customer base for her business.

María wants to expand her business by purchasing a sanguchero cart (a cart with wheels, set up to sell fries with chicken), which will generate more income for her business and therefore give her a better quality of life.  Thanks to a new income, she believed it was appropriate to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to fulfill her desire.

María has good references that describe her as a hardworking woman who makes an effort every day to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  The people who know her consider her a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to purchase a cart with wheels.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 45 años, reside en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana) en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Judith y Luis a los que cuida con mucho amor en una casa alquilada. A pesar de tener muchos inconvenientes en su vida y de luchar con ahínco para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Alejandro se siente feliz de dedicar su vida a la agricultura, principal actividad económica de su familia. Desde hace 8 años trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos de café y plátanos; donde le pagan un promedio de S/. 600 nuevos soles semanales por cultivar, machetear y mantener limpio los sembríos. “No pude obtener mis propios terrenos ya que tenía que invertir todas mis ganancias en mantener a mis hijos”, menciona con mucha nostalgia y a la vez con orgullo. Además de compartir su tiempo en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo (sierra del Perú), donde viaja una vez al mes, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ahora su objetivo principal es poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de saber que obtendrá el apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Alejandro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de su propia casa y si el dinero le alcanza lo invertirá para su negocio de frutas.
texts.en: Alejandro is 45 and lives in the town of Alto Yapaz (in the central Peruvian jungle) with his two children, Judith and Luis, for whom he cares with a lot of love.  They live in a rented house.  In spite of having a lot of inconveniences in his life and working diligently to take good care of his children, Alejandro is very happy dedicating his life to agriculture, which is his family’s main source of economic income.  He has worked for 8 years as a laborer on various coffee and plantain farms.  They pay him an average of 600 PEN a week to plant, cut, and weed these fields.  “I couldn’t get my own land because I had to invest all of my profits into taking care of my children,” he mentioned with a lot of nostalgia and also pride.  He also dedicates time to a business of buying and selling fruits in the wholesale market in Huancayo (in the mountains of Peru), where he travels once a month.  He makes good profits with this business.  His main goal is to give his children a good education.  He belongs to the communal bank, “El Palomar al éxito,” and this will be his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is happy to know that he will obtain financial support to reach his goals.  He promises to make all of his payments on time, like with his previous loans that he has had.  Alejandro will invest the requested money in the construction of his own home, and if he has enough money left, in his fruit business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house and to buy fruit to supply his business.

loans.name: Lluvias De Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan Eduardo es casado, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la albañilería y a la crianza de ganado, vacas y cerdos, inició este trabajo de albañil como ayudante y ahora es albañilería y lleva en este trabajo 7 años de experiencia, y le gusta tener iniciativa para mejorar su condición de vida.

Por lo que decide organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le va a servirá para vacas y cerdos para crianza. Ya que quiere tener una pequeña granja. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la venta de mercería. En la foto aparece una de las socias con su esposo (estan de primero en la foto).
texts.en:
Juan Eduardo is 33 years old and married.  He studied three years at elementary school.  He is in the construction business and also raises cows and pigs.  He started the building work as an assistant and now he is a builder with seven years experience.  He likes to take the initiative in improving his living conditions.

Juan Eduardo decided to form a group so that he could request a loan to buy cows and pigs to raise.  He would like to own a small farm.  The other members of the group raise animals and sell sewing supplies.  In the photo, one of the members appears with her husband (in the front row).

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en:
Behruz lives and works in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan. He is an active and hardworking husband. 

Bejriz is engaged in selling food and daily products. He sells sweets, drinks, sugar, etc. He has been in this business for 6 years and has his own grocery store. Behruz would like to get a loan of 10,500 TJS to purchase more food items in order to increase the assortment of goods in his store and expand his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme. Elle a 04 enfants. 
Ami travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2002. Elle achète les produits au GRAND MARCHE de LOME. Elle travaille avec 02 personnes 
Ami a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, de mais, 03 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Ami is a 42-year-old woman. She is married to a police officer and has four children. She has been working as a restauranteur since 2002. She purchases her goods at the GRAND MARCHE of LOME. She works with two persons. 

Ami has requested a second loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy sacks of rice and corn and 3 containers oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina is 36 years old and married with one child who is in is school. She has a business selling tomatoes, onions and cooking oil in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Santina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old with a business in quarry mining. He is married to Jane. They are blessed with four children. He has been in the business for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to employ labor for stone cutting to improve the stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his last born since the others are self-sustaining. His hope is to purchase another quarry ground, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To employ labor for stone cutting

loans.name: Carmen Fiorella

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Carmen; tiene 25 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad ; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia se dedica  al compra al por mayor de cuyes y luego los vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, la socia también trae  a la ciudad del Cusco a vender en los restaurantes turísticos, el cuy es protagonista de tener una de las mejores carnes con o colesterol y el consumo en la zona sur es de un 80 5; la socia conocedora de las bondades de tan rico potaje cría más de 3 años con sus familia cuyes y en esta ocasión ella lleva independientemente con un numero de 200 cuyes, la socia vendió el mes pasado 100 cuyes y ahora de sea incrementar su corral y comprar 100 cuyes mas para la crianza, la socia también comprar el alimento para los primeras dos semanas para todos los cuyes, la socia desea a futuro hacer su restaurante y dedicarse a la atención y preparación de los potajes en base a cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes en un total de 100.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” which is located in the District of Cachimayo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a seven-year-old son. Carmen is a small merchant who buys guinea pigs in bulk and sells them to different restaurants in the area. She also brings the animals to the city of Cusco to sell to the tourist restaurants. Guinea pigs are known for having one the best types of meat because it is low in cholesterol. The consumption rate of guinea pig in the southern area is 80%. Carmen knows that this meat is good for making rich stews since she has been raising these animals for more than three years. She currently has 200 guinea pigs. Last month, she sold 100 guinea pigs and wants to expand her pens so that she can buy 100 more to raise. Carmen also wants to buy enough feed to last two weeks for all of her guinea pigs. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare and serve stews made from the guinea pig. Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of 100 guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy 100 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es:
Wilber es un señor de 34 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.
Desde hace varios años que Wilber tiene este negocio de actividad agrícola, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.
Actualmente Wilber está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de semillas de maracuyá. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Wilber es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilber is 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and children in a community called Upala de San Carlos, in the province of Alajuela.  In Alajuela there are five national parks, a national wildlife reserve, five protected zones, and several forest reserves.  Also in the province is the Juan Santamaría Museum, which exhibits locally produced crafts.  This area is the top producer of coffee and sugar cane in the country.

Wilber has had his agricultural business for several years.  Right now he has the property that his parents left him, but he lacks the principal for his business to be successful and for his neighbors in the community to benefit.  He says that the project is very interesting to him.

Currently Wilber is requesting a microloan of 500,000 CRC to buy passion fruit seeds, with which he hopes to make his business grow and improve his quality of life as well as that of his family.

Wilber is a member of the Delirio Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and financially, as well as participating actively in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is married and has one child in school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a grocery business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He also operates a retail business which contributes to his income. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge he faces in the business. Antony dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Guijá, provincia de Gaza , sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais todos ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 11ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal Gaza para Maputo em Boane a procura de emprego, é coordenadora dos activistas na area de HIV-SIDA na Assoção PFUCANE ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 11.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (TCHUMA) para o negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para obra da sua casa (areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros).  Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 20.000.00mt, e 25.000.00mt, para concluir a obra da sua casa.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir o murro da sua casa para oferecer mais  segurança a sua familia assim, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Esperanca was born in the district of Guijá, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is unmarried and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She went to school through the eleventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She left Gaza for Maputo, in Boane, to find a job. She has been a coordinator for HIV/AIDS activists in the Assoção PFUCANE for more than five years and earns about 11,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in her bank account.
She's had loans from other banks (Tchuma) for her business, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) to build a house. Her first loans, in the amounts of 20,500 and 25,000 meticals, were both used on the house.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish the wall around her house so she can offer her family more security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) for her house.

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.ru: Гулсифат проживает в районе Джиликул. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кроме того она сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области она 40 лет. Гулсифат 64 года. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и селитры.
texts.en: Gulsifat lives in Dzhilikul region. She is a widow and has five children. She grows vegetables for sale. In addition, she also plants fruit trees. She has been working in this area for 40 years. Guslifat is 64 years old. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Florinda es casada, tiene 27 años , no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica a la zapatería, la elaboración de calzado para hombres, inició este trabajo como operario para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales  consistente en pieles de diferentes colores para producir más calzado, espera en el futuro tener un negocio un mas grande.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Florinda is 27 years old, married and never had the opportunity to study. She has 3 children, 1 of whom studies. She is a cobbler, making men's shoes and started out working for another business. Up until now has 2 years experience.

She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials comprising of different coloured leather skins with which to make more shoes. She hopes in the future to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres con ganas de progresar y salir adelante unieron esfuerzos y de allí surgió la formación del comité llamado 8 de diciembre, el cual se encuentra en su tercer ciclo. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades juntas para que de esa forma puedan fomentar el compañerismo entre ellas.
Una de ellas es la señora Lucia, quien se dedica al reciclado de botellas, latas, plásticos y demás tipos de materiales, nos dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pues recorre las calles buscando los materiales que recicla. Comenta que su trabajo le enorgullece mucho pues es muy honrado. Ella quiere seguir con su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de botellas, cartones y demás, los cuales venderá por cantidad y tendrá una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Sixteen women who want to progress and move forward have joined their efforts to form a committee called December 8th, which is in its third loan cycle. All of the members have independent business activities, but they also participate in joint projects that help build camaraderie among them.

One of the members is Sra. Lucia. She recycles bottles, cans, plastics, and other types of materials. Lucia says that her work requires great sacrifice because it requires that she walk along the streets in search of recyclable materials. She says that she is proud of what she does because it is very honorable work. Lucia wants to continue with her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy bottles, cardboard, and other materials that she can sell in large quantities as a way of earning more income.

loans.use: to buy bottles, cardboard, and other materials.

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite la localité de Rutegama de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle est vendeuse de bière locale depuis 9 ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6 è année primaire. Elle est mariée à Abraham, lui aussi commerçant de bière industrielle et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 3 étudient.
Son  crédit Kiva de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de bière locale  à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TUGUMANE
texts.en:
Joselyne is a 27-year-old shopkeeper who lives in the village of Rutegama in the province of Gitega in the middle of the country. She has been selling local beer for nine years, a profession which she started when she was a farmer. She went to school until the sixth year of primary school. She is married to Abraham, who is also a shopkeeper of industrial beer. They have six children together of whom three go to school. 

Her loan of 120,000 Burundian francs will help her to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of local beer to resell, in order to make large profits and increase her savings. 

She is a member of the community group Tugumane.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of local beer to resell, in order to make large profits and increase her savings.

loans.name: Samiarah

texts.en:
Samiarah is 37 years of age and married with four children. Two of her children are still in school.  She is grateful because her husband is helping her in managing their clothing business.

Samiarah has been in the clothing business for almost ten years. With her determination in life, she would like to increase her sales and buy stock of clothings for kids,mens and women but her capital is not enough.For this reason, she is asking for a loan P50,000. This amount would really help her in obtaining her goal in life. She hopes that she could improve their living conditions and earn more income to educate her children.

Samiarah believes that she could be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock clothings for her clothing business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 51-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been selling tomatoes in an open air market for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced to it by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy tomatoes for her stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Jitahidi Ilela Group

texts.en:
Anna is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, one attending secondary education. She has been growing maize, beans and coffee for over 10 years. She is earning low income in crop production due to crop diseases and a lack of fertilizers.

Anna would like to find working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. She would also like to expand the scale of production in the next five years from 5 to 13 acres with the expectation of earning more income that can be utilized to purchase clothes, build a better house and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Karezi

texts.en:
Karezi is a married father of two children who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a carpentry shop, which he started ten years ago through savings from casual jobs. He has continued to supply finished wood products to customers in his local community. 

Karezi was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase timber, a smoothing plane and other machines. His main challenge is bad debts and the high cost of transportation. His sights are set on owning a large store or factory in the future that deals in woodwork, and on owning other carpentry shops.

Karezi believes the loan will help him meet his clients’ demands on time. He will use the extra income obtained through the loan to invest in his family's future needs and also pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber, a smoothing plane and other machines for woodwork.

loans.name: Karina Alejandra

texts.es:
Karina Alejandra esta casada, tiene un hijo de tres años. Ella trabaja como enfermera y también tiene un puesto donde vende frutas en un mercado y a demás vende colchas por catalogo. Ella tiene su puesto de frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, y esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio y poder vender más. 
Karina es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que además de su puesto, trabaja como enfermera en emergencias haciendo guardias en las noches.
texts.en:
Karina Alejandra is married and has a three-year-old son. She works as a nurse, has a market stall selling fruits, and also sells bedspreads out of a catalogue. Karina has had her fruit and vegetable stall for seven years and is applying for a loan in order to stock up her business to be able to sell more.

Karina is a very hard-working person as, as well as her stall, she is also an ER nurse working nightshifts.

loans.use: to buy fruits and bedspreads to sell.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
41 year-old Adalat is a father of 2 children. Adalat is a refugee from the occupied Jabrayil region of Azerbaijan who lives in a worker\\\'s hostel in Sumqayit city. 

In 2000 he decided to try his hands in small-scale business and started selling greenery right in front of his hostel. Thus he launched greenery sale business.   

With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly meet his family\\\'s needs. To this end in 2004 Adalat borrowed $500 from Norwegian Microcredit. Due to this opportunity he opened vegetable counter in the central market of Sumgayit city, expanded his business and thus considerably improved his welfare. 

Today when his business is a success, this refugee-turned-entrepreneur intends to open a fruit section of his counter, increase his incomes and finally build his own house. Therefore he applies for the loan of $800. In his belief this will enable him to meet his family’s needs better and make his dream for own house a reality.   He looks ahead with hope and thinks he’s in good capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Adalat will use this loan for opening a fruit counter

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: During all his professional life Ivan S. had been working as a driver. But in 2001 he and his wife lost their jobs. Then he started own business. Ivan rented a hall and using  his wife’s professional experience he started a small confectionary workshop. Ivan’s special products are biscuit cakes. Production is not so large but is sufficient for Ivan and his family. Now Ivan needs a $ 1200 loan to buy a new special oven and to increase the variety of candies that he produces.

loans.use: To buy a new special oven

loans.name: Epifania  Pablina

texts.en:
Epifania is 35 years old, is married, and has 5 children. Her husband is a mason. Epifania raises chickens and pigs, which she sells in the city market. She spends a lot on feed for the animals, such as corn and vegetables. She needs the loan to buy more feed. She belongs to the “Palms Group 1.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

EPIFANIA TIENE 35 AÑOS, CASADA 5 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL.ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y PUERCOS LOS CUALES VENDE POSTERIORMENTE EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD ELLA GASTA EN LA COMPRA DE ALIMENTO COMO MAIZ Y VERDURAS POR LO TANTO NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS ALIMENTACION PARA SUS ANIMALES. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO PALMAS 1

loans.use: To buy feed for poultry and livestock

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en: Zahara lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a carpet weaver. She recently started this business and she needs money to complete the purchase of all her materials. She wants to take a group loan to buy new looms. She wishes to work hard and export carpets to different places in Afghanistan to attract more clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy new looms

loans.name: Ni Luh Wiliani

texts.id:
With an initial capital of Rp.1,000,000 (about $109), Ni Luh Wiliani started her business in pig farming. Wiliani bought 1 female pig to breed. She has to spend at least Rp.10,000 (about $1) daily for feeding the pig and she also has to spend Rp.20,000 (about $2) for her daily family expenses. As Wiliani has 2 children who are still studying at school and her husband’s income as a farmer is not always reliable, she uses the pig farming business to support the family. She gets Rp.700,000 (about $76) of profit per 6 months. 1 piglet usually can be sold for Rp.150.000 (about $16) to Rp.175.000 (about $19) and 1 female pig usually can give birth to 5 to 10 piglets. Wiliani is very glad to get the loan from DINARI because she can use the loan to add 6 more growing pigs and she hopes that the business is getting better and more profitable.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan modal awal sebesar 1 juta rupiah, Ni Luh Wiliani memulai usahanya beternak babi.Wiliani membeli 1 ekor Induk babi untuk dipelihara .Setiap hari biaya yang harus dikeluarkan sebesar Rp.10.000 hanya untuk pakan babi saja.Sedangkan biaya rumah tangga rutin harus dikeluarkan sebesar Rp.20.000 setiap harinya.Karena penghasilan suami sebagai seorang petani tidak menentu,sedangkan Wiliani mempunyai 2 orang anakyang masih bersekolah yang harus ditanggung, maka dengan usaha beternak babi ini dapat menopang biaya rumah tangganya.Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari beternak babi ini Rp. 700.000 setiap 6 bulan sekali karena setiap 6 bulan sekali Induk ini baru mempunyai anak yang sudah siap dijual.Satu ekor biasanya laku Rp.150.000-Rp.175.000 dan untuk 1 induk babi biasanya bisa melahirkan anak 5 sampai 10 ekor. Wiliani sangat bersyukur sekali atas pinjaman yang diberikan oleh DINARI. Karena melalui pinjaman ini Wiliani bisa membeli 6 ekor bibit untuk penggemukan ,dengan harapan usahanya ini semakin maju dan hasil yang diperolehpun lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To add more growing pigs and pig's food

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. I. Somaly was married in 1983 and has 3 children: one son and two daughters. She started her grocery business in 2001. Her two daughters work at the garment factory. Only her son is in primary school in the village. Her husband is a government official, and he is currently working in the Ministry of Social Affairs, Veteran and Youth Rehabilitation.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $400. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her stock so that she can expand her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Graciela's Group

texts.es:
Severo, Graciela and Angélica are partners of the Sumaq Ayllu Community bank. Sumaq Ayllu is a quechua word which means “pretty family”.

At their Community Bank, they have learned about responsibility, honesty, punctuality and most important, how to save. Angelica had been partner of another Community Bank before and with her savings, she bought merchandise and later on she could build her house.

They all do different activities. Graciela and Severo buy cereals and vegetables that they sell during the carnivals/markets of the region. Moreover, Graciela owns 2 cars that she uses for public transportation. Angelica tailors clothes, also makes clothes to dress the saints at the church, makes typical dolls (huamanguinas) and other handcrafts.

Their loans are respectively of 600 soles (200 usd), 1250 soles (425 usd) and 600 soles (200 usd) that they will invest purchasing cereals, potatoes, cloth, thread, sequins and toys to sell during the Christmas period.

Severo and Angélica will use their savings for the graduation and university admission of their respective kids and to expand their business. Graciela dreams about having a transportation company, and covering all the needs of her kids so they can learn a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, Angélica y Severo son socios del Banco Comunal Sumaq Ayllu, palabra quechua que significa “Bonita Familia”.

En su Banco Comunal han aprendido la responsabilidad, la honestidad, la puntualidad y sobre todo a ahorrar. Angélica anteriormente fue socia en otro Banco Comunal y con los ahorros que reunió pudo comprar sus artefactos e hizo su casa.

Las actividades que realizan son distintas, Angélica confecciona prendas D. vestir, muñecas huamanguinas, manualidades y ropa para santos. Por otro lado Severo y Graciela compran y venden cereales y verduras que venden en las diferentes ferias D. la zona. Además Graciela tiene 2 carros que hacen servicio D. transporte público.

Sus Préstamos son D. 600 soles, 1250 soles y 600 soles respectivamente que serán invertidos en la compra D. cereales, papa, olluco, telas, hilos, lentejuelas y juguetes para vender en la campaña naviD.ña.

Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la titulación D. su hijo, ingreso a la universidad e incrementar su negocio. Los sueños que tienen son tener una empresa D. transporte, sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Severo, Graciela and Angélica request $200, $425 and $200 usd respectively, that they will invest purchasing cereals, potatoes, cloth, thread, sequins and toys to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.pt:
Jose Alberto M. didn't officially marry, but he lived with a woman with whom he had three children. José is retired from the Mozambican Armed Forces. He contributed his youth so that the country could consolidate the victories gained with Independence in a climate of peace and harmony among Mozambicans. In this process of civil war that occurred in the country, he lost a leg, making him disabled.

Despite this, José didn't lose heart, neither did he let himself become depressed, and much less consider himself disabled. To the contrary--he rolled up his sleeves and went to fight. The fight to secure daily bread for his family. Because his disability pension that he gets from the Ministry of Defense isn't sufficient to sustain his family, he decided to enroll in the FDM credit program to be able to benefit from a loan. This is how he came to buy clothing in Maputo and sell them in one of the markets in the city of Xai-Xai.

Unfortunately, his wife, not contenting herself with a disabled husband, robbed him of some of his goods and left him and the children, still young. This was two years ago. At the moment, José isn't thinking of finding another wife. He says he has strength to raise the children alone. Still, it's possible in the medium-term future that he'll consider finding a companion. But he would be really careful to choose the one that would become his future wife and mother of his children, to not fall into the same trap he fell into the first time. But despite this, José is convinced that life shouldn't stop, that the only path is forward.

He travels twice a month to Maputo in order to buy clothes and sandals for his stall. On the first trip he bought clothing worth 3000 meticais, and on the second trip, clothing worth 1500, as it was to replenish stock. In the future, if the business goes well, he's thinking of improving his home using conventional building materials, as it is currently made of wood and stucco.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Jose Alberto M., nao casou oficialmente, mas vivia com uma mulher com quem teve 3 filhos. Jose e desmobilizado das Forcas Armadas de Mocambique. Ele contribuiu com a sua juventude para que o Pais pudesse consolidar as conquistas alcancadas com a Independencia num clima de paz e harmonia entre os Mocambicanos. Nesse processo de guerra civil que gracou o Pais ele ficou sem uma perna o que lhe relegou a uma posicao de deficiente fisico.

Apesar disso Jose nao desanimou, e nem se deixou abater muito menos considerar-se invalido. Antes pelo contrario arregacou as mangas e foi a luta. Luta para garantir o pao de cada dia para o seu agregado familiar. Pelo facto de a sua pensao de invalidez que ele recebe do Ministerio de Defesa nao ser suficiente para sustentar sua familia, ele resolveu entrar para o programa de credio do FDM para poder se beneficiar de um emprestimo. Assim ele passou a comprar roupa em Maputo e a vende-la num dos mercados da cidade de Xai-Xai.

infelizmente a sua esposa certamente nao se contentando em ter um marido deficiente fisico, roubou-lhe alguns bens e abandonou-o a ele e aos filhos ainda menores. isto faz 2 anos. Neste momento Jose nao pensa em arranjar outra mulher. Diz ele que tem forcas para criar os filhos sozinho. Todavia e possivel que num futuro a medio prazo pensa em arranjar uma companheira. Mas ele tera muito cuidado ao escolher aquela que vira a ser a futura esposa e mae de seus filhos, para nao cair no mesmo engodo em que caiu pela primeira vez. Mas apesar disso Jose esta convicto que a vida nao deve parar. a frente e que deve ser o caminho.

Ele viaja duas vezes por mes para Maputo afim de comprar roupa e chinelos para a sua banca.Na primeira viagem ele compra roupa correspondente a 3.000,00 Mt e na segunda viagem compra roupa correspondente a 1500,oo, pos que e para reforcar o stock. No futuro se o negocio correr bem ele pensa em melhorar a sua residencia usando material convencional pois que agora a casa e de paua pique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and sandals in Maputo for resale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
For 4 years now, Carlos has been peddling tickets for a lottery named ‘raspaditas’ and other lotteries in the most frequented streets of Managua, markets, banks and malls. He begins selling at 7:00 a.m. and travels through the streets all day in search of people who like to try their luck and that are fans of the lotteries named ‘raspaditas’ and ‘chalupa’. The income generated by this activity is very varied. This line of work is very hard, since he runs many risks such as being mugged, and he does not have a set locale where he can sell his product. He does all this due to having 2 small children to maintain and support. This is his only option for work at the moment. However, his hindrance is his inability to purchase all the lottery numbers and offer variety to his clients. This is why he requests a loan to buy lottery tickets ending in the numbers zero through nine and not pass up customers or sales, and to increase his income which is what he maintains his family with.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Carlos desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender de manera ambulante una lotería llamada raspaditas y billetes de loterías en las calles más transitadas de Managua, mercados, bancos y centros comerciales, su venta inicia a las 7: 00 a.m., todo el día recorre las calles en busca de personas que les gusta probar suerte y que sean fanáticos de comprar loterías, raspaditas y chalupa. Los ingresos generados por esta actividad son muy variados. Este tipo de trabajo es muy duro, ya que corre muchos riesgos como que lo asalten, él no cuenta con un lugar fijo en el que pueda vender su producto. Todo esto lo realiza debido a que tiene 2 hijos pequeños a quien mantener y sacar adelante, esta es la única opción de trabajo con la que cuenta en estos momentos. Sin embargo su limitante es que no tiene capacidad para comprar todos los números de loterías y tener variedad para sus clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar números de loterías del cero al nueve y no dejar ir clientes, ventas y aumentar sus ingresos que es con lo que mantiene a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Budumuli East A A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma M.. She is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to open up another branch. Fatuma is 25 years old and is married. Her husband has a phone accessories shop. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 125000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add stock to the kiosk and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Zamu W., Fatuma B., and Teopista N.. Prossy N. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs. Zamu W. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge and start selling cold drinks. Fatuma B. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase a fridge. Teopista N. is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to add more groceries.

loans.use: To open up another kiosk and expand business

loans.name: Salelologa Sapulu Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 3 women of Salelologa Sapulu on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Vasati P., 42, is divorced with 3 children. She has over 2 years experience in sewing. She sews t-shirts, uniforms and puletasis (dresses). Her loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine, material, thread and other items. She will sell her clothing 5 days per week.

Tiotala S., 56, is married with 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman and a farmer. She has over 3 years of experience farming taro. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, and 2,000 taro roots.

Sina M., 67, is married with 6 children. Her husband is unable to work because of sickness. She is helping her son start a hair salon. With her loan, she will purchase clippers, scissors, a comb, a mirror, shelves, and a chair.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, material, thread, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has spent many years working in different industries. The need to provide for four children has provided her with the drive to better her families situation. To this end, one year ago, Olga opened a billiard hall in her home. She manages this as a healthy place of entertainment.

Olga’s hope is to fix up her home and the billiard hall in order to create a more attractive space and bring in more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Olga, trabajó durante muchos años en diversos negocios y la urgencia de sostener a sus 4 hijos era la fuerza de mayor razón que la empujaba a salir de su situación. Es así que desde hace 1 año abrió un billar en su propia casa, un centro de diversión sana, que ella administra. Su deseo es mejorar su espacio de trabajo e implementarlo para hacerlo más llamativo a fin de albergar mayores visitas.

loans.use: Repair and improve the billiard hall.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik has run a dairy business for 10 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. Malik was born in 1956. He is married and has 2 children. He needs a loan of $750 to buy a cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Suban

texts.pt:
Suban I. is a native of Maputo, married, and the father to a one-year-old son. He has provided for himself for 10 years since he moved out of his parents' home.

He studied until the 12th grade and has been an english professor for 3 years. Besides teaching classes he is a businessman with an establishment and one employee. He keeps the hours of 7:00am through 7:00pm. He taught himself and committed to the business three years ago. His best selling products are cookies. He has a daily income of 600MT.

This is the second loan through Hluvuku and his first loan with Kiva. He used the first loan to purchase merchandise and he will use this loan for the same. With this loan he will grow the volume of his business.

In the future Suban intends to request another loan to open a Teka Way. He will try to maintain the business and expand to permit employing more people.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Suban I. natural de Maputo e casado, pai de um filho com um ano de idade, a dez anos que é responsavel da sua pessoa, isto é, que vive fora da casa dos pais. Suban I. estudou até 12ªclasse e é professor de ingles a 3 anos. Para alem de dar aulas é comerciante com um estabelecimento e um empregado, com um horario das 7:00h as 19;00h. Aprendeu sozinho e a 3 anos que se dedica a este negocio. O produto que tem mais saída é bolachas. tem um rendimento diário de 600,00mt. Este é o segundo empréstimo do Suban na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro usou para compra de mercadoria e este também vai comprar mercadoria. Com emprestimo vai aumentar o volume do negocio. No futuro Suban pretende pedir outro emprestimo para abrir um Teka Way. Tentar manter o negocio actual e desenvolver o mesmo para permitir empregar mais pessoas.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi T. was born in 1979 in Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her main business is selling bread in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. Her primary suppliers are bakers and often she buys bread on credit and sells it before reimbursing her lenders. She has benefited from one loan through WAGES and is requesting this second loan in order to make purchases in cash so that she can earn a good income.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Adjovi est né en 1979 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pain dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Ses principaux fournisseurs sont les boulanger et souvent elle achète du pain à crédit et le revend avant de rembourser son créancier. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter au comptant afin de pouvoir gagner un bon revenu.

loans.use: Purchasing bread

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hồi năm nay 31 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều kinh doanh hoa quả tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy hoa quả tại các đại lý lớn về để chị bán lại cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ tại chợ huyện và phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu thụ của bà con địa phương. Ngoài một cửa hàng hoa quả lớn bán tại chợ gia đình chị còn bán hàng trực tiếp cho người tiêu dùng tại nhà. Vì thế để phục vụ tốt nhu cầu của khách hàng gia đình chị phải thuê một nhân công chuyên vận chuyển hàng hoá cho các cửa hàng. Để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình ngoài thời gian bán hàng chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà tại nhà. Với nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ kinh doanh 4.000.000đ/ tháng và nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị Hội là một trong những hộ gia đình có kinh tế khá tại thôn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh hoa quả.
texts.en:
Ms. H. is 31 years of age. She has two children who are school-age. Presently, she and her husband does business selling fruits and produce at the local market. Everyday her husband picks up fruits and produce from the bigger businesses in bulk to bring home to sell to the locals in her community. Besides selling fruits and vegetables at her home, she also sells them at the local market. To provide better service, she also hired an extra hand to help deliver her products directly to her customers. To increase her family’s income, she also raises pigs and chickens at home. Her present income is 4.000.000d/month in which she received from her business; not to include the income from raising farm animals. Her family is considered one of the successful family in her town. This next loan, she is requesting a loan of 20.000.000d to continue to invest in her fruits and vegetables business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr:
Mariée à un mécanographe, Madame  M. Afi Enyonam est née le 21 juin 1974 Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Yoto. Elle a un enfant et a pour activité la vente des produits cosmétiques et de bijoux. Elle s’est installée à Lomé depuis 2004 et vend de quartier en quartier. Son stock est composé de parfums, de lait, de savons et de bijoux. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 10 cartons de pommades, 8 cartons de parfums et 35 bijoux afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi Enyonam M. was born on June 21, 1974 in Mission Tové in the prefecture of Yoto. She's married, has one child, and sells cosmetics and jewelry. She settled in Lomé in 2004 and sells from neighborhood to neighborhood. Her stock is composed of perfumes, beauty milks, soaps and jewelry. She already benefited from a loan that she repaid without problems. She's now seeking this second loan to resupply her stock in order to better meet customer demand. She intends to buy 10 boxes of ointment, 8 boxes of perfume, and 35 pieces of jewelry.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou K., 51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba. Elle veut acheter et revendre des thioub (tissus teintés) et de l’huile de palme pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou K. is 51 years old, married and is responsible for 7 children. She is a member of the village bank Samba.

She wants to buy and resell thioub (hand-dyed cloth) and palm oil to strengthen her business. Her income allow her to help with the family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single repayment. 

 Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of hand-dyed cloth, and palm oil.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank.  He is 41 years old and married with six children. Eusebio sells natural remedies and medicinal herbs that he prepares at home.  He learned the trade by working for a natural remedy business in Lima, and he sells his wares on foot in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Eusebio also travels to different local villages to buy alpaca wool.  Eusebio needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy alpaca wool.  His dreams are to get ahead in life, to save enough to provide for himself in old age, and to own a home to rent out. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Eusebio es socio del Banco Comunal Florecer. 
Eusebio es casado, tiene 41 años y 6 hijos, Eusebio vende remedios naturales, hierbas medicinales, que prepara el mismo en su casa, actividad que aprendió cuando trabajaba en una empresa de medicamentos naturales en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Eusebio viaja a distintos pueblos de la zona en donde compra fibra de alpaca. 
Eusebio necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fibra de alpaca. 
Los sueños de Eusebio son salir adelante, tener suficientes ahorros para su vejez y una casa para alquilar.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool from local villages

loans.name: Heyzel

texts.es:
Con un pequeño monto que le prestó ADIM esta joven mujer instaló su taller de costura en la casa de sus padres.  Heyzel  aprendió a coser desde niña, aprendió en un taller de una amiga de su mama, por ser de escasos recursos económicos esta joven y  su familia no tenia recursos para comprarle la máquina. Conoció a ADIM, por recomendaciones de una vecina que es clienta, opto por el crédito individual  del cual entró en su primer ciclo de crédito y lo pago con un excelente record crediticio, en la actualidad  va por su segundo ciclo. 
Heyzel considera que haber podido iniciar su microempresa ha sido una de las cosas mas importantes que le han pasado pues está segura que poco a poco va a poder avanzar ingresando a nuevos ciclos con montos mayores. Tener su propio taller es un sueño de esta joven que se comienza a realizar, ampliarlo cada día es una meta que está segura de alcanzar con trabajo, disciplina, voluntad y ahorro. 
Ha participado  en los talleres de capacitación, que adim le ha brindado y  ha  aplicado en su negocio lo aprendido.
texts.en:
As a young girl, Heyzel learned to sew in the workshop of a friend of her mother. Unfortunately, her family did not have the resources to buy her a sewing machine. She heard about Kiva's partner ADIM from a neighbor and, with the help of a small loan, Heyzel was finally able to set up a sewing workshop in her parents' home. Heyzel was granted an individual loan and repaid it on time. She is now requesting a second loan.

Heyzel believes starting her own small business is one of the most important things that has happened to her. She is sure that little by little she will be able to earn more and be eligible to borrow more money. She is beginning to realize her dream of having her own workshop, and expanding her business every day is a goal that she is sure to reach with hard work, discipline, willpower, and savings.

Heyzel has participated in ADIM's training workshops, and has applied what she has learned to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business until she has a large workshop

loans.name: El

texts.en: El C. is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a cleaner at a hospital and gets paid $70 a month. Her husband (pictured) makes $7 a day as a sculptor. They have two children, one is a student and the other is married but still lives at home. The married child has a business washing motorbikes at the market. Mrs. El C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more washing tools for her child's business.

loans.use: To purchase more washing tools.

loans.name: Gherman

texts.en: Gherman S. is from the Calarasi district. Gherman is married and has two children. Her husband left the country 5 years ago to look for work abroad with the hope that he would be paid much better. But S. remained here with her children and she is responsible for maintaining the household. S.'s children often help their mother with some of the farming work. She would like a loan from MicroInvest to buy seeds and expand her business of growing vegetables and grain.

loans.use: to buy vegetable and grain seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 51 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and cooked foods. She needs the loan amount of N130,000 to purchase one deep freezer to enable her to sell cold drinks to her customers. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Olatunbosun

texts.en: Olatunbosun is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes. She has the advantage of customers' buying clothes from her shop, while she will also sew it for them. In this way, Olatunbosun increases her productivity and profitability and she is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. Olatunbosun has been in this business for the past 8 years. She needs the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes and one industrial sewing machine. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
A small-size wooden house and a store located in Phnom Penh belong to Mrs. C. and two other family members.

To earn a living, C. runs a small business by selling breakfast foods to the neighbors. She can earn approximately $3 each day. For another source of income, her husband drives a trailer-motor taxi. 

C.'s husband is facing difficulty in his business activities, because the motorbike needs frequent repairs. Thus, C. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase a trailer motorcycle to replace the old one. The loan will help them attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer motorcycle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma J. is 44 years old and has seven children. She is a rice grower and tills her 1-hectare farm along with her husband to feed and clothe her family. When her children are not in school, they help Gemma in the farm. She wants to teach her children the value of hard work, which is important not only in house-hold chores but also at work. She requests a loan to buy four sacks of urea, seeds and herbicides. She is also interested in looking at other possible activities to augment her income.

Gemma appreciates CEVI’s effort in reaching out to so many people to help them start their business. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of urea, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Genita Luís Domingos

texts.pt:
Genita Luís Domingos S. é natural de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 7 filhos com idade entre o mais velho tem 27 anos e o mais novo tem 8 anos e estuda na 8ªclasse. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Genita estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira da sua família. Genita a 10 anos que vive na base de negocio que consiste na venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos ovos que compra a caixa por 480,00mt e vende por 650,00mt. Tendo assim um rendimento mensal liquido 3500,00mt e poupa 1000,00mt.

Genita solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Tem planos futuros que conta com o credito a construção de mais um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Genita Luís Domingos S. is a native of Maputo. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 8 and attending 8th grade. She only supports her family.

Genita attended school through 7th grade and stopped due to her family's financial circumstances. For 10 years, Genita has earned her living from her business, selling various products, particularly eggs. She buys them for 480 meticais per box and sells them for 650 meticias. She has a monthly profit of 3500 meticais and saves 1000 meticais.

Genita is requesting a loan for the first time through Hluvuku and Kiva, with which she plans to increase her stock. She has future plans to use aloan to build another commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel F. is a farmer. He grows rice to be able to provide for the needs of his family. Ariel is 25 years old this year. He has been tilling land for three years already. Because of his farm, he has been able to pay the school fees and for other expenses in their home. 

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will help him improve and develop his business even more. 

CEVI has been providing financial services to the poor. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Mensah

texts.en: Mensah G. is 44 years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader. Mensah is also a trader. He trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. Mensah also treks to other markets to sell. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Atsu M. est cultivateur du riz à Avetonou. Agé de 49 ans, il est marié et père de 5 enfants. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des engrais pour accroître son rendement et aussi engager des métayers pour élargir son espace cultivable. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Atsu M. is a rice grower in Avetonou. He is 49 years old, married, and the father of five. He would like to use this loan to buy fertilizers to increase his yields and also to hire sharecroppers, in order to expand his arable land. He is counting in this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lustica

texts.en:
Lustica is a member of the Bingwa borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 36-year-old woman, is single, and is the mother of three children aged 22, 19 and 14 years.

Three years ago, Lustica started her own cafe business selling food. She works fifteen hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Lustica’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice, wheat and sugar. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lustica hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat and sugar

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and she is married to Melecio. Nenita and her husband manage a vegetable farm and vending business in their rural village of Banquero, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Sending her children to school is very costly, but they are doing their best to provide for the needs of their children and to achieve their ambitions in life.  

To fulfill her dream, she is now asking to borrow PHP 5,000 for their vegetable production and sales business. Nenita is hoping that lenders will give her the chance to improve their enterprise for the sake of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Juana Claudia

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Juana es casada, tiene 59 años y 9 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, productos que venD. en el mercado señor D. arequipa, además Juana venD. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo y maíz.
Juana sueña con construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo y maíz.

loans.name: Mugomeh Group

texts.en:
This is A. M., Yankuba A. and Ismail C.. They call their group Mugomeh, a Mende phrase meaning “Let’s meet together”. This will be their first loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,400,000 to enable them boost their businesses.

A. M. (right) is the leader of this group. A. is thirty-four years of age. He was born in a village called Shengeh, Moyamba district, southern Sierra Leone. He is married with three children – one is in class one and the other is not of school going age. A. sells used shoes and has been doing business for fifteen years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Didier Boanerge

texts.es: El señor Didier Boanerges B. tiene la edad de 44años habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa, eh hijos, la esposa de él trabaja como docente para poder cubrir con los gastos del hogar, lo planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, agradece a la institución por la confianza y el buena aprobación de su segundo préstamo ya que son muchos los que se benefician con estos financiamiento. Los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de reconstruir su vivienda ya que en la que habita actualmente es de madera, y hasta esta hay parte que esta en mal estado pero gracias a Afodenic va a poder realizar su proyecto y poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia
texts.en:
Señor Didier Boanerges B. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. His wife works as a teacher in order to cover the household expenses. He plans to improve the quality of life for his family, and is thankful to the institution for its confidence and for the approval of his second loan since there are many who will benefit from this financing. He plans to finish rebuilding his home, given that the one they live in currently is made of wood and part of this is in disrepair. Thanks to AFODENIC, he will be able to complete his project and have a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es: Andrés M. F. tiene 19 años, soltero, y vive con su madre y 5 hermanos. Su familia tiene una finca y ellos cultivan cafe y matienen pasto. Todo la familia trabaja en la finca y su madre tiene una pulpería. Ahora ellos no estan usando el pasto entonces él quiere un prestamo para crecer y mejorar la finca. Las vaccas son para carne y quisiera a continuar comprando y vendiendo vaccas para apoyar sus hermanos y los 9 hijos de sus hermanos. Es su primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR pero su madre ha tenido un otro prestamo de FUDECOSUR para la pulpería. La hermana de Andrés es la sectretaría del comité y esta aparecido en la foto.
texts.en:
Andrés M. F. is 19 years old, single and lives with his mother and 5 siblings. His family has a farm and then grow coffee and maintain a pasture. The whole family works on the farm and his mother has a grocery story. Now they are not using the pasture, so he wants a loan to grow and improve the land. The cows are for meat and he wants to continue to buy and sell cows to support his siblings and his 9 nieces and nephews. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, but his mother has had another loan from the same institution for her grocery store. Andrés' sister is the secretary of the commission and appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 cattle

loans.name: Grupo Esperanza Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 11 personas el cual viven a 60 kilómetros de la cabecera de Totonicapán Guatemala, cuentan con un grupo con el fin de solicitar un préstamo para aumentar el capital de trabajo, varias de ellas se dedican a la venta de Relojes, como también a la crianza de animales como ganado Bobino, en su mayoría son de familias de escasos recursos económicos y para poder apoyar a  sus esposos económicamente tienen que emprender varias actividades y de esa manera poder vender sus productos a lugares circunvecinos del lugar de Guatemala, para todas las señoras  es importante el apoyo del préstamo que solicitan en la Asociación ASDIR.
texts.en:
This is a group of 11 persons who live 60 kilometers from the municipal capital of Totonicapán Guatemala. This group is requesting a loan to increase their working capital. Several of them sell watches, and members of the group also raise livestock such as cows. The majority have families with few economic resources, and in order to support their husbands economically they have to undertake various activities; they are able to sell their products in surrounding areas within Guatemala. For all of the women, the loan that they are requesting and the support provided by the ASDIR Association is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase business capital

loans.name: Majnunbek

texts.ru: Кахоров Мачнунбек проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мачнунбек более 15 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. У него имеюся постоянные клиенты, мясники. Кредит просит для закупа скота  и для дальнейшей продажи.
texts.en:
K. Majnunbek lives in the Tursunzoda region. He is 42 years old, married, with three children. Majnunbek has kept livestock for over 15 years. He raises and sells cattle. He has several butchers as regular clients. He is interested in obtaining a loan for purchase of livestock and for expenses associated with their sale.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Yao Bernard

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a fait une formation en cuisine, après sa formation il a ouvert son propre restaurant qu’il a appelé « FREEDOM FAST FOOD », beaucoup de gens viennent manger chez lui car il fait de la bonne cuisine. Actuellement les produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration étant épuisés, il s’adresse à WAGES pour acheter 2 bidons d’huile, un panier de tomates, 2 sacs de riz  et divers autres produits.Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman took training in cooking.  Afterward, he opened his own restaurant he called "FREEDOM FAST FOOD".  Many people come to his place to eat because he makes some good food. Currently, the items necessary for his restaurant business are out of stock, so he is inquiring with WAGES to buy two drums of oil, a basket of tomatoes, two sacks of rice, and a variety of other goods.  He is married and the father of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, tomatoes, sacks of rice, and various other goods

loans.name: Laurence

texts.fr: K. Laurence est née le 11 Août 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. il y a environs 9 ans que Laurence réside au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Mariée à GOUTON Guillaume, Laurence est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Sègbèya. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Laurence  n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aider son mari, Laurence  vend de la bouillie (de mil, de "tapioka", fait à base de manioc, et de "akpan" fait à base d'amidon de maïs). Laurence mène cette activité depuis environs 6 ans et vend sa bouillie dans son quartier. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Laurence s'approvisionne. Laurence a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursés ces crédits. Laurence a actuellement quelques difficultés financières et désire renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Laurence sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Laurence K. was born on 11 August 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For about 9 years, Laurence has lived in the Sègbèya area of Cotonou. Married to Guillaume Gouton, Laurence is the mother of three children. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents in Sègbèya. The couple provide for the family together. Laurence only attended primary school. To meet her needs and help her husband, Laurence sells 'bouillie' (made of millet, tapioca - made from manioc, and 'akpan' - made from maize starch). Laurence has run this business for about 6 years and sells her bouillie in her area. It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Laurence gets her supplies. Laurence has already obtained three loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid these loans properly. Laurence is currently having some financial difficulties and wants to strengthen her business in order to better satisfy her clientele. This is why Laurence is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maize, millet, tapioca, cartons of milk, and sugar

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: M. Emmanuel is a 49-year-old businessman. He is the father of three kids. He has a retail shop in his area. He started the business five years ago. He is using the loan to purchase food items and other products, such as soap, wheat flour, basins, cooking oil, and so forth, for the expansion of his business. His aim is to buy a plot of land and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell to expand his business.

loans.name: Basti

texts.en: Basti F. is a single 48-year-old woman who sells plates, cups, glasses, and other dishes for dowry. Most of her clients are young girls and brides who come to her store to buy beautiful dinner and tea sets or glasses. Basti has been running her store for 10 years. She applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN so she can increase the number of items she sells and to purchase products that are in high demand like dinner and tea sets.

loans.use: To purchase more dinner and tea sets.

loans.name: P.g.

texts.en: N. is a 43 year old woman living in a village in the Matara district of Sri Lanka, located on the southern coast of the island. She lives with her husband and three children. She is a house wife and helps her husband in his small masonry business. Currently, the business is too small to earn enough income for their family of 5, so she is seeking a loan to help her husband develop this small venture.  She will use the loan to buy brick, sand, and other materials to help them expand.

loans.use: Brick, sand and other building construction materials

loans.name: Treng

texts.en:
Treng V., age 45, is married and resides with her family in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children.

She and her husband are involved in the construction business as construction foremen, each earning approximately US $7 per day. V. is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000.

The family is also assisted by two of her children who are currently working at a local garment factory. The family's standard of living has improved since V. is with this business, so she wants to take a loan to expand her business.

V. is requesting a loan of USD $600 to purchase more construction tools to expand the current business. This is her third loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy construction tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of yams

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
Silvio Antonio S., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene cinco hijos a su cargo,  y de estos cuatro se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvio Antonio S. works as a custodian in Managua's Roberto Huembes market. He is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. He has had seven loans with Kiva partner Ceprodel over the past nine years and has used the money to improve his house. This loan will be used to put an electricity system in his house. Silvio's goal is to provide his children with better security and improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde M. de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene una casa de cemento si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es maestro albañil ellos tienen 2 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Cleotilde comenzó cosiendo en una maquina de coser vieja que le prestaron poco a poco con unos cuantos ahorros decidió invertir su dinero en unas telas y algodón para hacer muñecas de trapo y así vender a sus vecinos.

Ahora ella tiene 20 años haciendo muñecas de trapos para sus clientes y almacenes gracias a estos buenos ingresos ella pudo implementar un nuevo negocio de ventas de cilindros de gas, pero continúa como costurera. La casa de ella es en una loma de Paraíso de Guayaquil y es muy difícil trasladar los cilindros de gas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cilindros de gas para su nuevo negocio y poder ayudar a su familia con más ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener su casa terminada y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Cleotilde M., 47, lives in Paraiso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. She owns a house made of cement and has all the basic services. Her husband is a long-time construction worker and they have 2 children, both in school. Cleotilde began sewing on an old borrowed sewing machine. She decided to use her small savings to buy materials and cotton wadding to start a business making rag dolls that she sold in the neighborhood. She has been making the dolls for 20 years now, selling them to individuals and stores.
