Thanks to the earnings from the business, she was able to set up another business selling gas cylinders for cooking, but she's never given up the doll-making business. Her house is on a hill in Paraiso de Guayaquil and, consequently, it's very hard to move the gas cylinders back and forth. Cleotilde will use this loan to buy gas cylinders for her new business and, in turn, generate extra income for her family. In the future, she wants to finish her house and see her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Todos Unidos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Todas Unidas está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, esforzadas y luchadoras que habitan en San Judas, uno de los barrios más grandes de Managua.  Este sobre sale por su religiosidad y por sus pobladores quienes día a día buscan ganarse la vida.
La coordinadora del grupo es Martha Patricia G. propietaria de una pequeña pulpería  donde comercializa desde granos básicos, carne, chiverías, gaseosas y licor de todo tipo.  Ella con el préstamo  surtirá su negocio con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.
Las otras dos integrantes son Teresa de Jesús Martínez Quintana la cual desde hace quince años se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos y Rosa Catalina Pereza  es propietaria de un taxi y un microbús los cuales piensa darles mantenimiento con el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Group Everyone United is comprised of three entrepreneurial and hard-working women who are born fighters. They live in San Judas, one of the largest neighborhoods in Managua. This area is known for its religiousness and for residents who struggle each and every day to earn a living. The coordinator of the group is Martha Patricia G. who owns a small grocery store where she sells basic grains, meat, snacks, sodas, and every type of liquor. With this loan, she will supply her business with a greater quantity and variety of products. The other two members are Teresa de Jesús Martínez Quintana, who has sold clothing for more than fifteen years, and Rosa Catalina Pereza who owns a taxi and minibus that she will be able to provide maintenance for with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sodas, snacks and liquor.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 43 años , es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Vive en una localidad  ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa, que es propia .Desde muy joven  tuvo la noción de ser independiente;  y en la actualidad ayuda a sus padres a sembrar y cosechar de manera eficiente. Ella produce y comercializa cacao y  hoja de coca, y  va mejorando sus ventas de manera paulatina, todo esto se lo debe a sus padres quienes le enseñaron las técnicas y herramientas necesarias para obtener productivas plantaciones agrícolas. Rosa reconoce que hay muchas cosas por mejorar, en cuanto a la calidad y cantidad, y  lo logrará con el transcurrir del tiempo, solo por falta de capital no puede introducir maquinarias que le puedan  generar una  producción a gran escala. Por lo general trabaja sola , en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero siempre necesita de sus peones en tiempo de cosecha y su rutina diaria es de 12 horas, solo  los domingos se da un descanso con su familia. Su plan a futuro es producir frutas cítricas, para obtener mayor cantidad de clientes, a la vez desea sacar ventaja de sus competidores.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  asegura cumplirá puntualmente  con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente fortalecida  y en confianza con su banco comunal.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de más  terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de continuar sembrando sus productos , para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is a single mother of three children. She lives in a community located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry where she owns her own house. From a very early age she wanted to be independent and currently helps her parents plant and harvest efficiently. She produces cocoa beans and coca leaves to sell and has gradually been improving her sales. She owes all this to her parents who taught her the skills and gave her the tools to be an efficient farmer. Rosa realizes that there are many things still to improve both with respect to quality and to quantity and she will achieve this as time passes; it’s only the lack of funds that keeps her from introducing mechanization that would allow for large scale production. Generally she works alone but occasionally her family helps her; she always needs help from field hands during harvest time, however. She works a 12-hour day with just Sundays off to spend with her family. Her future plan is to produce citrus fruit in order to acquire more customers and have an edge over her competition. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she assures prompt repayment. Being a member of a communal bank gives her strength and confidence. Rosa plans to use the requested funds to buy more farmland in order to continue growing her crops so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more land to cultivate.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20 year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a house painter since 2006. He works independently as a painter and travels to meet his clients. In Lebanon, it is often necessary for young people to work to help support the family with the increasing cost of living in the country. He and one parent work to support the household.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his work. He is requesting a loan of $1,000. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his work as a painter

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija R. T. is a married woman with three children all attending school. For nine years she has been operating her business  selling peas and dumplings  door to door, at the market,  and from home to her neighbors. In addition she has houses  for rent. With a loan of Kshs 80,000, Hadija wants to purchase a bundle of baking flour, one sack of peas and two dairy cows.
Hadija faces the challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Hadija would like to run a bakery in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of baking flour, 50kgs of peas and two dairy cows.

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en:
Uranbileg S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger'- a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her eldest child is a student, and the other two children attend a local middle school while her husband is a porter in Mah market and only earns seasonally. 

Uranbileg currently operates a small bakery in her town. She started a retail business in 2004. She makes a variety of breads and baked goods and has found success in her new venture and has increased her working capital which enabled her to purchase gifts such as a carpet and a TV set for her sister's wedding. She was able to cover her child's tuition fees and purchase 'ger' covering materials and a frying stove with her business earnings. 

Her daily sales reaches to 20-25 loaves of bread prepared with 8-10 kilos of flour. She is a hard-working, easy-going woman who is focused on the future growth of her business. She says, “ I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future.” 

Uranbileg hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more flour and other supplies and products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Cheuy

texts.en:
Cheuy C., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known to be the favorite tourist place in the country.

C. produces traditional cake, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a chef and also earns an income of USD 3 per day. C. appears in the photograph with her husband.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita C. is from the village of Nangcaan, Rizal. She is 60 years-old and a widow with five adult children. To make a living, Purita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dry goods in the local community. Purita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Purita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Purita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Purita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the store. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Purita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen, aged 40 years, is married with a single son. She is an uneducated lady. She always wanted to get an education but couldn’t due to the poor financial conditions of her family. Her father was the only breadwinner of the family and she has a big family to serve and its difficult to manage the study expenses of her family.
 
Her husband, A. Gamar A., is a salesman by profession. He has 10 years of experience in sales work. Earlier, he sold edible items for someone else, then he started selling medicines as his own business. Now he wants to change his business. He has seen good potential in the grocery business because he can generate a good income on it, which he couldn’t earn by medicine selling. 
 
This family belongs to a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan city is famous for its dairy products. They own a small house of two rooms and have been living in it for over 21 years.
 
Shaheen has applied for a loan for the sixth time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy the groceries and start a grocery shop in the market. In the previous five years, Shaheen has given no complaints regarding repayments and hasn't missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to start a grocery shop

loans.name: Naljirmaa

texts.en: Naljirmaa Y. , age 57-year-old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her younger son attends University. She used to work in a local school as a teacher and has retired in 2009. Since then, she rents and operates a cafe at a local school with help of her husband. She plans to purchase more tools and equipments for her cafe and make her cafe more convenient and comfortable. She hopes to expand her products line in order to attract more customers. She is very laborious and open minded person and says " I will increase my business profits and help my son to create his own family." Naljirmaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to decorate her cafe and purchase equipment and supplies such as chairs and tables

loans.use: To decorate her cafe and purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
M. Muhammadjon is a young and energetic guy who raises calves in a small village in Ganchi district of Sugd region. Muhammadjon is young but full of energy; he tries every single day to make the life of his family better. He started his business 4 years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. 

Muhammadjon has great experience in cattle breeding and the farming business because he observed it from his childhood. Muhammadjon would like to expand his business and that is the reason that he has asked for a loan. This will help him to increase his income and improve living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. was born in1940, she is married to James, and they are blessed with three children and live in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Regina has faced some challenges in life.  She has been struggling with ill health and the problem of poor yield due to natural disaster. The most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, for the production of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoa yams. Most  especially cassava, which is used in the production of garri and water-fufu. She also plans to invest part in her general provision store, which will raise daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she was born a farmer and now she is an expert in farming over the past years. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Regina will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cassava seedlings.

loans.name: Meoung

texts.en:
Meoung S., 56, is widowed and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a farmer and raises chickens, earning about $0.60 US per day. Her child is a tailor in the city, earning $100.00 US per month to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend $40.00 US on food, $1.00 on electricity and water supplies, and $19.00 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of $500.00 to build a chicken cage and buy more chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a chicken cage and buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe P., 65, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is already a widow and she is both father and mother to three young hard-working adults. By the grace of God, Fe has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Fe P. operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages, etc. to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Fe  dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Juliana owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling rice by the kilogram in the local community. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Juliana joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional rice to buy and sell. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be Juliana’s third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Yusi

texts.es: Yusi tiene 31 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado vinculada a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, como herencia que sus padres le dejaron, enseñándole todo lo que es necesario en la vida del campo. En la actualidad trabaja cultivando papa y maíz, su esposo se encarga de las duras tareas que implica el removido del terreno para sembrar y manipular el arado entre otros y por su parte Yusi con sus hijos se encargan de esparcir las semillas y recoger las cosechas según sea el caso. Aunque hay ocasiones en las cuales contratan mano de obra para que le ayuden a realizar este trabajo en menos tiempo,  también tiene sumo cuidado con los animales que tienen sobre todo los toros y  vacas de su establo, en donde lo alimenta con pastizales que ellas misma cultiva. En  adelante desea tener más cantidad de animales y mejorar en sus posteriores cosechas. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra que va realizar, así como la compra de un toro que le servirá para engordarlo y venderlo en los próximos meses.
texts.en: Yusi is 31 years old. She lives together with her husband and their children in a house that is their own. All of her live she has been a farmer. Her parents taught her all that she needed to know about life in the country, and this was their inheritance to her. Today she has corn and potato harvest and her husband takes care of the difficult task of plowing the fields to prepare them for seeding, or he takes care of the harvest, whatever the case.  Sometimes they hire help to carry out these jobs in less time.  They also have livestock to take care of, especially bulls and cows they keep in a stable. They are fed natural foods from the harvest. In the future she hopes to have more livestock and improve her future harvest. This is her first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy to have the financial support and she is grateful to all those who contribute to the loan that she requests. It will be very useful for the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers for her plantations. She will also purchase a bull that will be fattened and sold in the six months.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a bull.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es: Ambrosia, de 53 años, está casada con Rómulo, de 53 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Ivan, de 22, Ángel, de 20 y Fredy, de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Hace poco Ambrosia, sufrió la perdida de uno de sus hijos, pero a pesar de ello; está valerosa mujer sigue trabajando arduamente, la ganadería y la agricultura, son sus principales actividades económicas. Sus sembríos constan principalmente de papa, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, y en épocas de campaña agrícola, los lleva a la capital, donde adquiere mejores ganancias. Mientras que la carne que compra, lo lleva a la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde la carne de cordero escasea. Ahora, está valiente mujer desea comprar un auto, con el cual piensa incursionar en el trasporte público. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, que fueron personas solidarias y le brindaron apoyo en el momento más difícil de su vida. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará carne al por mayor, para comercializarlo.
texts.en:
Ambrosia, 53, is married to Rómulo, 53.  They have 8 children but only three, Iván, 22, Ángel, 20, and Fredy, 16, live together as a family with them in their own house located in Ricrican.

A short time ago Ambrosia suffered the loss of one of her children.  Despite that, this brave woman continues working hard.  Her main economic activities are farming and cattle raising.

Her crops are mainly potatoes and she sells her harvests at the Tarma wholesale market.  During agricultural campaigns she takes them to the capital where she obtains greater profits.  The meat she buys she takes to the city of San Ramón (Peruvian central jungle) where lamb is scarce.

Now this brave woman wants to buy a car to go into public transportation services.

This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support from her communal bank.  They are supportive people who helped her through the most difficult moment in her life.

She will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure and if there is enough money will buy meat at wholesale to resell.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure and meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old and is married with four children, ages 9, 7, 5 and 3. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Miriam started her business a year ago.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, la socia tiene una combi que realiza servicio público donde su esposo es chofer y ella es la que se dedica a cobrar, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio público de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su combi.                

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Cleofe is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Cleofe divides her time between her daily activities and her transportation business. She has a minibus used for providing services to the public. Her husband is the driver while she is in charge of collecting fares. This business provides the means by which her children can get ahead. Cleofe wants to improve her transportation services, so she is requesting a loan to maintain her vehicle.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Rose Mwangulu

texts.en:
Rose Mwangulu L. is 39 years old and married to Mwarandu. Together they have four children.

Rose has been in the tailoring business for the last seven years. This is her first loan from KADET. With it she plans to purchase cloth, sewing notions and material for linings.

Rose’s profits will be used to purchase more sewing machines and employ more staff. Her dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, sewing notions and material for linings

loans.name: Mark Raymond

texts.en:
Mark Raymond O. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 23 years old. He is married and has 2 infant children. 

To make a living, Mark Raymond owns & operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal transport services to local community members. He  has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mark Raymond joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. 

Mark Raymond is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to maintain service. This loan will be his 2nd loan  from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools to maintain service

location.town: Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a food vending business.  She lives in Rizal, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Menchie is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Menchie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: Madame Irène est mariée avec un enfant à charge. Elle a  33 ans et habite quartier Anfamé.   Elle fait comme activité la décoration. Elle achète les matériaux de décoration au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle compte 11 d’expérience et a son atelier à côté du feu rouge Bè en face de la station totale. Elle demande  un prêt pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plusieurs clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Irène is married and has one child to support. She's 33 years old and lives in the Anfamé neighborhood. Her business consists in selling decorative materials. She purchases her supplies in Accra, Ghana, as well as at the Grand Market in Lomé. She has 11 years of experience, and her workshop is located next to the Bè traffic light, opposite the Total gas station. She's seeking a loan to resupply and satisfy several customers.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials

loans.name: Diolita

texts.en: Diolita is a 55 year-old married woman who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato, with her family. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She grows rice and corn that she sells to the market. The pigs she raises are for fattening and sale as well. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and fertilizers. Diolita works hard to improve her businesses and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 49 años de edad, es divorciada y reside junto a su hijo en el caserío Toribio Castro del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de venta de alimentos en un cafetín de un molino de la zona donde vive. Ella prepara alimentos y los ofrece en venta a las personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, adicionalmente vende golosinas, galletas y bebidas gaseosas. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 2 años y es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Doris desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de sillas y mesas para renovar las que tiene en su negocio y están deteriorados insumos ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Doris is 49 years old, divorced, and she lives with her son in the community of Toribio Castro in the district of Lambayeque. It is a region of humble inhabitants that are primarily dedicated to agriculture. It is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She prepares foods from a cafeteria at a mill in the region where she lives. She prepares foods and she offers them for sale to the people who come to work in the region. She also sells snacks, cookies, and soft drinks. The business is 2 years old and it is a great source of help for her family. It is through this business that she is able to earn a daily living.

Doris wants to expand her business with the purchase of chairs and tables to replace the ones that she has in her business because they have deteriorated. And she wants to purchase ingredients because her business's demand has increased. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles which will help her reach her objectives.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables to renovate her business

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: EL DUO EMANUEL, ESTA CONFORMADO POR, DOÑA BLANCA R. DE 43 AÑOS SEPARADA CON 6 HIJOS, DOS DE ELLOS LA AYUDAN ECONOMICAMENTE Y TRES ESTUDIAN AUN EN EDADES MENORE DE 12 AÑOS. DOÑA BLANCA TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA Y PANADERIA QUE ATIENDE DE DOMINGO A DOMINGO, DESDE LAS 6:30 AM HASTA LAS 8:30 PM  ELLA SE SACRIFICA CON GUSTO YA QUE ES SU OBJETIVO SACAR ADELANTE A SUS NIÑOS QUE AUN ESTUDIAN SU TIENDA TIENE DE EXISTENCIA YA 6 AÑOS, Y ES EL UNICO INGRESO QUE OBTIENE, TAMBIEN HACE DONAS, SU OBJETIVO ES AMPLIAR SU TIENDA Y AUMENTAR EL INGRESO ECONOMICO EN SU FAMILIA,ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA ELAVORAR PAN.  DOÑA ANA RAYES DE 42 AÑOS CASADA CON TRES HIJOS, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFACCIONES EN EL INSTITUTO, ENTRE SUS PRODUCTOS ELLA VENDE: DONAS, GASEOSAS, TOSTADAS, GOLOSINAS, Y MUCHA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO. DOÑA ANA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO  PARA SEGUIR CON SU NEGOCIO Y TENER MAS INGRESOS PARA SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SU ESPOSO CON LA ECONOMIA DE SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
One of the members of the Emanuel Group is Doña Blanca R.. She is 43 years old, separated from her spouse, and has six children. Two of her children help her financially. Three of her children are students who are under the age of 12. Doña Blanca has a small store and bakery that she manages Sunday through Sunday from 6:30am to 8:30pm. She gladly makes sacrifices so that her children who are still in school can get ahead. Her store has been in existence for six years and is the only source of income that she has. Blanca also makes donuts. Her goal is to expand her store so that she can increase her family’s financial income. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Doña Ana R. is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She sells snacks at a school. Among the products she sells are donuts, sodas, tostadas, candy, and a variety of other everyday products. Doña Ana is requesting a loan to buy consumer products so that she can continue her business and generate more income to help her husband with the household finances.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina Leano is a 61-year-old woman living in Magsaysay, Naguilan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is widowed and has six adult children.

Josefina has been in the business of selling a variety of medicine in her community for five years. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional medicine to sell.

In the future, Josefina would like to expand her business to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Married to Ruth, Charles is 41 years and the father of three children who are attending school.  He has practised farming in the town of Olkalou for the last five years.  Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan which he will use to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. His previous loans were paid well and in good time. In the future, Charles hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Simion

texts.es:
Santos, habita en la comunidad el Ocotolillo, ubicada en Yali, municipio de Jinotega, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, el es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de café. Inicio a cultivar café, en la parcela de su papa, a la edad de 15 años de edad. Cuando recibió una herencia de su padre, se independizo el ya tenia 22 años de edad, se caso, sus hijos estudian en una escuela ubicada en la comunidad. A pesar de que el solo estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria, por dedicarse a trabajar, el quiere un mejor futuro para sus hijos. El señor Santos también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, vende plátanos que son otros ingresos que el posee.    
Solicito el préstamo para sembrar café, comprar abono, insumos, pago de mano de obra. Con esta inversión espera darle un mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo, sacar una cosecha de buena calidad y buen rendimiento. El esta enfocado en seguir mejorando su siembra de café, desea poder comprar una manzana mas de tierra para cultivar  café, mejorar su casa. Su meta próxima es sembrar 2 manzanas de frijoles, una manzana de maíz, y cultivar café.
texts.en:
Santos lives in Ocotolillo community, in Yali, in Jinotega.  He is 37 years old, has two children and works as a coffee farmer.

Santos started growing coffee on a plot of land belonging to his dad at the age of 15.  When he was 22 years old, Santos received his inheritance from his father and started working independently.  He also got married.   Santos' children are attending school in their community.  In spite of the fact that he only studied up to the fourth year of elementary school because he started working, Santos would like a better future for his children.  He also grows basic grains such as corn and beans, and sells bananas which makes him an extra income.

Santos requested this loan to help him grow his coffee.  He will buy fertilizer and supplies, and pay laborers.  With this investment, he hopes to better maintain his coffee crop, obtain a good-quality harvest and a good yield.  He is focused on continuing to improve his coffee growing and would like to buy an additional 'manzana' (approximately 1.68 acres) of land on which to grow coffee.  He would also like to improve his home.  His next goal is to sow two 'manzanas' of land with beans, one with corn and grow coffee.

loans.use: to grow coffee.  He will buy fertilizers and supplies, and pay laborers

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 26 años de edad, convive con Víctor  de 30 años y fruto de su relación concibieron dos hijos, Mayra de 05 años y Abel de 02 años de edad y juntos residen en su propia casa en el distrito de Quimbiri. Dina es  una mujer muy luchadora con ganas de sobre salir  y triunfar en la vida,  su actividad  rutinaria es apoyar a su pareja en la elaboración de ladrillos de construcción. En el trabajo de la ladrillerilla viene trabajando 07años y su almacén central se encuentra en el populoso distrito de Quimbiri. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de 03 trabajadores quienes se encargan del proceso y reparto a domicilios. Existe mucha demanda en su negocio, porque atiende pedidos y abastece a diferentes distritos de la zona del Valle Río Apurímac como son: Pichari, San Francisco y Santa Rosa localidades prosperas y con mayor crecimiento económico. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales como desmonte de tierras y hornos para la elaboración de sus ladrillos. En lo futuro tiene proyectado comprar su propia movilidad un carro de carga para poder trasladar su mercadería y así reducir los gastos en el alquiler del transporte. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá otro apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo y  esta muy contenta  trabajar de la mano de las socias de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado le servirá como capital para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dina, age 26, lives with 30 year old Víctor, and they have two children.  Mayra is 5, and Abel is 2.  They live in their own house in the Quimbiri district.  Dina is a very tenacious woman with the desire to get ahead and succeed in life.  Her daily routine is to help her husband make bricks for construction.  He has worked in the brick making-industry for seven years.  

Their central warehouse is in the populous district of Quimiri.  He has three helpers who take charge of delivering to homes.  There is much demand in his business because they take care of orders and stock different districts like Pichari, San Francisco and Santa Rosa, in the Vallé Río zone.  These are prosperous locations with great economic growth.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials to clear the land and ovens to make their bricks.  In the future she plans to buy her own car for hauling the bricks in order to be able to transport her merchandise and reduce the expense of renting transportation.

This will be her sixth loan.  She is very happy to know that she will have another loan.  That way she is sure to advance with her work.  She is very happy to work hand in hand with the members of her communal bank.  She will use the requested loan to buy raw materials to make their bricks.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Beatriz is 46 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Beatriz has an "abaca" making business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her "abaca"-making business.

Beatriz has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her "abaca" (natural fiber) making business.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Constancia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Constancia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Constancia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Constancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Karim est un homme âgé de 45ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 02 enfants.  
Karim travaille comme vendeur de CD, Télévision, DVD depuis 2005. Il  vend à ses clients dans le quartier de BE. Il achète les produits au Grand marché de Lomé. Il travaille avec 01  employé. 
Karim a requis son cinquième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 06 télévisions, des DVD, des CD.
texts.en:
Karim is a 45-year old man. He is married to a seamstress. He has two children. Since 2005. Karim works as a vendor of TV sets, CDs,   and DVDs. He sells in the Be neighborhood. He stocks up at the Big market of Lomé. He also employs one person to work with him.

Karim has requested his fifth-cycle loan from WAGES in order to purchase six TV sets, and some DVDs and CDs.

loans.use: To buy CDs, DVDs and TV sets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more plastic containers to re-sell.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il est composé de 26 femmes issues de différents quartiers de la ville et ont comme activité commune le petit commerce.

La responsable Ndéye Ami est âgée de 35 ans, divorcée elle est mère de deux garçons et une fille qui vivent avec leur père; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de parfums, écharpes,habits enfants....; elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 6 ans. Elle est debout à droite habillée en wax vert-orange avec des ronds blancs et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses produits dans la capitale et dans les villes limitrophes pour revendre dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte.


Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des articles à bon prix pour pouvoir tirer un bon profit en les revendant.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge ses enfants bien qu'ils soient avec leur papa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 15, 2008 when the "Village Bank" was inaugurated. It is composed of 26 women from various neighborhoods of the town who all engage in small-scale retailing. 

The group leaD., Ndéye Ami, is 35, divorced, and the mother of two sons and one daughter who live with their father. She is a small-scale retailer selling perfume, scarves, children's clothing, etc. She makes good use of her six years' experience. She is standing on the right, dressed in a green and orange African print with white circles and has raised her left hand.  

She buys her merchandise in the capital and adjacent towns and resells the goods in her neighborhood door-to-door. She intends to use her loan to buy articles at a reasonable price so that she can make a good profit when she sells them. Her goal is to support herself and her children, even though they live with their papa.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Génesis, es del Chaco, está integrado por 11 mujeres de esa zona. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de procurar mayores ingresos y beneficios, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familiares. Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa, pero les gustaría ir poder creciendo día a día.
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de joyas hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre le piden cierto tipo de joyas. Dice que esto le genera muy buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría poder seguir en el negocio. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una joyería donde pueda ofrecer la variedad de productos que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pulseras, cadenas, anillos y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Genesis" is made up of 11 women from this area.  They meet with the objective of getting higher incomes and benefits, not only for themselves, but also for their families.  They are in their first loan cycle in the program, but they would like to be able to grow their businesses each day.  Rosa has had a business selling jewelry for a good while now, and she comments that she has a lot of customers who always request a certain type of jewelry.  She says that this business generates good earnings, and so she would like to be able to continue with it.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a jewelry store where she could offer her varied products for sale.

She requests a loan to buy bracelets, chains, rings and other pieces of jewelry, with which she will be able to continue to grow her business and offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She thanks the Fundación for this opportunity, because getting this loan will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains and other pieces of jewelry

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Don Ernesto tiene 54 años de edad y vive con su esposa. El tiene 4 hijos, pero todos ya tienen sus propios hogares.

A Don Ernesto siempre le a gustado trabajar arduamente. Él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde muy pequeño, pero desde hace 25 años empezó con el cultivo de hortalizas. Este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre.

Las hortalizas que Don Ernesto cultiva incluyen tomates, chile, pipían y huisquil, y además de esos ahora ha empezado a cultivar fríjol. Para que sus plantas puedan dar buenos frutos y en abundancia, él debe comprar insumos para poderlas cuidar bien.

Don Ernesto esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la cosecha de sus hortalizas, y para el pago de mano de obra que le ayude a sacar el fruto de su cosecha (puesto que él solo no da abasto).  

Los frutos de su cosecha los vende satisfactoriamente en la comunidad donde vive, obteniendo un buen margen de ganancias. El obtendrá buenos ingresos y se ahorrará el comprar la verdura para su consumo personal en el mercado, ya que el mismo la cosecha.

Lo que él desea es seguir cosechando mayor cantidad de hortalizas el próximo año, de esa manera mejorará la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 54 years old and lives with his wife.  He has four children who already have their own homes.

Ernesto has always enjoyed working hard.  He has been farming since he was very young.  Twenty-five years ago he started growing vegetables.  He learned this work from his father.

Ernesto's vegetables include tomatoes, chilis, pipian (squash) and chayote.  He has also started growing beans.  In order for his plants to provide good fruit, in abundance, he must buy supplies so that he can care for them properly.

Ernesto is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy agricultural supplies for his vegetables.  He will also pay laborers who will help him to harvest his crops (as he cannot do it alone).

Ernesto sells his harvested crops satisfactorily within his community.  He makes a good profit margin.  He will make good income and save by selling vegetables for personal consumption in the market.

What Ernesto would like is to continue, harvesting a larger quantity of vegetables next year.  This will enable him to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his crops

loans.name: Moses A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema city, eastern Sierra Leone. Their school was founded in 2002 and currently has an enrollment of 223 pupils and 7 teachers. This is the first loan that teachers of this noble institution will receive from SMT/Kiva lenders, and it will certainly create a lot of improvements in the lives of these borrowers.

Moses, the 49-year-old leader of this group, was born in Bunumbu, located in eastern Sierra Leone. In the teaching profession for 31 years now. Moses is the married father of three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. He will use his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Hean, 64 years old, is a rice seller who earns $2 per day. Her husband is a worker who earns $2 per day. The couple has one child, 15 years old, who stays at home. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a stock of rice to sell for a good price. She wants to support her child in studying a skill although now he does not know the skill he wants to study.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Juvilee

texts.en:
Juvilee is married and is 42 years old. He has six children and he resides in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Juvilee operates his own motorcycle business as a means of transportation to earn a living. He has had this business for more than 20 years. Each month, he earns Php 8,000. 

He has requested a loan of Php 25,000.00 to repair his existing vehicle for better service. Juvilee has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Juvilee will keep the returns for the educational plans of his six kids and to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El señor Dionicio nació  en Valle grande, es casado tiene cinco hijos ya mayores, el se dedica a la agricultura, tiene su parcela en pampa el Coscal y también se dedica a la ganadería, la zona donde el trabaja se encuentra a 42 km de San Luis en la provincia Florida de la Santa Cruz, donde el tiene su parcela, donde vive y trabaja, el siembra maíz, arroz, y también un poco de yuca, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz Todo lo que el cosecha lo saca a vender en el mercado de el Torno, del productor al consumidor, ya viene trabajando con Emprender hace 4 créditos, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que emprender  nuevamente le esta dando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Dionicio was born in Valle Grande. He is married and has 5 grown-up children. He is a farmer and has his own plot of land in the pampas of Coscal. He also raises animals. The area he works in is 42km form San Luis in the province of Florida de la Santa Cruz, a place where he has his plot of land, lives and works. He sows corn, rice and also a little cassava. He will use the loan to buy seeds to sow corn. Everything he harvests, he sells at the Tomo market, direct from producer to consumer. He has been working with Emprender for 4 loan cycles. He is very grateful for the support that Emprender is again givng him so as to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing corn.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Rajab is applying for another loan for his business. He will use this 80,000 Kes loan to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, Rajab hopes to continue expanding his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Rajab has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mr. Von, 37, is the father of 3 children. With his team, he works as a construction worker in a variety of locations, which provides him with nonstop work to do. He is able to earn in the neighborhood of $4.50 a day. He has tried very hard to support his children because he wants them to pursue a high standard of living and have a bright future. 

With this loan amount, he will purchase a second-hand motorcycle that will be used for both work and family transportation. In the future, he intends to open a general store so his wife can sell a variety of products from his house.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
Garnet is 44 years old and married with 2 children.

Garnet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her sari sari store.

Garnet has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and entertainment (videoke).

Garnet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim, aged 36, is in the business of raising pigs from which she is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day. Currently, she lives in Baray district with her husband and two school-aged children. 

Thim has requested this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy posts which will be used to build a fence around her house. This fence will secure the family from unexpected things happening. In the future, Thim wants to own a general store selling mixed products from her house.

loans.use: to buy posts which will be used to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 to 25 years. She describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a general store where she sells items such as soap and stationery. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area which is good for business. She describes her biggest business challenge as unfavourable climate change. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stationery and soap. Jenifer's business goal is to run another general store near her town within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stationery and soaps.

loans.name: Pedro Fabian

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro  tiene 57 años de edad es casado, su principal actividad es la de  prestar el servicio de taxista libre es decir busca pasajeros por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba,  Tiene  automóvil propio pero sus papeles de su auto no están a su nombre , trabaja 4 días a la semana, el vive por la Av. Petrolera km 3 en la zona sud,  a 4 kilómetros de la ciudad,  uno de los barrios mas pobres del Cercado, tiene una granja porcina ubicada  rayo pampa- Tarata donde también atiende y abastece de alimento a su granja porcina  . Necesita  de infraestructura para su granja ya que con la lluvia se inundo y el índice de mortalidad de su ganado porcino subió, la granja se encuentra en mal estado las paredes húmedas se vuelven débiles y tienden a caerse y su ganado porcino esta en peligro  a morir aplastados se encuentra muy preocupado el cual es motivo del préstamo que esta tramitando.
texts.en: Pedro is 57 years old and married.  His main business is working as a freelance taxi driver.  He drives all over the city of Cochabamba looking for passengers.  He owns his own vehicle but the car's papers are not in his name.  He works four days a week.  Pedro lives on the km3 stretch of Avenida Petrolera, in the southern zone, four kilometers from the city center, in one of the poorest neighborhoods of El Cercado.  He has a pig farm located in Rayo Pampa, Tarata where he works and supplies his pig farm with feed.  He needs infrastructure for his farm because it became flooded in the rains and the death rate of his pigs increased.  The farm is in a bad state of repair.  The damp walls become weak and tend to collapse which means that his pigs are in danger of being crushed to death.  Pedro is very worried which is why he is taking out this loan.

loans.use: to carry out building work on his pig farm

loans.name: Diana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Diana tiene 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo y de sus tres maravillosos  hijos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, así como también una gastronomía y paisajes muy hermosos. Diana tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante sobre todo porque tiene el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar el cual son sus hijos y por ello cada día se esfuerza para poder sacarlos adelante al lado de su esposo. Día a día Diana trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes.

Diana esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como arreglos de techo y mejoramiento de paredes, de esta manera su familia tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir  luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Construir su vivienda de material noble”.

loans.use: Para mejporamiento de techo

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 27 years old. She is married with three children aged between 4 and 10 years. They all go to school. 

She is wholesaler of Irish potatoes and she has been running this business for the past 5 years, while her husband is a businessman.

With the loan, she would like to buy Irish potatoes to sell. With the profits from the business she plans to buy a house. 

In the future she aims to earn at least 4,000,000 RWF in a year.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Claudio Peregrino

texts.es: Claudio es un hombre trabajador de 62 años que vive en la localidad rural de Pecon, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y además se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar una vaca orgánica para vender la leche que produce y así aumentar sus ingresos para realizar mejoras a su vivienda

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: My name is Hilda A. I work selling colognes and lotions, I have my business for about 3 years, and have good clients because I sell my products in the center of the capital, my business produces income to support my family, my goal is to increase my inventory in order to offer my clients with a larger variety and quality of my products and the profit I get I will use to pay for a private university son, who will finish high school soon and also to support my family.

loans.use: To buy colognes and lotions.

loans.name: Ràúl Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar has spent most of his life dedicated to tailoring. He says it is a family business; his wife and children work with him. "I have very little fabric to use. I need more material to be able to continue to fill my clients' orders. I'm asking for a loan of $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Cesar lleva toda una vida dedicándose al oficio de la sastrería, es el negocio de la familia como dice el, su esposa y sus hijos forman parte del equipo de trabajo. "Tengo muy poca tela de donde cortar requiero de una cantidad mayor de material para poder seguir con los encargos de mis clientes solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy material for my work.

loans.name: Teodosa Laudina

texts.en:
My name is Teodosa Laudina and I run a small clothing store in my home. I also sell clothes on the street. I am a single mother and thanks to my business I can provide for my family and send my children to school.

Mi nombre es Teodosa Laudina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, soy madre soltera y gracias a este negocio puedo dar a mis hijos educación y demas gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase underwear, men's shirts, blouses, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
Amara K. is thirty-six years old, married with four children. He is a very innovative man who started a small workshop for repairing bicycles. Many youth have sports bicycles and Amara creatively started his workshop just outside the open market where many customers now take their bicycles for repair.

Amara would like to improve his service by purchasing spare parts so as to have an inventory on hand, and also procure some needed tools. He is requesting a loan of $150 from SMT to help him expand his business activity.

loans.use: Purchase bicycle spare parts to keep on hand to improve service

loans.name: Ni Putu Suarni

texts.id:
Ni Putu Suarni is a housewife with one 5 year old child. Suarni stayed in a house she did not own. Since she did not have any other skills, Suarni became a pig farmer. Today, Suarni raise 1 mother pig and 3 piglets that she bought for Rp2000,000 (about US$220). A piglet cost Rp250,000 (about $28). Rest of the capital was used to buy animal feed. In a month Suarni spent Rp90,000 (about $10) to buy animal feed. After about 6 months Suarni could sell her raised pigs for a profit of Rp300,000 (about $33)/piece. Loan from DINARI wil be used to add capital to buy pig feedstock and animal feed, with the hope that she could raise more pigs and add profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Suarni adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga dengan 1 orang anak yang baru berumur 5 tahun. Suarni tinggal di sebuah rumah yang bukan miliknya sendiri ( menumpang ). Karena tidak memiliki keahlian lain, Suarni kemudian menjadi peternak babi. Saat ini Suarni memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan 3 ekor penggemukan yang bibitnya dibeli dari modal Rp.2.000.000,- Satu ekor bibit penggemukan harganya Rp. 250.000,- Sisa dari modal tersebut dipakai untuk membeli pakannya. Dalam sebulan Suarni menghabiskan Rp.90.000,- untuk membeli pakan babinya. Setelah ± 6 bulan Suarni menjual babi hasil penggemukannya dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak, dengan harapan dapat memelihara lebih banyak lagi babi dan menambah keuntungan.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Visith

texts.en:
Mr. Visith A. was married in 2005 and now has one daughter. He runs a business planting papaya.  He also assists with silk weaving at home after learning from his wife. His wife first learnt how to weave silk when her mother taught her in 1998, and she has been weaving ever since. 

This is the first time he has asked for a loA. from MAXIMA. He has asked for this $500 to purchase more silk and sewing thread for his wife. Now he cA. weave well himself he would like to set up another loom for himself. With the money that is left over he will buy more papaya seeds to plant in his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and another loom for himself.  He will purchase papaya seeds for his farmland with the remaining money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ruthi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Ruthi S.. She is married with five children, ages 8, 10, 16, 20, and 24. In 2000 Ruth established a farming business. Ruthi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana (her husband is pictured) is 37 years old. She and her husband have four children and live in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Her husband has 5 years of experience running a taxi business.  The family would like a loan of $850 to buy spare parts and improve their taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a taxi business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva Mélendez likes to see her family get ahead in life, which is why twenty years ago, she started selling seasonal items, such as gifts, flowers, and home décor, among other things. Genoveva realized that both her family and living expenses were growing while her husband’s income was insufficient to raise their 4 children. Thanks to Genoveva’s constant struggle to move her business forward, her children are currently receiving an education. Nevertheless, her struggle continues, which is why Genoveva wishes to expand her business.

Genoveva is requesting a loan of $375.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 6 monthly installments. With this money, she will be able to purchase more merchandise, thus increasing her variety. With your help Genoveva will be able to move her family forward and help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva Mélendez, es una mujer a la que le gusta que su familia salga adelante. Es por es que hace 20 años atrás que Genoveva comenzó a vender artículos de temporada como son; regalos, flores, mercancía para adornar las casa entre otras cosas. Genoveva comenzó a ver que su familia crecía y los gastos también, y con lo que gana su esposo no era suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Actualmente Gracias a que Genoveva a luchado por sacar adelante su negocio es que sus hijos se mantienen estudiando. Sin embargo la lucha continua y es por eso que Genoveva desea crecer su negocio.

Genoveva está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Genoveva podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Genoveva podrá sacar a su familia adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try M., age 42, is married with six children and resides in Kampong Cham province with her husband of many years. She and her husband, Ek Sam Eoeun, 44, work to raise the family’s income by making cutting boards and selling them to the market to earn approximately $2.5 of profit per day. One child is a construction worker building a house and makes about $2 a day.
This couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts to stock and resell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts to stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a young, enthusiastic, budding entrepreneur who lives in the Sabana Grande de Boyá community of Monte Plata. She’ll have her Secondary Education certificate in a few months, and she’s ready to study Business Administration at the public university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

To make a living and save money in order to start her studies, Esther sells garments to men of her community. She says that she has a lot of customers, including teachers and students of her school, neighbors that have a good job, and other friends.

With her loan, Esther will buy more goods in order to increase her sales volume, and thus her income. That way, the entrepreneur hopes that she’ll be in a better situation to reach her goals and move ahead.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing to retail in her community.

loans.name: Mony

texts.en: Mrs. Mony K. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a perfume seller in the local market. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Mony K. sells shoes. Previously, Mrs. Mony K. has obtained a loan from AMK to start her two businesses. Her business activities now are improved, so she wants to expand her business; thus, Mrs. Mony K. asked for a loan to purchase more perfume for her customers. The rest of the money would be used to buy more fashionable shoes to resell. Mrs. Mony K. is a widow with four children, one of whom is a driver while one other is working in Korea. A third is studying at a local school, while the youngest child is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more perfume for her customers. The rest of the money would be used to buy more fashionable shoes to resell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a family mom who is always looking for opportunities. She does not let anything go by that could provide daily income for her family. She is 35 years old and has three children, two of which are still very young, which is why a few years ago she decided to contribute to the household income. In order to earn money, she works in various faculties and a year ago established a business selling typical hats of Huancayno. These hats are commonly worn by the local people because they live in a very sunny climate, but also by tourists, who take back to their homes a beautiful Huancayno hat as a reminder of their travels. Jessica sells the hats on foot and desires to grow her business. She needs more capital in order to obtain new hats to sell.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Jessica es una madre de familia que siempre está atenta a las oportunidades, no deja pasar ninguna a fin de que pueda conseguir el sustento diario para los suyos. Tiene actualmente 35 años y tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales son todavía pequeños, por ello, años atrás decidió apoyar en la economía de su hogar, por lo cual emprendió múltiples oficios y desde hace un año se ha establecido en el negocio de la venta de sombreros típicos de Huancayo. Estos sombreros son usados comúnmente por las personas de su localidad, porque tienen un clima soleado y también para los turistas que se llevan a sus ciudades de origen un lindo sombrero huancayno como recuerdo. Actualmente, Jessica los vende de manera ambulante y su deseo es poder crecer en este negocio. Ella necesita incrementar su capital para adquirir nuevos sombreros para la venta.

loans.use: Increased business capital to purchase new hats to sell.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju G. lives in Bagdol. Bagdol is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores.

Mrs. G. has a five-member family, including her, her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Gopal G.. He is a retired army officer. Her daughter is studying in grade 7. Her older son is studying in grade 4 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. G. opened her small restaurant 3 years ago. She sells different types of food items in her cafe. Especially, she sells Nepali food, but she also serves tea and coffee. Now Mrs. G. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to expand her business by purchasing necessary food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her cafe

loans.name: Benkadi (Good Understanding) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (5) membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Djiguissèmè sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et deux (2) enfants. Elles vivent en général dans des ménages monogamiques au quartier Bozo de la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unis par des liens ethnique et professionnel ce groupe de femmes Bozo existe depuis plus de 10 ans .Il exerce le commerce de poissons frais, fumés et séchés.
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela après avoir correctement remboursé les deux premiers prêts.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 563 kg de poissons frais, 21 barres de glace alimentaire et 6 cartons de poissons fumés. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés dans les villages de Mignon et Diado (préfecture de Macina) et en poissons frais à Niono (village de Dora) et sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger auprès des pêcheurs. Pour la glace elle est achetée à Seribala et à Dougabougou. La glace sert à mieux conserver le poisson frais. Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako et sur place à Markala au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes revendeurs venant des grandes villes.
