Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 81.125 FCFA.qui sera utiliser essentiellement pour agrandir la taille de leur activité. Elles ont pour ambition de posséder chacune un congélateur afin de mieux conserver les poissons frais et augmenter ainsi leur marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Benkadi of the association Djiguissèmè are all married with an average age of 41 and on average, two children. They mostly live in monogamous households in the Bozo neigborhood in the Sous-Prefecture Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

United by bonds of ethnicity and profession, this group of Bozo women has been in existence for 10 years. They sell fish--fresh, smoked, and dried.

They are on their third group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, having correctly reimbursed their first two loans.

This new loan will be used to buy 563 kg of fresh fish, 21 blocks of food-grade ice, and 6 cases of smoked fish. They buy their smoked fish in the villages of Mignon and Diado (Macina Prefecture) and their fresh fish in Niono (Dora village) and right in Markala on the banks of the Niger River from the fishermen. As for the ice, they buy it in Seribala and in Dougabougou. The ice is used to preserve the fresh fish. The fish is sold in Bamako and in Markala itself, for cash and rarely on credit to a clientele composed of women and of men who come from the big cities and who re-sell what they buy.

They each hope to make a monthly average profit of 81.125 FCFA which will be used essentially to expand their businesses. Their ambition is to possess, each of them, a freezer so as to better preserve the fresh fish and thus raise their profit margin.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fresh fish, smoked fish, and food-grade ice

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR MIGUEL ANGEL TRABAJA COMO MESERO DE UN FAMOSO 
RESTAURANT SU ESPOSA TRABAJA DE LIMPIEZA EN UN SALON DE EVENTOS, EL Y SU ESPOSA TIENEN DOS HIJOS MENORES PARA LOS CUALES BUSCAN SU PROTECCION ESTAN SOLICITANDO  ESTE PRESTAMO PARA CONSTRUIR UNA BARDA EN SU CASA Y BRINDARLES A SU FAMILIA UN MEJOR MODO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel works as a waiter at a well-known restaurant. His wife is part of the cleaning staff at a conference hall. Together they have two young children. To help protect their children and improve their family's quality of life, they are requesting a loan to pay for the construction of a fence around their house.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una barda

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado con la iniciativa D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo con microcréditos, esperando el desarrollo D. sus negocios.
NORAH Q..- Es la líder del grupo, ella vive en la guardia, Santa Cruz, Bolivia, ella vive en casa propia. Tiene la actividad D. venta D. cosmético ella es ambulante, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
HERLINDA P., ella venD. ropa en el mercado en la misma localidad y también venD. refrescos  en la misma zona, vive en propia casa tiene tres hijos, los cuales son buenos estudiantes, y la aydan en su trabajo. 
ARMINDA E., es la tesorera del Banco comunal, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos ella  tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en la casa familiar y su esposo trabaja D. ayudante D. chofer y ella sueña con tener su propio taxi. El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
A group formed with the goal of increasing working capital with microcredit, hoping for the success of their businesses. NORAH Q. is the leader of the group. She lives in La Guardia, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives in her own home. She works selling cosmetics on foot, and this credit is needed to invest in her business to increase her capital. And with the savings that she has accumulated over time she wants to have a little store in her neighbourhood. HERLINDA P. sells clothes in the market in a fixed location and she also sells soft drinks in the same place. She lives in her own home and has three children, who are good students, and they help her with the work. ARMINDA E. is the treasurer of the community bank. She works selling cosmetics. She has four children. She lives in her family’s home and her husband works as an assistant of a driver. She dreams to have her own taxi. The business that she currently has is on foot and, similar to the other members of the group, with time she wants to have a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mirenda Akoko

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoko Mirenda est née le 8 juillet en 1981 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité, la vente de jus de fruit dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2003.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter un congélateur pour que ses produits soient fraiches afin de mieux servir les clients.
texts.en:
Mirenda Akoko A. was born on July 8, 1981 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is a single mother of one child. Mirenda Akoko sells fruit juice in the Agoè quarter to the north of Lomé, and has been in this business since 2003. The loan she is requesting, her first, would allow her to purchase a freezer to keep her products fresh and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is a 30-year-old married woman with three children living in District 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  Her husband sells vegetables from a cart and she works as a tailor.

Seema is asking for a loan of US$850 (40000 AFN) to buy more vegetables for her husband and a sewing machine for her business, hoping that the investment will bring them greater success.  She wants to thank Kiva for this loan process that helps the poor all around the world.  She is happy with her relationship with both Kiva and AFSG and she thanks all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Humilité Group

texts.en: Mbenza sells fresh fish, manioc and corn flour. He has been in business since 1977. He started selling spare car parts in Matadi in Lower Congo which is about 350 km from Kinshasa. His first business was prosperous, but collapsed due to the currency devaluation that took place in 1981. He lost about $200 of his running capital. He then went to work for a company until 2005. He stopped working and relunched his own business. His business makes about $120 per week. Mbenza planned with the first loan from Hope to diversify his business by buying palm oil. He has two points of sale within his community in order to make more income.  His dream is to open a large general boutique. Mbenza is 55 years old, married and a father of four children between the ages of 3 and 34.  Of his children, one is already married, one is at secondary school, and two at primary school. Through his business, Mbenza has been able to support his family. He also likes it because it gives him the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients he is able to offer them quality products at a better price. His plan is to open a storage depot.

loans.use: To purchase two containers of palm oil

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: A sus 48 años, Teófila ha luchado mucho para tener una buena vida, vive con su esposo en un cuarto alquilado y anhela con todas sus fuerzas tener un futuro prometedor. Ella es una muy buena vendedora de pan, hace los panes más deliciosos del mercado Laykakota (Mercado muy conocido de la ciudad de Puno), le gusta conversar con sus vecinas, pero detesta vender en los días de lluvia, puesto que su mercadería termina mojada, ella es conciente que para salir adelante tiene que trabajar mucho y ya lleva 10 años en este cansado trabajo. Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda donde vender sus panes y otros productos, además brindarles mayores comodidades a sus clientes, no decae en su afán de sobresalir en la vida y tiene la esperanza de que si se esfuerza mucho lo logrará. Siendo éste el segundo préstamo al que accede en MFP, se siente con la responsabilidad de cancelar todas sus cuotas, es por eso que todos los días ahorra un poco de sus ventas, además que tiene una responsabilidad con su banco comunal. Teófila utilizará todo el dinero del préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para sus panes, comprará azúcar, harina, levadura, etc.
texts.en:
At 48 years old, Teófila has fought to have a good life. She lives with her husband in a rented room, and has longed with all her power to have a promising future. She is a successful bread salesperson, making the most delicious breads in the Laykakota Market (a well-known market in the city of Puno).

She likes to converse with her neighbors, but she hates to sell her breads when it's raining, because the market always ends up getting wet. She knows that to succeed she needs to work very hard and she already has 10 years of experience in this tiring business. In the future, she'd like to have a store where she could sell her breads and other products, and also offer more amenities to her clients. Her enthusiasm for succeeding in life does not fade, and she has hope that with hard work, she will achieve success.

As this is her second loan with MFP (a Kiva partner) and because she has a relationship with her community bank, Teófila feels the responsibility to repay each of her installments. Because of this, she saves a little of the profits from her sales each day. She will use all of the money from the loan to buy ingredients for her breads: sugar, flour, yeast, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas 1 Group

texts.en: Mujeres Decididas 1 is a group of 5 borrowers all trying to receive their first loan with Esperanza International. Each member is hoping to take out a small loan and start their very own small business. Lucy A. is the representative of this group, and a great leader with the group. Lucy is the mother of 2 very young children and knows that this is her chance to provide them with a better life. She always dreamed of providing her children with a good education. Right now Lucy is having a hard time feeding both children and does not have a steady income. She is hoping to start a small store selling all sorts of goods. She feels like she is ready to start something of her own and start making her own money. She is very excited about this opportunity and is going to make the most of it!  Thanks for all your support!!

loans.use: Buy products for small store

loans.name: Oluwatosin

texts.en: Oluwatosin is a trained nurse and she sells medicine. She is 54 years old and is a widow with four children. Oluwatosin needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Bathangay

texts.en:
S. Bathangay is 34, married and the father of a two-year-old daughter. Batghangay's family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In 2004, he participated in a cobbler training program at the center of his province. Since then, together with his spouse Munhtuya, he has been running a shoe repair shop. In 2007, with their profit, they bought a shop and moved to a new home close by. S. has many repeat customers partly due to his humble personality.

Bathangay's family lives in a "ger" (traditional Mongolian housing tent) district on rental land. Soon he and his wife would like to own a plot of land. With this loan, Bathangay will buy shoe repair supplies.

loans.use: To buy shoe repair supplies.

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma R. manages a small sari-sari store. She is 50 years old, married and has no children yet. She was tired of just staying in the house and earning nothing. She wanted to help her husband. That is why she started to establish a small store and sell various kinds of goods like rice, sardines, package goods, soaps and other items. Now, she her business is growing and well established.

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will truly help her increase her income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Akouwa M. est une femme de 55 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est tient le commerce de divers articles exposés sur une étagère. Ce commerce est la source de ses revenus. Akouwa souhaite avec ce fonds acheter des marchandises qui lui permettront de d’augmenter ses recettes et par conséquent améliorer se conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Akouwa M. is a 55-year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She is the owner of a business selling various goods displayed on a rack. This business is her source of revenues. She would like to use this loan to buy merchandise that will enable her to increase her receipts and consequently to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya B. lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter goes to a local kindergarten. He has a small business selling food. He owns a small food store on the busiest street in Arhanghay. He sells various food products, including wheat products, soft drinks, and candies. He mostly purchases his food products from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 with 700,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,400 MNT) and his business capital has now increased to 4,000,000 MNT. In the future, he hopes to expand his food store by adding more food items. Enhtuya requests a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase food products for his business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 64 años y 7 hijos, Julia es panificadora, tiene un horno artesanal D. leña en su casa, en donD. elabora panes típicos como la chapla, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado cercano a su casa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, azúcar y levadura.
Los sueños D. Julia son educar a su ultima hija y comprar maquinas para implementar su panadería.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Julia is married, 64 years old, and has 7 children. Julia makes bread, and has a handcrafted wood oven in her home where she makes traditional breads like Chapla. She carries out her sales in the market near her house. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, and yeast. Julia’s dreams are to educate her last daughter and to purchase machinery to open a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Tareap Doun village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Sokhom C. is the 41-year-old village bank president. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Orn davy, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish from other people to resell and earn more profits. She has three children who are attending the local school.

Mrs. Chanroen S. did not come in perS. to take a loan but her husband was there, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more fish from other people to resell and earn more profits

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is 39 years old and married to Bartonjo Kiptala who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. Monica has a poultry business which is located in Sertwet at Kiptala Bartonjo farm within Eldoret Town. Monica practices poultry farming with a local breed of chicken and sells her eggs to Kipchamo Primary Boarding School. She has been in the poultry business for the past six years now. Monica was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who is already a client with KADET. With this loan from KADET, she intends to buy more broiler chickens and to improve the roofing on the poultry house. In future, Monica intends to diversify and grow her business; she wants to rear more broiler chickens for meat, and begin large-scale manure production. Monica hopes that the profit from her business will allow her to pay for a university or college education for her children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens, and iron sheeting to improve the roofing on the poultry house

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Three years ago, Sofia opened a general store. Having been a member of ASHI since 2000, she was able to borrow business capital in order to start her general store. Her husband's income from farming, which was the initial business they supported with their first loans, had been the family's other source of income until the present. 

To enhance her business, Sofia wishes to borrow money from ASHI. With that she will be able to buy the necessary equipment that would complete the service her store gives to people - like selling cold beverages and other frozen foods.

Sofia is happy and glad because she has the capacity now to grow a business. However, during her life she has regretted being poor. None of her four children have reached college. Although they now have their own family and their own sources of income, Sofia wants to establish a stable business which her children and grandchildren can inherit when she passes away, since their livelihoods are sporadic. With loans she gets from ASHI she will be able to continue to enhance her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her general store.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok I is a villager in Hang Heng Village in Takeo Province. She owns a grocery store. Her husband, Mr. En Khun, is a construction worker. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer or rice seed, or to hire laborers to work in his field. Thus, Mrs. Sok I has decided to request a loan for this purpose. She will use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom attend the local school. The others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. is a 55 years old man who is married to Mary Waithera. Together they have three children (two boys and one girl) who all go to school. 

Francis has been operating a retail shop selling different things for the last nine years within Naivasha town. He got to know about KADET through a marketing and promotion activity that was done by KADET staff in the town.

Francis been able to service two loans without any default and he will now be appliying for his third round. Francis will use this loan to expand his shop and boost his stock.

His future aspiration is to have a wholesale shop, buy a plot and build rental houses to boost his income.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Expanding and boosting his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Mariama Soukho

texts.fr: Mariama Soukho K. est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Elle a eu à y bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Avec son crédit elle fabrique et vend de la glace et de la crème glacée. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Soukho K. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children whom she supports.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years and has benefited from six loans, which she always repaid regularly.  With her current loan, she is making and selling ice and ice cream.  She contributes to improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.en:
Carmen sells clothing and gold and silver jewelry on foot. A good business woman, Carmen has established clients to whom she offers credit lines and she collects weekly payments. This loan of 10,000 gold cordobas (NIO) will be used to buy more merchandise.

Carmen reports that the microfinance services of Fundación Leon 2000 have greatly helped her to improve her business and allowed her to better her living situation. She is 47 years old, married, and has an 8 year old.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Miracle

texts.en: Miracle sells iced and smoked fish in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The demands for her fish are high in her community and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a major fish distributor in Benin City. She is a friendly and a hard working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 42 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of fish

loans.name: Akouvi Florence

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la coiffure et en 2004, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion de son foyer. Ses clientes apprécient la qualité de ses services ; elle en profite pour vendre aussi des mèches à des prix concurrentiels. En ce moment elle a besoin d’acheter des mèches et tissages pour renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This woman learned how to style hair, and in 2004 she opened her own salon in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.  This business enables her not only to support herself but also to do her financial share in managing her home.  Her customers appreciate the quality of her services;  she uses this advantage to sell hair extensions too, at competitive prices.  At this time, she needs to buy some hair extensions and weaves to replenish her low inventory.   For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES.  She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.
Ekua works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with stew. She buys bags of rice from nearby towns. Ekua has been in business for nine years, and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 35 years old and is married with five children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Queen sells VCDs and is happy that her business is doing well. She is also a hairstylist and she sells groceries. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a better education for her children.

Queen is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Queen is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Eduardito Group

texts.es: El grupo Eduardito está comformado por Xiomara G. quien tiene un taxi y vende ropa, Fátima F. quien administra un kiosco en el monte Sinaí y Xiomara Montes tiene una barbería. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que lo que más desean es ayudar en su hogar.
texts.en:
The "Eduardito" group is comprised of Xiomara G., who has a taxi service and sells clothing; Fátima F., who runs a kiosk in Mount Sinai; and Xiomara Montes, who has a barber shop. They are hard-working women who want more than anything to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to a taxi and to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	El señor Luis Alberto V. es trabajador de Universidad FAREM Esteli desempeñándose como conductor.
Luis va usar el crédito para compra de medicamento ya que tiene a su madre en mal estado de salud y también para pagar una deuda personal.
El quiere con el medicamento se  pueda recuperar el estado de salud de su madre y poder cancelar su deuda y solo quedar con la del crédito.
Luis es casado y tiene dos hijo a su cargo y ambos en edad escolar este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel el cual le han permitido hacer algunas mejora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto V. works with the University FAREM Esteli as a driver. Luis is going to use the loan to buy medicine for his mother who is in poor health. He will also use it to pay for his personal debt. He wants to have the medicine so his mother's health can improve and to be able to cancel his debt and only have to pay off this loan. Luis is married and has two school-age children. This is his second loan with Ceprodel, which has allowed him to make small improvements in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicine and paying back a loan

loans.name: An

texts.en: K. An, 66, is a widow and lives with her son in the Takeo province. Her son is married already but, so far, her son still lives with her. Since 1980, she has been making and selling palm cakes in the village and is able to make about US$2 of profit a day. Her son, Sem Boren, is a construction worker. On average, he makes US$2 per day as well. K. An is asking for a loan of US$700 so that she can start a new business for her daughter in law. She wants her daughter to operate a grocery store. (K. An is pictured with her son)

loans.use: To operate a grocery store.

loans.name: Manith

texts.en:
Mrs. Manith K. (pictured above), 45, and her husband, Mr. Senghorn Toun, 41, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the daughters weaves silk at home and the other two attend school.     

Manith has been a silk weaver for 10 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a security guard for five months.
Manith is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria S. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 46 years old. Gloria is married and has 6 adult children. Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) where she sells food & daily use products. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
Yayah J. is a businessman who owns a pharmacy along the Old Koribondo Road in the city of Bo. His pharmacy is registered and licensed through the Pharmacy Board of Sierra Leone to sell drugs.

Yayah is married with four children. His wife assists him in the pharmacy when he goes out to sell in the neighboring villages where he has customers. He is very committed to his business.

Yayah is in need of a loan to buy more drugs to satisfy his customers and hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to buy a motorbike to use when distributing his stock to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for increased sales

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy Y. is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Daeum Pring village in Kandal province. She is a fishnet seller and her husband, Mr. Cheng Koy, is a fisherman. With both businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Channy Y. is now requesting a loan to buy more fishnets to enlarge her husband's business. With this loan, she hopes to increase their income to improve their standard of living. This couple has five children: two are laborers, while the other three are students in the local school and also support their parents' business.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Eusebio Freddy

texts.es: EL SEÑOR EUSEBIO  ES UN CLIENTE ANTIGUO,  HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD   EN LOS PAGOS DE SUS CREDITOS,EL CLIENTE TRABAJA CON SU TAXI EN TODA LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, EMPIEZA SU LABOR A LAS 6:00 am Y LA TERMINA A LAS 20:00 APROXIMADA MENTE, LA ESPOSA SRA. PASTORA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA FERIA DE LA 16 DE JULIO LOS JUEVES Y DOMINGOS DONDE LA GENTE SE REUNE A REALIZAR SUS COMPRAS Y A DEGUSTAR LA VARIEDAD DE PLATOS QUE OFRECEN, EL MAYOR SUEÑO DE LA FAMILIA ES LLEGAR A TENER SU CASA, POR LO QUE SE ESFUERZAN EN LOGRARLO, TRABAJAM DURO, EL SR. EUSEBIO AYUDA TAMBIEN A SU ESPOSA EN LA VENTA DE COMIDAS YA QUE ESOS 2 DIAS DE FERIA TIENE BUENA VENTA Y NECESITA AYUDA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO EL SR. EUSEBIO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA QUE SU ESPOSA ELABORE SUS RIQUISIMAS COMIDAS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio is a long-standing client and has shown himself to be responsible about repaying his loans. He works as a cab driver in and around the city of El Alto. He starts work at 6:00am and finishes around 8:00pm. His wife, Sra. Pastora, earns money selling food in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. People congregate in the market to buy what they need and enjoy the variety of dishes for sale. The family's greatest dream is to build a house of their own, a dream that they work for with all their might. Sr. Eusebio helps his wife with food sales because she sells a lot on market days and needs his help. With the money from the loan, Sr. Eusebio will buy the supplies that his wife needs to make her delicious meals. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: La Fuerza 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group La Fuerza (the force), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple, rented structure with her husband and three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling water and ice by purchasing a freezer to keep her wares cold. She will use the profits to save towards the day when she can move from her rented home into her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 33 años, es un padre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Yeny (27) y sus 3 pequeños hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Con muchas ganas de trabajar Raúl sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente plantaciones de café y plátano, productos que vienen a comprarle personal de cooperativas de la ciudad, debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, y considera que lo más difícil es tener que fumigar sus tierras, ya que las plagas perjudicarían sus cultivos. Para más adelante, espera que su producción mejore en cantidad, pues de eso dependen los ingresos económicos de su familia.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, esta muy satisfecho de haberlo obtenido y promete  pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, además en su banco comunal es un integrante muy querido.Raúl tiene planeado invertir los mil nuevos soles solicitados en la compra de más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 years old and is a very happy father and worker. He lives in his own home with his wife Yeny (27) and their three small children, who are the principal motivation for all of his efforts. Having strong work ethic, Raúl goes out every day to cultivate their land. He mainly has coffee and banana plantations. Because of the high quality of his products, his buyers include staff from urban cooperatives. What he likes most about his work is cultivating his land. He has 15 years of experience doing this and believes that the most difficult part is having to spray the crops in order to prevent pests from harming them. In the future, he hopes to see an increase in the quantity of production, given this is what his family's income depends on. Raúl plans to use the requested $375 to buy additional compost for his crops, making it possible for them to yield greater quantities. He is a very valued member of his community bank. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very pleased to have received it and is committed to making all payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase compost for his crops

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Mark F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Mother Blessing'. He is 25 years old, married, and has one child who is three years old. He was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For 9 years, Mark has been selling soap, body crème, shampoo, hair grease and powder in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, body crème, shampoo, hair grease and powder. He describes himself as kind and easy-going. His dream is to expand his business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nowah is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more soap, body crème, shampoo, hair grease and powder

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng Y., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. Y. charges batteries at home, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a mechanic and earns an income of USD 5 per day. 

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more tools to repair cars and improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy car repair tools to improve the business

loans.name: Merly's Group

texts.en: Merly J. is from Bagong Silang, Santiago City. She is 51 years old and is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Merly J.. Merly is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Merly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Merly is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merly from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Kashifa

texts.en:
Kashifa is the wife of G. M. and resides in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. Kashifa is an educated 37-year-old lady. She has completed her education until the 8th standard and couldn’t study further due to the poor financial condition of her family. She got married a few years ago and started taking care of her husband’s family. Her husband and his family respect her a lot for her calm nature and good behavior.  

Her husband has a business renting motorbikes. He gives motorbikes on rent to people and charges them based on the hours they keep the motorbike. His business is going well nowadays. He has two bikes currently but wants to buy another motorbike to increase his income. Therefore, Kashifa has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. With the loan, her husband will buy another motorbike and use it in his business to generate more income. The increased income will help him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie F. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 40 years-old. Elsie is separated from her spouse and has one child. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling both food anddaily use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Meggy

texts.en:
Meggy is a single woman who has been operating her business selling bananas and green vegetables for the last five years. She sells to her neighbours, wholesale, retail, at the market, door to door and from home. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a dairy cow, to start selling milk as another source of income.  Meggy faces a major challenge of transportation and theft in her business.

She hopes to be a dairy farmer in future. Her major goal of working with Yehu is to get a loan and uplift her standard of living. She lives at a rental house with electricity and piped water.

Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk

loans.name: Mariama Cire

texts.fr:
Mariama Ciré D. est une femme de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ADIAF depuis le 28 juin 2008. Elle a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits (denrées alimentaires et produits cosmétiques) 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses recettes financières. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
Mariama Ciré D. is a 25-year old woman. She is married and the mother of three. She joined Banc Villageois of ADIAF on June 28, 2008. She obtained loans four times in the past and never had any problems with repayment.
She keeps a store in which she sells a variety of goods (food products and cosmetics). Her new loan will allow her to boost her stock level in order to increase her income. Her goal it to contribute to the family budget and to provide for her own personal needs.

loans.use: Growing and promoting her business

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 28 years old. Julieto is single. To make a living, Julieto owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Julieto has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julieto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieto is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Julieto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Nicholas Mutuku

texts.en:
Nicholas Mutuku aged 44 years, sells used and new tyres in Umoja innercore. He is married to Damaris Nthenya and together they have three children,  a daughter aged 17 and two sons aged 14 and five years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by other Kadet clients.

Umoja innercore is a well-populated area and Nicholas has many clients. His business of 11 years gives him a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000, and with the loan he wants to buy more tyres, rims and tubes. If the loan boosts the business, Nicholas plans to open another shop in the surrounding estates.

Nicholas, who describes himself as honest and hard-working, has great dreams of growing his business to many shops which will enable him to give better education to his children and attain a higher standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy tyres, tubes and rims

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
The young woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Suos S., 24 years old, who lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She is employed in a garment factory that is full of garment workers. She generates a profit approximately of US $3.00 a day to help pay for her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Her husband also works as garment worker and has a fixed salary per month. This couple has only one child who lives with them.

Mrs. Suos S. will be using her loan to buy some soil that will be used to raise the low part of her house, which is lower than street. This is loan will provide for her and family and help them to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy soil to raise the low part of her house, which is lower than street.

loans.name: Yelitza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yelitza; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene una combi que hace servicio público, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7.00 p.m, por medio de este negocio ella está ahorrando para poder estudiar, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de combi. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yelitza is a member of the “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Yelitza is 23 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  She has a minibus which she uses to provide a public transport service.  She works from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  Through her business, she is saving up so that she can study.  She would like to improve her minibus service and is requesting this loan so that she can have maintenance work done on her vehicle.

She would like to thank those who will take part in her dream by helping to fund her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on her vehicle

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. A. is a married woman who lives in 110, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a food-vending business and a farm. Her husband, Cornelio, who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 21 and 40 years old. 

Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, with which she intends to buy stock for the general store and fertilizers for her rice and corn plantation so that she can continue to save for future improvements to the businesses. 

Delia D. A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends the Mongolian State University of Education in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, while her other two daughters attend a local secondary school.
Erdenechimeg operates a clothing sales business in her province. She started her business in 2003 selling a small number of products. After years of successful operation, her working capital has doubled in size. She hopes to continue her business success. Erdenechimeg is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Belisario; el tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos y también se dedica a ser chofer brindando servicio urbano y su esposa se dedica a la venta de los anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de anticuchos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los anticuchos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco District in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mr. Belisario is 27 years old and lives in a common-law arrangement and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling "anticuchos" (skewered meat) and he also works as a driver offering service in the city.  His wife also peddles anticuchos.  

The member wants to expand his anticucho business.  He plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for the anticuchos.

Belisario is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "anticuchos" (skewered grilled meat)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. She has worked as a photographer for more than 10 years. In 2004, she decided to open a small photography shop and began her own camera work. She helps her husband who works in the car mechanics field with the family income. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new camera so that she can do her work competently by taking professional pictures and as a result increase the number of her clients and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima S. is from the village of Mambatangan, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Fatima is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fatima raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Fatima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Fatima is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fatima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lawrence Ndiritu

texts.en:
Lawrence Ndiritu K. owns a retail shop in Bamburi, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last two years, and he earns a good income. He is 28 years old, married and the father of one child. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., with which he plans to purchase more stock of rice, flour and sugar and packets of sweets for sale.        

Lawrence intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plough back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, flour and sugar and packets of sweets

loans.name: Mélégan

texts.fr: Madame Mélégan est mariée et a 31 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants. Pour aider son mari au foyer, elle vend les sacs en détail  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle a commencé son activité  en 2003 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Elle espère augmenter son commerce et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mrs. Mélégan, age 31, is married and has two children to support. To help her husband meet the household expenses, she retails bags at the Grand Market in Lomé. She started this business in 2003, and gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She's seeking a loan in hopes of bolstering her business.

loans.use: to buy bags

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 46 years old and married with four children.  Two of the children are in school. Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Sally has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, curls, candies etc. 

Sally would like all her children to finish a college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Rebeca R. y Maria Vidalia S., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18 (Diez y ocho) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La sra. Maria Vicia se dedica a la produccion y venta de queso, y en algunas ocasiones vende también leche, ella es una mujer muy esmerada en su labor, es destacada por esa caracteristica por todos los que la conocen, su familia lucha contra la pobreza cada día y ella desea con fe poder salir de esa situacion por ello trabaja arduamente.
Solicita el préstamo para adquirir leche y herramientas para la produccion de queso, confia plenamente en que los inversionistas van a apoyarla, tanto a ella como a su grupo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Rebeca R. and Maria Vidalia S..  They approached the Fundación Paraguaya office to get involved in the Women Entrepreneurs Program.  They invited their friends and neighbors and decided to work together to get ahead and improve their quality of life.  There are 18 humble, working women in this group that must earn a living each day. 

Maria Vicia is dedicated to the production and sale of cheese. On some occasions she also sells milk.  She is known for being very careful with her work.  Her family fights against poverty every day and she has faith she will overcome this situation by working hard.  Maria is requesting this loan to buy more milk and tools for producing cheese.  She has faith that the investors will support both her and her group.

loans.use: to buy milk and tools for the production of cheese

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam A. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños que están a su cuidado, ella está casada con el señor Ronal Terceros. Ellos viven en la zona de Maica Central de la ciudad de Cochabamba; gracias a su esfuerzo al menos tienen un techo donde pueden protegerse y vivir dignamente con toda su familia.
Miriam trabaja extrayendo leche de sus vaquitas, trabaja fuertemente todos los días y tiene que caminar mucho para que pueda vender su producto. 
Miriam  necesita el préstamo para que pueda comprar alimento y forraje para su ganado debido a que las malas condiciones climáticas hicieron que muera una de sus vacas, es por esto que ella quiere dar una mejor alimentación  a su ganado; ella está agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con dinero para que pueda alimentar mejor a sus vacas y estás no mueran.
Miriam entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que realice mejoras en su vivienda
texts.en:
Miriam A. is 30 years old; she has two small children in her care.  She’s married to Mr. Ronal Terceros and they live in Cochabamba’s Maica Central zone.  Thanks to their efforts they at least have a roof over their heads to protect themselves and live with dignity together with their family.

Miriam works milking cows.  She works hard every day and has to walk much to be able to sell her product.  She needs the loan to buy feed and forage for her cattle because the bad weather conditions caused the death of one of her cows so she wants to feed the remaining ones better.  She is grateful to people who, through Kiva, provide the opportunity to have funds that will allow her to better nourish her cows so that they won’t die.

Among Miriam’s future plans is taking out a new loan to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 55 years old and married. He does welding to earn a living. Daniel has employed two people to assist him in his tasks. He works hard in his business and ensures that his children get a quality education.  

Daniel decided to join Faulu Kenya so that he would get business loans. He has also benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management. This has helped him to grow his business. He wants a 20,000 KES loan to buy iron sheeting.

loans.use: To buy iron sheeting.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 53 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec  ses  enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye  de la préfecture de Koutiala.  
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire des études, elle s’est vite intéressée au commerce de diverses marchandises et finalement à la transformation du noix de néré en Sounbala. Elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 30 ans.  Elle reçoit d’importantes commandes à travers ses clients à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur du pays. 
Pour pouvoir combattre les petits ruptures qu’elle subit, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle  il y a 7 ans.  Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) tous correctement  payés, elle est à son  8ème prêt individuel et  les sept précédents ont été bien payés. 
Elle compte acheter, 10 sacs de noix de néré avec ce prêt, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente à Bamako (capitale Mali) et à l’extérieur du pays à une clientèle composée  de femmes  et hommes au comptant  à crédit. Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage d’utiliser  pour payer les intérêts du prêt de Soro, prendre en charge sa famille comme elle est veuve. Très courageuse et motivée, Mme compte toujours sur les financements de Soro  pour l’agrandissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a 53 year old widow and the mother of three children.  She lives with her children in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala prefecture.  Not having had the opportunity to attend school, she quickly became interested in selling various merchandise, finally deciding to make Sounbala (a condiment) from néré nuts.  She has operated this business for more than 30 years.  She gets sizable orders from her clients inside and outside the country.  Seven years ago, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to overcome breakdowns (in supplies) that she encountered, and thereby to keep her clients satisfied.  After eight solidarity (group) loans, all of which have been fully repaid, she is on her eighth individual loan and the seven preceding loans have been fully repaid.

She intends to buy 10 bags of néré nuts with this loan.  She gets her supplies at the Koutiala Grand Market and sells her goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) and outside the country to a clientele composed of men and women in cash and by credit.  With her working capital bolstered, she estimates that she will earn an average profit of 150,000 CFA per month that she plans to use to pay the interest on the Soro loan and to support her family, as she is a widow.  Very courageous and motivated, she always depends on the Soro financing to build her business.

loans.use: To buy néré nuts for making Sounbala

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 42 years of age and married with five children. Lusia has a banana plantation. She has many years of experience in this business. Lusia needs a loan of 1000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. 

She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas, or about $104 US per week) to improve and expand the business. 

In 2011, Lusia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lusia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong, 48 years old, is a villager living in the Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with five children, and her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. Presently, Mrs. Duong sells lotus flowers, which she buys in bulk from her supplier. Her husband always picks up the flowers for her before he starts his taxi service. The family's house has recently had many things break down. Therefore, Mrs. Duong has decided to seek a loan of $1100 from Kiva, which she will use to repair her broken house.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has a shop that sells a variety of fish like milk fish and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. Janet is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Janet has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell. In the future, Janet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a focused and hardworking 67-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with grown-up children. For the last 30 years, he has been carrying out farming, especially tree seedlings. He also makes extra coins by making traditional stools to meet the needs of his family more comfortably. He wants in the next five years to have prospered and to be the supplier of seedlings to various institutions. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. He bought two dairy cows with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 53-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. She has 3 children. Mai’s spouse works as a painter. Mai has been in the business of selling rice for 6 years. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of rice to sell. Mai hopes her business will run smoothly and help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Marko

texts.en:
Marko is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a green grocer business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry hot season when the availability of green groceries is lower. He dreams of establishing a wholesale green grocer shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Sara Adelina

texts.es: Sara Adelina: de 26 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta y elavoracion de tejidos tipicos,desde hace varios años,ella nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos,ya que nos dice que sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente,el sueño de ella es agrandar mas sus ventas y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Sara Adelina:  26 years old, she makes and sells typical fabrics, for several years now.  She tells us that she requests this loan to purchase raw materials to make textiles, since she tells us that her sales have increased significantly.  Her dream is to increase her sales and help her family.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make textiles.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia esta agradecida por su cooperación en los dos créditos anteriores los cuales ha invertido en su negocio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en un nuevo negocio de venta de productos de belleza en comprar (cosméticos, perfumes de dama y caballero) ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, ya que sus clientes le solicitaron mas productos. 
Doña Natalia planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que los gastos familiares y escolares de su hija se encargara su esposo el señor Fernando quien trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener mas ingreso a la familia, para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos.
texts.en:
Natalia is grateful for your cooperation with her previous two loans, which she has invested in her business.

She is asking for a loan to invest in a new business selling beauty products (cosmetics, ladies' and gentlemen's perfumes), since she doesn't have the money necessary for the investment, and her clients are asking her for more products.

Natalia plans to pay back the loan with the earnings from her business, since family expenses and school expenses for her daughter will be the responsibility of her husband, Fernando, who works as a truck driver.

She wants to improve her business and earn more for her family, in order to help her husband with the expenses.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is taking a bigger Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to establish another business of selling milk to her neighbours and students at a nearby school. With the loan, she intends to purchase a freezer for storing milk and packets of milk for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing milk and packets of milk for sale.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo no Distrito de Boane quando contraiu matrimonio, é comerciante ha mais de 14 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, cervejas amendoim e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Hamida was born in the district of Homoine, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children who are still in school. She went to school through sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports three nephews who live with them.

She left Inhambane for Maputo in the district of Boane when she got married. She's had a shop for more than 14 years and earns about 15,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan from Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 metials, which she will use to purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer, and so on) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She is committed to paying off this loan in full and on time, and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer, and so on) to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine, who is 35 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, and is the mother of three children, one of whom is in high school while the other two are in elementary grades. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college — a dream for most Filipino parents like Geraldine as she herself was only a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Geraldine operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs from those round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Geraldine dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. And she also wants to have her own warehouse for the rugs that she is selling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Joselyn Elizabeth

texts.es:
Joselyn de 19 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Guasmo”. Una joven emprendedora que quiere salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios. Tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio, ya que el negocio de ella es la venta de cloro.

La dificultad de ella es que no tiene los ingredientes necesario para la elaboración del cloro. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para su negocio como cloro, desinfectante, detergente en paquetes para venderlos por fundas y tambien confites para venderle a sus proveedores y para aumentar su negocio. Su sueño es buscar un local donde ella pueda comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Joselyn, 19, lives in suburban area called “Guasmo”. She is a young entrepreneur who wants to get ahead with God’s help. She aspires to expand her business, which is selling cleaning products.

Her difficulty is that she does not have the necessary supply of cleaning products. She is requesting a loan to buy products for her business such as bleach, disinfectant and detergent by the case in order to sell them in packets. She will also purchase candy from suppliers to sell and thus expand her business. Her dream is to look for a shop where she can market her products.

loans.use: to buy products such as bleach, disinfectant and candy.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a widowed woman with five children, four of whom are enrolled in school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mupa has operated a retail shop for the past thirteen years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Bolorkhorloo

texts.en:
Bolorkhorloo is a 29-year-old, hard-working woman who lives with her husband and children in the outer 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children, ages 3 and 5, attend local kindergarten while her husband works as a tractor-trailer driver at a local company. 

After working as a saleswoman for five years, Bolorkhorloo decided to start her own business in an indoor market called Tumen Plaza. She mostly sells women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. As the market is located in a very busy shopping area, her business makes outstanding revenue. 

Bolorkhorloo is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to import more clothes for the upcoming season because the New Year holiday is a high shopping season. She is a responsible client of our institution who repaid her previous loans successfully and on time. Bolor is working hard to improve her family’s living standards so her children can enjoy a safe and good quality of life as they grow.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal, 48, has been farming for close to 20 years. He plies his trade in Mpigi. The widower and father of eight grows and sells cash crops, such as coffee, sugarcane, maize, and bananas. He supplements his income by raising pigs.

What explains his longevity in this business? Pascal says it’s through purposefulness and hard work that he has managed to keep his business afloat. In addition, the crops he grows sell well, which helps to explain his long tenure in the business. Though he has made great progress, Pascal is still hell-bent on greater success. His determination will come in handy. In the near future, he hopes to expand his pig husbandry business

Pascal intends to use his Kiva loan to purchase high-grade manure to apply to his crops.
