loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and married to Bernard. They have two children.

She has been into her business for the last three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from this business. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell and in the future, to have a stock of cereals.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Nesima

texts.en:
Nesima is single and works hard to support her family. She has a loading business in the Philippines and requested a 4000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional load wallets to sell.

Nesima has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear. In the future, Nesima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional load wallets to sell.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 35 years old, married with five children.

Jacquelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jacquelyn has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell ready to wear clothing.

Jacquelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.en:
My name is Ana F., I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for about 3 years, and I sell to several markets and small stores in the area, which helps me support my family. My goal is to be able to hire other people so that production and sales keep growing. I will use the profit from my sales to remodel my one room house and give my children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ana F. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, y mis ventas las realizo en varios negocios como ser mercaditos y pulperias de la localidad, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia, mi meta es poder darle trabajo a otras personas para que mi produccion aumente y tambien las ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darle un mejor estudios a mi hijos.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, salt, lime, water, matches, wood, coal.

loans.name: Sohar Gricelda

texts.en:
My name is Sohar, and I sell dry wood to my neighbors. In our community we use ovens to cook our food, tortillas, etc. For us it is cheaper to use ovens (not stoves), and this helps us conserve energy. My biggest clients are the people dedicated to manufacturing and selling tortillas. I need to maintain a great amount of wood, and buying in large quantity is cheaper. In this way I can obtain greater revenues to help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Me llamo Sohar y me dedico a la venta de lena seca a mis vecinos, en nuestra comunidad usamos fogones para cocinar nuestros alimentos, las tortillas y otros. Para nosotros es mucho mas barato usar fogones que estufas y nos ayuda en la economia de nuestros hogares. Mis mayores clientes son las personas que se dedican a elaborar y vender tortillas es por lo que necesito mantener un buen numero de lena y comprando por cantidades grandes es mas barato, asi puedo obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase firewood.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Juana Francisca, and I am a businessperson. I have a small grocery store in my home. I have dedicated myself for two years to this type of work, which permits me to obtain income and help with the expenses of my family. In this way I can offer my children a better quality of life. My children help me in their free time.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Hola mi nombre es Juana Francisca, soy comerciante, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me permite obtener imgresos, para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y de esa forma poder ofrecer a mis hijos un mejor nivel de vida. cuento con la colaboracion de mis hijos en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, chicken, toilet paper, coffee, and dairy products

loans.name: Anadilia

texts.en:
Anadilia is a single woman with 3 children. She lives in a small community called "Los Casabe" in the city of Santo Domingo.

She started working in her business 5 years ago; before that it was her mother's. She works in an establishment where she sells chicken, drinks and other foodstuff to the people in her neighborhood. She is also a teacher and works for the "Secretaria de Educacion" part-time.

loans.use: To paint the establishment and buy more chicken

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Mrs. Nen L. (21) and her husband live in the Siem Reap province with their child. They work selling hardware items, earning about $5 a day between them. Mrs. Nen L. is applying for this loan in order to purchase more hardware items so that she can more effectively meet customer demand.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Van Bac

texts.vi:
Mr Bắc is 34 years old, married with 1 kid who's attending 4th grade. Both he and his wife have occupation. She sells peanuts and he raises poultry. They have about 70-90 chickens. He plans to repair the chicken coop: to solidify and clean up the environment. He had applied for a loan and plans to repay it in 6 months. He will put aside a portion of his income to make the monthly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Anh Bắc 34 tuổi, có vợ và có 1 con đang học lớp 4. Cả hai anh chị đều có công việc để kiếm sống. Vợ anh là chị Hoàn làm đậu phụ để bán. Anh chủ yếu tập trung vào chăm sóc đàn gà khoảng 70-80 con của gia đình. Hiện tại anh đang muốn sửa chữa lại trại gà của mình cho sạch sẽ và kiên cố hơn. Anh hiện đã đăng ký vay vốn và trả dần trong vòng 6 tháng. Thu nhập của gia đình sẽ được tiết kiệm để hoàn vốn vay.

loans.use: To repair chicken farm

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim S. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. He has a business selling goods such as batteries, lamps, and lanterns. Nasim works in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar. He has a large assortment of goods, but he has many competitors in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar.

Nasim has been a responsible client of MicroInvest for the past year. He requests a loan so he can increase his current supply of goods and expand his inventory, so he can successfully compete in the bazaar.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety of products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Mary S.. She is married with four children, aged 2, 4, 11, and 13. In 2006 Mary established a phone voucher business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. All of this makes any phone-related business a safe venture. So, happy lending…

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stocks of phone credit vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat A. was born 1955 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has five children. Mrs.A. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004.

She is engaged in selling clothing and shoes in a flea bazaar where her trade outlet is located . She has a good assortment of products and many repeat customers. Mrs.A. is requesting a loan of $625 to increase her inventory of goods.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.es:
Elisabet crochets and sells beautiful, colorful bedspreads and tablecloths. She started working because she wanted to improve her family’s quality of life when her husband’s income as a farmer just wasn’t enough to cover the basic necessities of her dear children. She also sells her products at a local market every 15 days. She plans to increase the amount of products she has, to satisfy customer demand. That’s why she is asking for your help to put her plan into action.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisabet, se dedica a tejer hermosas y coloridas colchas y tapetes a crochet, su deseo por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la ha conducido a desempeñarse en esta labor ya que el ingreso de su esposo como agricultor es insuficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus amados hijos; también vende sus pequeñas ovejitas en una feria local y cada quince días.Tiene en mente incrementar la cantidad de ovejitas ya que ha obtenido mayor cantidad de pedidos, por esa razón solicita tu ayuda para poner en marcha este proyecto.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Sada's Safinia Group

texts.en:
Sada is a married woman. She started her business of making and selling chapatis in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

In the past, Sada has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to make more chapatis for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in small business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items to make chapatis

loans.name: Thị Thái
loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her fruits by expanding her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a very hardworking woman, and this quality of improving each day and carrying out quality work has been passed on to her children who are always grateful to her. Gregoria teaches them this art so that they can create beautiful pieces of handiwork to sell in the tourist markets. She also creates typical embroidered clothing that she adorns with creativity and attention to detail. The artwork of Gregoria’s hands is admired by everyone in her town and her embroidery and hand-made items are in demand by tourists. In order to attract customers and fill current orders Gregoria has requested a loan to buy materials to make her embroidered and handcrafted items. Please consider supporting the dreams of Gregoria to keep working as well as the dreams of her children who will carry on the legacy of this art.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria es una mujer muy empeñosa, y esta cualidad de mejorar cada día y realizar un trabajo de calidad, ha transmitido a sus hijos que siempre estarán agradecidos con ella. Gregoria les enseña todo el arte para elaborar bellos artículos de artesanía que venden en las ferias turísticas. También realiza el bordado de fustanes de trajes típicos que elabora con creatividad y detalle. El arte que las manos de Gregoria tienen es admirado por la gente de su localidad y sus bordados y manualidades son muy solicitados por los turistas. Para atraer clientes y satisfacer los pedidos que ya tiene Gregoria pide un préstamo para comprar el material para sus bordados y artesanías. Apoya los deseos de seguir trabajando de Doña Gregoria y la de sus hijos que heredarán este arte.

loans.use:
To purchase materials for the fabrication of handicrafts and the embroidery of clothing typically worn in the region.

Comprar material e insumos para la fabricación de artesanía y el bordado de fustanes como prenda típica de su región.

loans.name: Semeni's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Semeni M. is 35 years old and married. She has been selling food and snacks since 2007. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Semeni would like a loan of $1050 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothes, charcoal, shoes, snacks, and firewood.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian B. (28 años de edad, profesor de música especializado en acordeón) tiene domicilio propio ubicado en la calle Nanahua de la zona de Pasankeri (ciudad de La Paz) vive con su madre su hermano. Debido al bajo sueldo que percibe Cristhian también se dedica a la confección de ropa para niños, su producto es vendido en distintas ferias de todo el país. Por eso, solicita crédito para comprar material de trabajo, lo que le permitirá mantener su fuente de ingresos ya que con dicha actividad él esta progresando.

Es un buen cliente de Impro y se recomienda ayudarlo.
texts.en:
Christhian B. (28 years old and a music teacher specialized in the accordion) has his own home located in Nanahua Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother. Because his salary as a music teacher is very low, Cristhian works making children's clothing which is then sold at fairs throughout the country. He is requesting a loan with which to buy working materials. The loan will allow him to maintain his source of income, since the clothing business is developing well. Christhian is a good client of Impro and the organization recommends helping him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIALES / Purchase of materials

loans.name: Tuvalu

texts.en: Tuvalu S., 38, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the food business. She sells to families and at the public market 5 days a week. She has had 7 previous loans with SPBD.  Tuvalu would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, a new stove, new Chinese pots and a teapot.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Tuvalu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.

loans.use: To purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, a new stove, new Chinese pots and a teapot

loans.name: Neyza

texts.es: Neyza tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. DesD. hace 10 años tiene un salón D. belleza, trabaja realizando todo tipo D. cortes D. cabello, tites, ondulaciones, etc. al gusto D. su clientela, en un inicio y desD. entonces es el brazo derecho D. una D. sus primas, que tiene su salón D. belleza en una zona céntrica D. la ciudad, es así que tuvo la oportunidad D. recibir capacitaciones D. lo último en tendencias D. la moda D. cortes D. cabellos y demás tratamientos D. belleza, entonces abre paralelamente su salón D. belleza, sus vecinos que son su principal clientela son los que acuden a solicitarle  sus servicios, esto la anima trabajar por lo cual sigue capacitándose. Además D. ello, también tiene su pequeña granja D. cuyes, que son un ingreso más para su economía.  Neyza solicita este préstamo con el que invertirá en la compra D. productos D. arreglo personal, como ganchos, peines, entre otros, que serán mercadería D. venta en su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Neyza is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past 10 years, she has had a beauty salon, working to cater to all types of hair cuts, styles, etc. to satisfy her customers' preferences. For a long time, she has been the right hand woman of her cousin who has a beauty salon in downtown. As a result, she had the opportunity to learn the latest trends for hair cuts and beauty experimentations. Later, she opened a partner beauty salon. Her neighbors are the main customers that request her services and they encourage her to continue her career. Moreover, she has a guinea pig farm that is another source of income. Neyza requests this loan to invest in personal beauty products, such as pins and brushes, among others, that will be merchandise for sale in her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase personal beauty products to sell in her beauty shop

loans.name: Abla Philomene

texts.fr:
Madame A. Abla Philomène est née le 31 décembre 1952. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente du charbon de bois et des céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 sacs de charbon de bois, 10 sacs de mais, et 3 sacs de haricot. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Abla Philomène A. was born on December 31, 1952. She is married and a mother with a child. Her work involves selling charcoal and grains in the Agoè district of Lomé. Once, she was the recipient of a loan from WAGES and repaid it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 12 sacks of charcoal, 10 sacks of corn, and 3 sacks of beans. With this new stock, she will be able to do well in her sales and to realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and grain

loans.name: Borya

texts.en: Borya Z. is 40 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school, and the oldest is married and living with her husband. Borya is a petty trader who trades in peanuts. Her husband and children are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling peanuts has enabled her to rent accommodation for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of peanuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's education. She is a member of the group called “Trust in God” Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Borya wants the loan to buy bulk supply of peanuts

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edilyn G. operates a community store that offers basic commodities. Aside from that, she also sells vegetables, fish, and pork meat. Her husband, Dominador supports her in the business through his income from working as a driver. Together they work hand in hand to support the future education of their two children: Ed Dominic– seven years old, in the first grade, and Shandy Nicole– two years old.  

Edilyn hopes to purchase more stock for her store and vegetables for her vending business. With this plan, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to increase her capital as she is striving hard for the development of her business and for her family to build their own house. Edilyn said that she must start to save money for their future plans and needs to be patient. Her dreams motivate her to think positively in order to achieve them.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store and vegetable vending

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing C. is a 28-year-old married woman.  She is a hair stylist, but she also sells hair cream, hair extensions, and women's clothes to generate additional income.  She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $675 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more goods (i.e., hair cream, hair extensions, and women's clothing) for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials for her salon (hair cream and extensions) and additional clothes to resell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana F. is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. All of her children are in school and are doing very well. She has been trading in the community of Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana where she lives with her family.

She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for four years. She has been doing this business with her husband. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces and supplies palm oil to food vendors to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand becomes very high. She and her husband also travel to the big cities for supplies. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nut fruits and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency and allow her to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and to raise more income so she can help her husband to provide food for her family and finance her children's education. 

Susana belongs to a village bank called "Luke." She hopes to receive GH¢600 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruit.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere sells foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She promises to pay back promptly. Chinyere is 33 years old and married with a child. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy H., 39, has been selling fresh fishes to her neighbors in her village for years. She sells the fish that she gets from her husband's fishing and that she buys from the wholesale suppliers as well. Beside her business, she is also a good homemaker who cooks delicious food and cares for her four children, who are single and still live in the family home. To help feed the family a little more, one of her sons is a worker for a garment industry, whilst her husband is a local fisherman. Because her husband's fishing is a profitable investment for the family, Vy H. is looking for a loan in order to buy more tools for her husband's fishing business.

loans.use: To buy more tools for fishing business

loans.name: Koffi Justin

texts.fr: A. est un électricien, il a sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé «  ELECTRO STAR ».pour gagner plus de revenu il a associé à cette activité le commerce des matériaux de construction. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé il veut se réapprovisionner  et  sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des tuyaux, des barres de fer, des tôles, des clous et de ciments. Il est marié et a 02 enfants, c’est son commece qui lui permet de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. is an electrician, he has his own shop that he called "ELECTRO STAR". To increase his income, he also sells construction supplies. His stock has run out, and he wants to resupply. He's therefore seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pipes, iron bars, sheet metals, nails, and cement. He's married and the father of two children, and his business enables him to properly provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell construction supplies (pipes, nails, cement, ...)

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes son su mejor apoyo en tiempos difíciles, ya que como familia lograron sobre llevar algunas crisis, pero también compartieron grandes logros como la construcción de su casa. Desde joven estuvo involucrada en el comercio, pues le gusta invertir su tiempo de forma productiva, y ahora viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa de segundo uso y de cosméticos, pero su actividad más importante es la administración de su motocarro, el cual acaba de adquirir con el apoyo de su hijo, quien la motivó a invertir en este vehículo que les serviría, a ambos, para trabajar y juntar el dinero suficiente para adquirir un puesto en el mercado, donde Mónica pueda vender variedad de prendas, ya que es la actividad que más le agrada realizar. Mientras tanto, se dedica a conservar su movilidad en buen estado, realizando los mantenimientos necesarios para que no tenga problemas mecánicos que perjudiquen su economía. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y su permanencia en la institución le da la confianza para seguir trabajando con personas tan responsables y comprometidas por su desarrollo como son sus compañeras de su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que solicita le darán la oportunidad de adquirir algunos repuestos y aceites para motor que requiere su motocarro.
texts.en:
Mónica is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and their 2 kids, who are her best support during difficult times. The family has already overcome a few crises, but they have also shared big accomplishments, such as the construction of their house. Since she was young, Mónica has been involved in commerce, as she likes to invest her time in productive things. Currently, she sells second-hand clothes and cosmetics, but her most important job is administering her motortaxi, which she just acquired with the support of her son, who motivated her invest in the taxi. The taxi will generate enough money to get a post at the city market, where Mónica can sell her clothes, as this is now her favorite activity. Meanwhile, she keeps her taxi in good shape, and undertakes the necessary maintenance in order to avoid mechanical problems. This is her 13th loan with MFP, and her long-standing relationship with the institution gives her the confidence necessary to continue working with the people responsible for her development, such as her companions at her communal bank. The 1300 Soles that Mónica is asking for will give her the opportunity to acquire parts and oil for her motortaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts for her motortaxi.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de l’eau en sachet « pure WATER » et du jus, elle fait cette activité depuis 2003. Il existe une école à proximité de son lieu de commerce, à la sortie des classes, les jeunes viennent acheter chez elle, cela lui permet de réaliser de bonnes recettes. Son stock a diminué et elle souhaitera se réapprovisionner. Ayant déjà obtenu un premier crédit, elle sollicite de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter 10 sachets de sucre, 4 carton de plastique pour emballer le jus, et 400 sachets de « pure WATER ».
Elle est veuve et a à sa seule charge ses 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a women who earns an income selling "Pure WATER" in bags and juices. She has been in this business since 2003. There is a school near her place of business. When classes let out, the youngsters come and buy from her. This enables her to realize a good income. Her inventory has shrunk, and she would like to stock up again. Having already obtained a loan, she's requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy ten packets of sugar, four boxes of plastic for packaging juices, and 400 bags of "Pure WATER". She is a widow and is alone in supporting her four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, plastic, and baggies of "Pure Water"

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. L. región 2 veces por semana en donD. compra quesos, animales, papa, productos que comercializa en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa y queso.
Los sueños D. Julia son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, which means All Together in Quechua. Julia is married, 42 years old, and has 7 children. Julia travels to the regional markets twice a week where she purchases cheeses, animals, and potatoes, products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and cheese. Julia’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by MarieL. Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and cheese.

loans.name: Hameda Group

texts.en: Hameda is the leader of this four-member group.  Each of them wants to take out a loan for improving and expanding their businesses, so they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Hameda wants a loan for her embroidery business. Nagia wants a loan for a leather-working business. Nadei wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Waseel wants a loan for a painting business. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a businesswoman who makes a living selling clothes, linen and lace. She sometimes sells by traveling about, hawking her wares. She is 33 years old, divorced and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is committed to support her family by working hard. She has 15 years selling experience but has been hampered by insufficient funds. She is applying for this loan to revive her business and increase her profits. She wants to buy clothes, linen and lace in bulk to sell to her customers. Her overriding goal is to save more money so she can give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To buuy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad L. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 57 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Felicidad owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise for additional income. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia I. is a 45--year-old woman living in the town of Toamua.  She is married and has three children school-aged children. Ia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Ia has been engaged in this business for over five years.

In 2005, Ia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2650 tala WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Ia is now requesting a new loan of $1,050 which will be used to purchase more materials needed to provide her services. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Abemu

texts.en: Abemu is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells provisions like milk, detergent, toothpapste, etc in her grocery store. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um C. is 26; she is married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells a variety of flowers that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier. She sells to people who need flowers to decorate parties or ceremonies. She also plants a type of flower on her garden around her home. Her husband helps her sell flowers. Um C. finds it hard to picking up her flower to sell at the market, because she doesn't have her own vehicle, so that she is looking for a loan on Kiva through HKl to be used to buy a motorcycle which she will use them to support her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which she will use them to support her business

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 5 Group

texts.en:
Emilia is a 46-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Emilia is the coordinator for her group, El Señor es Mi Pastor #5 (The Lord is My Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Emilia lives in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. She lives with her husband and four children, and runs a small clothing shop. With her new loan, Emilia plans on purchasing the latest styles of pants and blouses for women and jeans, polos, and t-shirts for the men who shop in her store. 

This is Emilia’s first loan with Esperanza, and she is excited for the opportunities that an increase in capital provides. She hopes to expand her store’s selection, and one day have her own shop rather than renting. With four children, Emilia also hopes to earn enough profits so that she can send them all to university. Thank you for lending to Emilia and El Señor es Mi Pastor group!

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the food she makes for vending. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her family's daily needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is hard working woman who is determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. 

She is 43 years old and married with four children. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
el sr. EUSEBIO G. M. cuenta con un centro de fotocopiado y un molino para moler maiz, operando bajo el nombre de FOTOCOPIAS Y MOLINOS  "MONTE CRISTO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de 
habitacion. Eusebio es casado y padre de 3 hijos, todos dependen de su matrimonio,  3 de ellos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli.
El  Sr. EUSEBIO tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 17 años de dedicarse a prestar este tipo de servicios, su preferible clientela estan satisfechos con su esmerada y fina atencion que les brinda.
Juntos con su esposa atienden este negocio el cual les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar y mantenimiento de su negocios.
ahora el esta solicitando el credito para comprar resmas de papel al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señor EUSEBIO G. M. runs a photocopy center and a mill to grind maiz, operating under the name of "MONTE CRISTO PHOTOCOPIES AND MILLS". His business is located in his house. Eusebio is married and the father of 3 children, all dependant on him and his wife. Three of his children attend the secondary and primary public schools of the city of Danli. Señor Eusebio has a lot of experience in the management of this type of business, since he has been dedicated to providing this type of services for 17 years. His regular clientele is satisfied with the careful and personal attention that he offers them. Along with his wife he attends this business, which generates for them the financial resources to supply the expenses inside the home and the maintenance of their business. Now he is requesting a loan to buy reams of paper wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reams of paper wholesale for his photocopy business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia FAUSTINA tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Cuatro de sus hijos son independientes y dos están es su poder. La socia y su esposo tienen un taller de pintado y planchado de carros en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que tienen el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida y por ese motivo ayuda a su esposo en el taller. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más herramientas y materiales como pintura, macilla, balón de oxigeno que se utiliza para soldar.  
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Faustina is 38, married, and has six children. Four of the children are independent and two are not. The member and her husband have an automotive body shop at their residence. They have had this business several years and have been successful due to their hard work and determination. Our member is an enterprising mother who helps her husband in the body shop in order to raise their family's standard of living, and she does so despite many difficulties. The member needs this loan to buy more tools and materials such as paint, Bondo, and oxygen tanks for use in welding. The member belongs to the Communal Bank "HUAYNA CCAPAC" of the Arariwa Association of Cusco Province, Cusco Department. The member is grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and also promises to make timely repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs this loan to buy more tools and materials such as paint, Bondo, and oxygen tanks for use in welding.

loans.name: Eunice Nyamweru

texts.en:
Eunice is married to John and they have three children: Kennedy, Peter and Patrick.

Eunice was introduced to KADET through existing clients. She is servicing her second loan and has no previous serviced loan from other Micro Finance Institutions. She intends to use the loan to increase stock in her hardware shop: inventory such as plumbing materials, paint and tiles.

Eunice's area of business is situated along a highway where there are many houses being developed. This ensures her a steady demand for her goods, which are used for building the houses. With the extra profits she plans to expand her business.

Eunice hopes to own a chain of hardware stores in Nairobi and other towns as she describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase inventory in her hardware shop.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida es una joven madre de 21 años, vive con su pareja, Percy de 25 años, con quien tiene dos hermosas hijas; María de 2 a y Kritsi de un año. 
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, maíz y flor de gladiolo con la ayuda de su esposo .También tiene 2 vacas, algunas ovejas, 2 caballos y 2 asnos con los que transporta los insumos agrícolas hacia sus terrenos.
Cuando ella era adolescente tenía muchos sueños, que por un tiempo vio truncados, pero las ganancias que percibe ahora por la comercialización de sus productos le permiten vivir cómodamente, por eso para el futuro desea comprar más cabezas de ganado y sembrar en mayor cantidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y  se compromete ante su banco comunal a ser puntual en sus pagos, para que el grupo siga creciendo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, abono y fertilizantes que le brindaran una cosecha fructífera.
texts.en:
Alida is a young, 21-year old mother. She lives with her husband Percy, age 25. They have 2 daughters: María, age 2, and Kristi, age 1. For 2 years Alida has planted potatoes, peas, corn and gladiola flowers with the help of her husband. She also has 2 cows, some sheep, 2 horses, and 2 donkeys, which she uses to bring farm supplies to her land. When she was young Alida had many dreams, which were cut short for a time. But the income she earns now from selling her products allow her to live comfortably. Thus in the future she hopes to buy more livestock and plant more. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises her community bank that she will be punctual in her payments, so that the group can continue growing. With the money she is requesting she will buy seeds to grow peas, and organic and chemical fertilizers that will bring her a bountiful harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 50 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living by running a grinding machine that processes foodstuffs for her customers. The demand for her services is currently too high for her to meet, and she would like to expand her business to help satisfy all of her customers. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan for NGN 150,000 to buy an additional grinding machine and a generator. She hopes to expand her business in the future, and is pleased to be able to say that her children are excelling in their various fields of endeavor. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine and a generator

loans.name: Mrs. Chhong Mam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes twelve members who all live in Sdok village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chhong M. is the village bank president and was selected by all the members. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chhong M. is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. She is a widow with three children, who all are enrolled in the local public school. However, this family tries to work hard in the field so they can earn more income. In order to improve the condition of her family's standard of living, Mrs. Chhong M. wants to breed pigs but she does not have enough money to buy it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 26 year old single man living with his mother and brothers. When he has only 11 years old, he started in the field of working as a mechanic to earn an income to help with the many expenses of his family. And then, in 2003, when he was older and had more experience, he opened his own car repair shop to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He helps, along with his brothers, to improve the family's living situation. 

Today, Haidar is requesting a loan of $1,000 to renew his mechanic equipment and acquire newer tools in order to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: To renew his mechanic equipment and add more advanced tools.

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mi H., aged 43, is married and resides with his four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He is engaged in a business which involves fishing and buying fish for sale, earning an income of USD 2.8 per day to help cover the family's expenses. His wife operates a business selling lotus flowers, earning an income of USD 1.8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Mi H. and his wife have had these businesses. He is requesting a loan of USD 500 to build a house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 36-year-old mother of four. She has a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking fat and maize flour among other products. She has been in this business for six years and her business has grown since she joined Faulu Kenya.

Angelina belongs to a group of entrepreneurs who save their money together and guarantee each other's loans. This makes it easier for her to get a loan from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to add to her stock of sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

Angelina is a hardworking lady who hopes to have a well-established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro T. is from the village of Southwestern Pob., Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Alejandro is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandro owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as milo, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alejandro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alejandro from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana ,de 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Reside en una localidad de la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura y aunque al principio no sabía nada de este rubro , recnonoce que con el tiempo ha aprendido bastante .En la actualidad tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y obtiene buenas ganancias económicas, su estrategia de éxito es que siempre tiene su negocio bien surtido de toda clase de productos. Además no le gusta esperar que se le agote su mercadería sino que se abastece cada quince días . Por lo general sus productos los vende en su propia localidad y los precios van acorde al poder adquisitivo de cada cliente, ya que su negocio está segmentado para todo el público en general. Usualmente trabaja  sola, y  en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Las puertas de su negocio están abiertas todos los días, y para el futuro desea ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, para ofrecer sus productos al por mayor a sus asiduos  clientes.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se  compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus  pagos, además esta muy agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal por la solidaridad que ejercen entre todos.Yobana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería , para  abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, y a la vez satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yobana, 25, is a single mother of one daughter; she lives in her own home located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry. For the last five years she has been a farmer even though she started out not knowing anything about farming; she recognizes that in this time she has learned quite a bit about it. She has a grocery store and earns good profits from it; her strategy for success is to always have the store well stocked with a wide variety of products. Besides, she doesn’t like to run out of items so she stocks up every two weeks. In general, she sells her products in her own location and prices are according to each customer’s ability to pay; her store is segmented for the general public. She usually works alone but occasionally her family helps out. She is open for business every day and in the future would like to expand her store to offer wholesale items to her regular customers. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she is very grateful to all the members of her communal group for the solidarity among them. Yobana plans to use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of merchandise to stock her store in order to meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pagnes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 38 años y su hija menor Yanira de 11 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de plátano y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente Maribel. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Maribel is a simple, 40-year-old, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Victor, 38, and her minor daughter Yanira, 11. She wants to offer them a better quality of life. Cultivating plantains and coffee is what Maribel does every day. With much effort she has made her fields very productive, and her crops very high quality and much appreciated in the city of Pichanaki, where she takes them to sell. What she likes most about her work is caring for the crops; she has been doing this for 15 years. Maribel thinks that the most difficult part is transporting the crops, since the sacks are very heavy and tire her greatly. In the future she wants to purchase new fields, to be able to sow more. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she intends to be very punctual in her payments, since she doesn't wish to create problems for her communal group, in which she feels very content. With the 300 new sols she requests, she will purchase more manure for her farms.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE FOR HER FIELDS OF PLANTAINS AND COFFEE

loans.name: Riko

texts.en:
Riko P. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes to sell. Riko is 43 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for her children to be used as a means of transport to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 62 years old, married and has seven children. While most of her children are adults, she still has her younger ones who go to school and hope to finish college someday. Dionisia owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also raises ducks. Dionisia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.

Dionisia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Dionisia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dionisia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Dionisia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela O. is a hardworking lady based in Kisumu, a lakeside city in Western Kenya along Lake Victoria. She is married to Agripa Onguka, a college teacher. They have three children between 8 and 16 years old. 

Pamela operates a salon and boutique at the town center in Kisumu city where she sells new clothes and salon materials like weaves, pieces for hair plaiting and many more beauty products. From this business, Pamela makes a monthly income of around Kshs. 33,400 ($417).Confidently, Pamela has operated this business for the last 13 years and therefore she has wide experience. She is taking her fourth loan from Kadet Limited and she is confident that she will be able to pay in full without default. She intends to use the loan to buy weaves, new clothes and pieces for plaiting. 

From the anticipated profits, Pamela will ensure she uses it to educate her children and ensure that their living standards improve for the better. Apart from this, she has plans to open other businesses and her plan at the moment is to open the popular money transfer business service (locally known as M-pesa). For sure, the sky is the limit for Pamela. She hopes to get a Kiva lender to help her realize these plans.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and pieces for hair plaiting.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is a city famous for dairy business.  
She is a vigorous lady who keeps herself busy in her sewing business. She loves this work and tries to makes changes in her sewing. She beautifully crafts new designs on every dress, which attracts more customers towards her. She sews clothes of her neighbors and relatives. She charges between 100-150 PKRs on each dress. The earning amount helps her to manage the financial circle of her house. 
 
Her husband is involved in a wheat-selling business. He buys wheat from the wholesallers and supplies it to other wheat-sellers and earns income on it. He has been in this business for over six years. 

Rani has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the wheat in bulk and fulfill the orders of his customers.  
She is hopeful that this investment will bring the positive change in her husband’s business and he will be able to improve his income.

loans.use: Purchase wheat in bulk to resell

loans.name: Peter Wasonga

texts.en:
Peter A. is 28 years old and is married to Hellen Atieno. They have two children: Eugene is three years old and Sheryl is one year old. The wife sells vegetables and uses the profits made to contribute to the upkeep of the family. They live in Suna Migori town.

Peter runs a butchery shop and has been in this business for the past three years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use the money to buy a bull that he can slaughter and add meat to his inventory. He earns an income of KES 40,000 monthly. 

He hopes that the profits made will be enough for him to open another butcher shop and be able to employ one person to help him manage it.

loans.use: Buy a bull to slaughter and add meat to stock butcher shop.

loans.name: St Maria Development B, Mubende Group

texts.en: N. Federesi, with raised hand, of the St Maria development group is a progressive lady who has operated a veterinary drug shop for more than 10 years in the Kyenda trading centre, Mubende. The widowed mother of 10 children, she had to run this business as well as growing agricultural produce to meet her family needs. This has earned her 400,000 Ugandan shillings per month. She is seeking a loan to buy more drugs for the shop and restock the business in order to meet customer demand. This will tide over her business as she looks at owning a building in the trading centre.

loans.use: buying more stock of drugs for increased inventory.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 52 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Junto a sus hijos, Octavia trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra papa y habas, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Octavia is 52 years old; she is a very simple and very hard working person. She lives in her own home together with her two young children who are the reason for all of her efforts. Together with her children, Octavia works every day in the fields. With a great deal of work she has managed to make her fields be very productive, now harvesting many things and always the produce is of the highest quality. She started out planting potatoes and fava beans, these products are highly sought out in the markets. What she most enjoys about her work is warding pests away from her plantations. She has had 10 years in the business and the hardest part is having to transport the goods to the wholesale market in Tarma for sale. 

For the future of her business, she hopes to save enough money to set up a stand in the wholesale market, as she now travels to make her sales. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she knows that this loan will help her a great deal in the development of her business. In her community bank she is a very responsible member, a source of great pride. With the three thousand nuevos soles she requests she will invest in the improvement of her cultivations. She will purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan E., from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 56 years old, married and has nine grown children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food products including snacks and biscuits and home products such as bath soaps and shampoo in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teng's Group

texts.en:
Ten people make up this village bank loan. They are located in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. This village bank group selected Mr. Teng L., a 26-year-old married man, as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Teng L. and his wife, Mrs. Khvei Vanna, are working as employees in a garment factory. With their occupations, they still don't earn enough income to improve the family's living conditions, so they want to conduct a new business: pig breeding.  Mr. Teng L. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feed. This couple has one child who is just six months old.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and pig feed

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old, married and has 2 children aged 19 and 22. Merita owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merita has been engaged in farming for over 30 years. She wishes to have her children finish college and have bright futures.

Merita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Merita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca Partida del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura desde hace más de diez años, por un lado el cuenta con un terreno agrícola de una hectárea en el cual suele sembrar cebollas y adicionalmente cuenta con chivos los cuales cría y comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona. Wilmer tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro y durante los últimos cinco años ha podido obtener el conocimiento necesario sobre el cultivo de cebolla ya que sólo se ha dedicado a esa actividad, actualmente ha instalado una hectárea de este cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para conseguir una buena producción.

Wilmer desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de cebolla, específicamente planea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y brindar mantenimiento a un motor con el cual extrae agua de un pozo para regar su cultivo. Para realizar estas acciones se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 34, is in a common law relationship and lives with his family in Huaca Partida, Pítipo district, a farming area located in Ferreñafe province, over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been a farmer for over 10 years.  He has a one hectare field where he tends to plant onions.  He also has goats that he raises and sells among merchants in the area.

Wilmer has quite a bit of experience in this line of work and during the last five years has been able to learn everything necessary about onion growing since he has dedicated himself solely to this activity.  He currently has a hectare planted with onions and is working hard to obtain a good harvest.

Wilmer wants to provide proper maintenance to his onion fields, specifically he plans to acquire fertilizers and service the motor of a pump he uses to extract water for his crops.  To do all this he needs to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For onion crop maintenance costs.

loans.name: Ethel Doliguez Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ethel D. is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-age children. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ethel D. Group. 

Ethel owns and operates a business of making and selling food, such as snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately $72 a month.

In 2005, Ethel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

Ethel is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 
About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bassam

texts.ar:
بسام متزوج وعمره 32 سنة له ولد يعمل في حدادة وبويا السيارات يحب عمله وله فيه 15 سنة
يعمل بجد ونشاط ويريد دائما التطور والمثابرة في العمل يريد لعائلته التطور والاستمرار في التقدم 
يسعى دائما الى تجديد مصلحته له تاريخ جيد جدا مع المجموعة كان يتلقى خلاله دعم كامل من العائلة
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للمصلحة لزيادة الزبائن وتطوير العمل
texts.en: Bassam, 32, is married with a son. He has been working in the autobody repair and painting business for 15 years. Bassam is active, vigorous and persevering at work. He wishes to improve his family and work conditions. He likes his work and always gets his family's full support.  Bassam has a very good credit history with Al Majmoua. He seeks a loan to buy new equipment so that he can develop his business and increase his clients.

loans.use: To buy new equipment to develop his autobody repair and painting business

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou P., 45, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning $1 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month the family has to spend $35 US on food, $10 on the children’s education, and $25 US on other expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair the house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. P. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a member of Riruta Genesis B, registered under Faulu Kenya.  She makes and sells soaps and detergents and employs one person in her business. She also sells secondhand clothes to supplement her family’s income. Mercy hopes to own a permanent business premise in the future.  She says that through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to educate her children. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy chemicals for manufacturing soap and detergents.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for manufacturing soap and detergents

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and toothpaste in the local community. Daisy has been involved in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such beverages and canned goods. This will be the third loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a variety store

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Haja.  She is married and has three children aged 16, 11, and 9. In the year 2001, Haja established her clothing and food items business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,500,000 every month from this business. 

Haja would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Haja has a very good loan repayment history. She requires a new loan in order to buy rolls of clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Haja plans to build a house and educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing for her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard S. C. is a man who is 30 years old. He is married to Susan Yariwo and together they have three beautiful children. He runs a matatu (van) transportation business in the Kitale area. This has been his business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Bernard's first loan with KADET LTD and he wants to buy new seat covers for his matatu (van). He hopes that sprucing up of the van will attract more customers and thus also more profits, which he will use to repay the loan. In the future he wants to improve his services and also educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for the matatu (van)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Josephine is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to the market. Josephine also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells the pigs as well. She has requested a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer. Josephine works hard to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Belen, esta en el 14 ciclo. Las socias del banco se dedican a L. venta D. cereales, animales menores, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. quesos, tejido D. chompas, y a L. costura. L. presidenta para este ciclo es Juana, tiene 53 anos, es casada, con 4 hijos D. (15, 14,y mellisos D. 11 anos). Es feriante solicita un credito D. S/. 1 050.00. El credito que solicita lo invertira en L. compra D. cereales. Juana viaja a L. feria D. Seccelambras los dias jueves ahi compra los cereales y los venD. en Ayacucho a sus caceras a veces los venD. elL. misma en su puesto. Los dias que no viaja a L. ferias venD. cereales, papas, choclos, arvejas o verduras D. temporada en el mercadillo cerca al cementerio. Los dias domingos venD. en L. feria D. San Juan Bautista. Ingreso a FINCA Peru, por L. invitacion D. L. promotora, le gusta por L. facilidad en los creditos y pueD. ahorrar, aprenD. en las capacitaciones. Su sueno es que sus hijos sean profesionales que tengan mejores oportunidades que elL. y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
The Belén communal bank is in its 14th cycle.   The bank members sell cereals, small farm animals, groceries, cheese; some weave sweaters and are seamstresses.

The group President is Juana, 53.  She’s married and has four children (15, 14 and 11 year old twins).  She’s a merchant and is asking for a 1050 sol loan to buy cereals.  Juana travels to the Seccelambras market Thursdays to buy the cereals there that she then sells to housewives in Ayacucho.  Sometimes she sells them herself in her stand.  On days she doesn’t travel to the markets, she sells cereals, potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, peas or seasonal vegetables in the little market near the cemetery.  On Sundays she sells at the San Juan Bautista market.

She joined FINCA Peru thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She likes it because of the ease in getting loans and because she can save; she also likes learning at the training sessions.  Her dream is that her children become professionals and that her business continues to make progress.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Froy

texts.es:
Froy B. O. es de Cartagena, y es dueños de la ebanistería mas conicidad de la comunidad de Cimarrón. 
Desde que se caso, empezó a trabajar con su suegro en un taller de ebanistería, y desde hace poco decidió empezar su propio negocio. Ya casi tiene todas las herramientas que necesita, sin embargo solo le hace falta una acepilladora industrial de madera. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo de  500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprarla y así empezar a trabajar en su propio negocio.
