El es socio   de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Froy B. O. is from Cartagena; he is the owner of the most well-known cabinetmaking shop in the community of Cimarrón. 

When he married, he started to work with his father-in-law making furniture, and after some time he started his own business.  Now he has almost all of the tools that he needs, except he still lacks an industrial grade shop vacuum.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 Costa Rican colones, so that he can buy this equipment to use in his business.

Froy is a member of the "Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón" Communal Finance Institution, one the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy an industrial shop vacuum for his cabinetmaking workshop

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in a small city called Kasur. It is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its leather industry. Her house is located in the area of Azher colony. Bilqees is a very supportive lady who operates an embroidery business to support her family financially. She also fulfills her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother very well.  Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is a property dealer. He helps people find homes for rent and for sale. His business is going well and he earns reasonable profits from it. 

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son who is also involved in an embroidery business and needs a loan to buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk to fulfill orders on time. He learned this art from Bilqees and has six years of experience in this field. Bilqees hopes that a loan will have a positive impact on his business and will increase his profits. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Tatayyira Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 30 years ago in Matotoka village, Maseray is married to a trader and has two children who are attending primary school. For many years now, Maseray has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, Maseray is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business. 

This is the first loan that Maseray and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Talita

texts.en:
Talita is 25 years of age and married with two children. Talita owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Talita needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Talita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Talita's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks like bongo's, cookies and twisties

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk, age 39, is an animal feeder. Her husband is an electrician. Their income is 8 USD per day. They have four children, ages 18, 17, 13, and 5. Every month, she has to spend 25 USD on food and 35 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 500 USD to buy chickens and pigs to sell. She also plans to make cages for the animals. She also wants to repair her house to make it more comfortable, as now it is not in good condition at all. She hopes that she can make a good profit from this career.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jovelyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mastula's Group

texts.en:
Mastula‘s group is comprised of two hard working women. Mastula is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child. Her child is currently in school.  Mastula has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Mastula hopes to own a boutique that sells clothes. Mastula is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos de 16 y 1 año, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de ganado, agricultura, crianza de animales, su esposo de dedica a la construcción. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar cabezas de ganado, alimentacion y semillas para los cultivos. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta dedicarse a labores del hogar y pasar mas tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 45, is married.  She lives with her husband and children who are 16 and 1 year old in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the Calli Kausay communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  They are in farming, livestock raising, livestock sales, vegetable sales, and others.

María is a livestock merchant, farmer, raises animals.  Her husband works in construction.  He purchases and sales take place in the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to purchase heads of cattle, feed, and seeds for her fields.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to buy a piece of land.  She enjoys going household chores.

loans.use: to purchase heads of cattle, feed, and seeds for her fields

loans.name: Los Andes 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANDES 1” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teodora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Teodora  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años atrás por intermedio de sus amigas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Andes 1” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teodora. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors in order to get ahead.

Sra. Teodora said that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She was invited to join the organization by a promoter. Teodora currently has a business in which she knits blankets. Her friends convinced her to work several years ago.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to increase her capital for purchasing wool. She will buy the wool in the neighborhood of La Ceja and use it to make the products that she sells on request. Working in this manner allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Teodora is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teodora said that she enjoys the training seminars.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.es:
Agrepina nació en la comunidad de Amaru del distrito de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La pueden encontrar a Agrepina  en su puesto de venta desde las 12 de la tarde hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a domingo. 

Agrepina requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, fideos y otras cosas más. 
 
Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Agrepina was born in the community of Amaru in the district of Pisaq (Cuzco, Perú). She is 42 years old and in a common law marriage, from which she has seven children. At present, she lives in the the city of Pisaq and she does her activity there. She sells food as a street vendor in the Plaza de Armas. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her job. Agrepina can be found at her sales stall from 12 until 3 in the afternoon Mondays through Sundays. 

Agrepina needs the loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, pasta and more.  
 
The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets on the 30th of every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cuzco, Perú). Cuzco is known as a very touristy and commercial area. It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because in it is one of the Seven Wonders of the World,      “Machu Picchu”.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, pasta and more.

loans.name: Adjowavi Enyonam

texts.fr:
Adjowavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 51 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle a 02 enfants.
Adjowavi travaille revendeuse de charbons de bois (un combustible très utilisé par les femmes togolaises).
Adjowavi a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle achéte les marchandises à Kara et Anié et revend à domicile. Elle a débuté en 2009.
texts.en:
Adjowavi is a 51-year old woman. She is married to a pastor. She has two children.

Adjowavi works as a vendor of charcoal (a fuel very popular with Togolese women). Adjowavi has requested her third-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal. She stocks up in Kara and Anié and sells out of her home. She launched her business in 2009.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a una D. las miembros. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su Barrio. El comité se Denomina “La Esperanza” en homenaje a la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya; ya que las mismas señoras tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso D. su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. Actualmente están en el décimo ciclo con 18 integrantes.
La Directora General del comité es la Sra. María, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropas y cosméticos en su barrio, es una persona, responsable, y trabajadora.  Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia y darle por lo menos las condiciones básicas para que puedan tener una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas, con lo cual podré cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la nueva oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to the initiative of one of its members, who invited her neighbors and friends to start a committee in her neighborhood. The name chosen for this committee is “La Esperanza” (“Hope”) in honor of the opportunities offered by Fundación Paraguaya, as these ladies will have new chances to star a better job, thus contributing to the income of their families and proving their children with a better standard of living. The group is composed of 18 members and they are actually working their tenth cycle. 
María is the Director General of this committee. She engages in selling clothes and cosmetics in her neighborhood. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. She says that thanks to her job she has succeeded in providing for her family and in offering them at least the basic conditions for a decent and honorable life.
She is requesting a loan to buy items of clothing, in order to meet her customers’ requests. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the new chance she is being offered.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is married to a house builder. She has 3 children who are between 3 and 7 and are all currently attending school. Claudine has been selling food in a store for 3 years. She would like a loan to buy more food to stock her store. She will use the profits to build a house, pay school fees, and provide medical insurance for her family. She would like to double the size of her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 42 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez. She is married with 2 children. To earn a living, Maricel has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Maricel would like to be a supplier of dried fish in her town.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nawar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

Nawar has owned a car workshop since 2009, repairing cars and balancing wheels.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation, and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2000 loan in order to purchase a wheel balancing machine for cars. He is aiming to increase profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Narcisa Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por la comunidad del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, en este lugar su gente es muy amable y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en distintas actividades.

Doña Narcisa tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 19, 17, 14 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Narcisa se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catálogo en sus tiempos libres y se encuentra en el negocio 3 años. También vende comida en su casa, lleva 4 años en este trabajo y labora de domingo a domingo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Vida."  She lives in the community of Aguacate, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a place where the people are very friendly and warmhearted.  The people here maintain the culture and the traditions of their parents, and they work in a variety of activities, including agriculture and animal husbandry.

Narcisa is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 14, who attend a school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own the home that they live in.

Narcisa has been selling clothing and cosmetics through a catalog in her free time for 3 years. She has also been selling food from her house for 4 years, and she does this work on a daily basis.

She has been a member of her communal bank for 4 years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics.

Her goal is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Shovlat

texts.en: Shovlat, aged 49, is married and the mother of two sons and one daughter.  She lives with her family in their own house in Lankaran.  She mostly fattens cattle for resale.  Shovlat has been doing this work for over 7 years.  She is taking out a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase 3 more cattle.  She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Dibirmagamed

texts.en:
Dibirmagamed is a 54-year-old farmer from the village of Chantlikure, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Sikinat, two sons (23 and 22 years old) and a daughter-in-law. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is their only source of income. 
They have milk cows and sell homemade cheese. Also the family owns a plot of land, where various fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold locally and the family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Dibirmagamed requested credit to purchase materials for greenhouse construction. He will grow vegetables in the winter months and sell them in the spring for seasonally high prices, which will significantly increase the family's income. 
The greenhouse will also be used for growing vegetables in the summer months. Dibirmagamed plans to reinvest any increase in income in the further development of the family dairy farm; he plans to purchase milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 29-year-old married woman with no child. She has had a business of selling food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ajah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and oil for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and oil for sale.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 25-year-old, single woman who lives with her only parent and seven siblings. Six of them are working, and her brother is the one responding to his family's demands and covering their expenses. For this reason, Fatmeh decided to start her own home business to take some of the responsibilities off of her brother. She has been teaching private lessons since 2009. 

Today, she’s asking to borrow $1,300 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new computer, desk and a board in order to carry on her job in a proper way. In the future, she plans to join a local school and benefit from their experience.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer, desk and a board in order to carry on her job in a proper way.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 38-year-old, married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has run a fish selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Madame   Fatimata   est   une   femme  sénégalaise   qui   habite   près  du  guichet   de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre, non loin de sa zone d’habitation. Elle   s’active  dans   le   secteur   du   commerce depuis  5 ans et pratique la vente de tissus. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit dans cette institution. Elle sollicite un    prêt  de  100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de tissus à revendre. Avec ce financement elle espère  développer son activité de commerce par l’accroissement de ses bénéfices ce qui lui permettra de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise et de démarrer la vente de thiouraye. Elle souhaite aussi développer son épargne et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur consiste  à acquérir une cantine.

loans.use: acheter des tissus a revendre

loans.name: Dandjo

texts.fr: Dandjo âgée de 47 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Dandjo est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Thomas. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Dandjo vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées  par le couple. Pour cette raison, Dandjo vend depuis six ans dans sa région, des fagots de bois. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Dandjo achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Dandjo sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fagots de bois.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Karla

texts.en:
My name is Karla M. and I have been selling cosmetics and clothes for the bedroom in my own store for the past 4 years. My clients are employees of public and private offices. This business allows me to generate revenues to support my family. My goal is to increase the inventory in order to increase sales, the profits of which will go to covering all the expenses related to my two newborn sons.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karla M. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos y ropa de cama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son empleados de oficinas publicas y privadas, actividad que me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que tenga poder cubrir con todos los gastos de mis dos hijos recien nacidos.

loans.use: Buy creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, cameras, shampoo, conditioner.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married with three children. When he lost his job as a salesman at the Total petrol station in Kumba he welcomed unemployment as an opportunity to become self-employed. He traveled back to his native village and joined GHAPE in 2004. With his two previous loans he has succeeded in providing his community with fish, pork and manure.

Given a loan of $800, he plans to buy nine piglets, sticks to repair his fence, pig feed, and Belgo concentrate feed for fish. He is convinced he will succeed for because of his motivation, the skills he learned in trainings, the available market and his commitment to success. He plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: selling fish and pigs

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim S. lives in Beylagan and sells women's clothes in the city bazaar. He established his business 5 years ago. He has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2003. In 2003-2006 Rahim took out 3 loans from Normicro totaling $2000. Now Rahim would like to borrow $1000 to expand the line of goods he offers for sale.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. has a beautiful view of the park across the street from the hotel she owns in Ayacucho, Peru. She lives nearby with her 6 children, aged 14- 27, and her husband. She is kept very busy running and managing the 23-room hotel, for which she and her husband are solely responsible. She only hires help during “Santa Semana,” (Easter Week) which is a huge event in Ayacucho and brings visitors from all over Peru. She says this is definitely her busiest time of year, and the hotel is at full capacity for several weeks before, during, and after those dates.

Somehow Nelly, between cleaning the rooms, bookkeeping, and checking her guests in, has found time to open a small gift shop in the storefront adjacent to her hotel. She hopes to receive a loan of $600 to expand the inventory of the gift shop, which currently is limited to women’s hair accessories, postcards, and collectible dolls. She also has maintenance issues in several of the rooms, for which she would use part of the loan money to hire a plumber and electrician to fix.

loans.use: Expand the inventory of the gift shop; hire a plumber and electrician

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng S. is 36 years old, and lives with her 41-year-old husband and their two young children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Sreng S. works growing vegetables on their own plot of land, and earns $0.50 a day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns $3 a day. His motorcycle is very old and needs frequent and expensive repairs.

Mrs. Sreng S. would like to buy her husband a new motorbike so they no longer have to spend their very limited resources on repairing the old motorbike.

loans.use: Purchase a replacement motorbike for taxi service

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila Z. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. She is 47 years old and has one son. Her husband died 10 years ago.

She and her son sell clothes, perfumes, etc. in the city bazaar. She started her business after her husband died. She needs $1,200 to buy more kinds of goods and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Mr. Friday O. is 50 years old, married, with 7 children. He lives in Uromi, Edo state, and owns a poultry business. He has been a member of LAPO since 2005 and would be thankful for a loan of US$550 to buy more food for his birds.

loans.use: Purchase of feedstock for a poultry business

loans.name: Janane

texts.en: Janane is 47 years old and has two children. She lives with her family in the Lebanese town of Aley, where she works as a sales agent for different types of products that are popular in her area. She uses her income to support her family, and has come to us for a loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. This is the second time Janane has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and we believe she will use the new one as effectively as she did the first.

loans.use: To buy various products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani, age 46, is married to M., who has no job. To support their living, and their 3 children, Hani opened a small shop where she sells groceries, vegetables, snacks, fruits, fried snacks, etc. She earns $20 a day with a small profit. To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of $100, so she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Blanca Patricia

texts.es:
Blanca Patricia G. F. tiene una familia integrada por4 hijos de 11, 12, 16 y 24 años, ella esta casada y su marido se dedica a hacer trabajos de albañilería por su cuenta lo que generaba inestabilidad económica e su familia dado que el trabajo de su esposo era eventual por lo que un día hace 5 años compro una paca de ropa y la empezó a vender con éxito entre sus amistades, posteriormente emprendió viajes a Chinconcuac, México donde compra la ropa que ahora vende.

Ella desea contar con su apoyo para reunir US $475 que pagara en un plazo de 6 meses para así poder ir con un mayor capital y así comprar más mercancía ya que sus ventas se están incrementando.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca Patricia G. F. is married with 4 children 11,12,16 and 24 years old. Her husband works on construction jobs independently. Since his job does not provide stable income, 5 years ago she started to sell clothes among her friends. She now goes to Chinconcuac in Mexico where she buys the clothes in bulk and resells them.

She’s requesting a loan of $475 to be repaid in 6 months with this money she plans on increase her inventory.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi L. is 42 years old and lives in Siem Reap. She makes her living selling fish in the local market. Her business does relatively well, bringing in US $8 per day. Her husband works as a motor taxi driver based in front of a local hospital. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The remaining four are all enrolled in school. She wants to expand her market-stand’s inventory by buying more expensive kinds of fish. She hopes this will make her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Hayatin

texts.id:
Hayatin's daily activity is a seamstress, from morning till about evening. In the evening she usually sells fried items. Seamstressing has been done for years, since this is the only expertise she has. She receives many type of orders, individually as well as garment business who order in large quantities. Increasing family needs, makes her works harder . The income received is used for household needs and children's schooling expenses. Hayatin very much hopes that loan help could be used as capital to buy sewing needs like cloth and strings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari yang dijalani Hayatin adalah sebagai penjahit, mulai dari pagi sampai menjelang sore. Pada sore harinya biasanya dia menjual gorengan. Kegiatan jahit menjahit sudah dijalani selama bertahun-tahun, karena hanya inilah keahlian yang dia miliki saat ini. Berbagai macam pesanan sering dia terima, baik itu perorangan maupun garmen yang memesan dalam jumlah banyak. Kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin bertambah membuatnya semakin giat bekerja. Penghasilan yang didapat selain untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga juga untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya. Hayatin sangat berharap diberi bantuan pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal membeli bahan jahitan seperti kain dan benang.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza J. is 20 years old and lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where she runs her own small trading business. Mrs. J. applied for her first MicroInvest loan earlier this year, right after learning about our organization and its advantageous loan terms and procedures. She used her loan to expand her business, which consisted of selling material that her customers used to make popular Tajik-style national dresses. Mrs. J. has since expanded her business so that she now also sells ready-made national dresses. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy seasonal materials and additional national dresses. She will repay the loan in eight months.

loans.use: to import seasonal materials and dresses for resale

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Ricardo has worked the land his entire life--his parents taught him to farm at a very young age. He has been working his own land for eight years and dedicates great effort to maintaining it and improving production.

His land needs to be maintained during the harvest in order to yield good results and this maintenance entails applying fertilizers and insecticides. Therefore, Ricardo is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

Ricardo lives in the Ticuantepe municipality, an area which is well-known for producing excellent fruit, such as pineapple and pitahaya [or dragon fruit]. He has a 15-year-old son who is also learning to farm. In the future, Ricardo would like to be able to increase production and be able to generate more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Don Ricardo se ha dedicado trabajar la tierra toda su vida, desde muy pqueño sus padres le enseñaron el oficio de la Agricultura. Tiene 8 años de cultivar sus tierras, a las cuales le ha dedicado un gran esfuerzo por mantenerlos y sacar adelante su producto.

La tierra necesita de mantenimiento durante la cosecha para dar buen fruto, y ese mantenimiento conlleva laaplicación de abonos e insecticidas, y para eso solicita el préstamo Don Ricardo para comprar estos abonos e insecticidas.

Don Ricardo habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, municipio reconocido por la producción de excelentes frutos como son la piña y pitahaya. Tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad y quien está aprendiendo los oficios de la agricultura. Desea en un futuro poder aumentar la producción y generar mejores ingresos para su familia

loans.use: Production maintenance.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. He is a single gentleman that lives with his mother and willingly supports the expenses of his family. His primary goal has always been to give his family a better standard of living. Alexei is very hard-working and enterprising. He works in his car repair workshop day and night. He always says his work is something that gives him enthusiasm and inspiration. As a good manager, Alexei has succeeded in managing his loans in "Nadiya Ukraine" and repaid all of them without any delinquencies.

Alexei has been in business for 15 years. He is eager to access the above amount to buy good quality modern tools that he can use fixing vehicles in his shop. Alexei will benefit from more consistent financial support because it will strengthen his trade and provide an important profit margin to improve his business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase modern tools

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 47 years old and a married mother with three children. Two of them are in school. She is so grateful to Sinapi for giving her a loan which saved her marriage as her husband saw her to be a burden on him. She used the previous loan to start selling cooked rice for schools and children and other workers in her town. This enabled her save to help her husband in paying the children's school fees.

Juliana wants to add to her rice business the selling of spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called 'Yesu ne manidaso'. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, baking flour, etc. to make food to sell

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Phượng 41 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào mở cửa hàng tạp hóa, từ khi gia đình chị mở của hàng buôn bán kinh tế gia đình đã phát triển lên rõ rệt, mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm hàng ngày anh vân đi làm thu nhập binh quân 80.000đ/ ngày. Chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Vu Thi P., 41 years of age, has been a part of this organization since 1997. All her previous loans was used to invest into her convenience store business. Since starting the business, her family income has rise and since been stable. She is able to afford and purchase more for her family. Ms. P. husband is a taxi-driver and makes approximately 80.000d/day. She has 2 small children who are school-aged. This next loan that she is requesting, 10.000.000vnd, she would like to use this amount to invest in buying more inventory for her business. Her average monthly income is 5.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Ms. Sinoun K., 43 years old, is a housewife in Banteay Meanchey Province and currently has plans to start a pig-raising business. Her husband, Mr. Sat Chhorn, is a 49-year-old farmer who also works in a rice mill, earning in total $6 a day. The couple has two children, a daughter employed in a super market and a son who is a goldsmith in a local market.

Sinoun is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the construction of the family house. She believes the loan will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is a single mother to three children. Marcelina has a store in a rented space near the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, grains and drinks. Marcelina also sells prepared meals in the same location, for which she has an assistant.

Marcelina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, rice and oil. Marcelina’s dreams are to provide her children with a good education, to save money to expand her business, and to give her customers good service. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.  

Marcelina es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se ubica cerca al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, gaseosas. Además Marcelina vende comida en el mismo local, para lo cual cuenta con una ayudante.  

Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite.  

Los sueños de Marcelina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, ahorrar para ampliar su negocio y dar servicio de calidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and oil

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru:
Ходжиев Абдулло женат, имеет 6 детей. Он преподает математику в средней школе  своего поселка. Жена работает медсестрой в местной больнице, она остается на ночь на дежурство с больными пациентами. Бывают дни, когда супруги не видятся неделями. Но вырастить шестеро детей нелегко. Абдуллоджону пришлось  искать другие источники доходов. Он устроился водителем одного из городских  таксопарка.  Сначала он брал рейсы по городу, сейчас он берет и дальние рейсы в дальние города, и районы по республике Таджикистан.  Так как на дальние рейсы дают большие деньги. Сейчас их дети выросли, каждый из них зарабатывает на жизнь,  и помогают отцу. Один из сыновей  присылает деньги с России. На деньги сына и накопив необходимую сумму, он приобрел джип, так как на этой машине легко ехать по перевалам, также в эту машину  помещаются больше пассажиров, что приемлемо для его заработка. 
Его бизнес приносит хороший доход, поэтому его сыновья посоветовали  продать существующую машину и обратиться  в Микроинвест для приобретения новой и более надежной машины пригодной для перевала. Накопив нужный капитал, и по совету сына Абдулло получил кредит и приобрел надежную машину.
texts.en:
Abdullo K. is married and has six children. He teaches mathematics in his town's secondary school. His wife is a nurse at the local hospital, where she works with sick patients on the night shift. On occasion he does not see his wife for a week at a time, and raising six children was no easy matter. Adullo needed to find other sources of income, and took up driving a cab for a local taxi company. In the beginning, his fares were in town, but now because the pay is higher he takes on ones further afield, to distant towns and regions throughout Tajikistan. Their children are now grown and each of them earns a living and assists his father, including one son who wires money from Russia. Since business is good, his son recommended that he sell his current vehicle and seek assistance from MicroInvest for buying a new, more reliable vehicle better suited to mountain driving. Acting on his son's advice, Abdullo took out a loan and together with the money he had saved purchased an SUV that carries more passengers and makes it easy to drive the mountain passes, both good for his earnings.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an SUV

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans, Mme Eya A. est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Ayant depuis son enfance une passion pour le commerce des chaussures, elle n’a pas hésité à se lancer dans cette activité dès que l’occasion s’est offerte à elle. Pour assurer un service constant et stable à sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner régulièrement en marchandises. Cela va donner un coup de pousse à son commerce qu’elle aime tant et accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eya A., age 26, is married and the mother of two children. Being, since her childhood, passionate about the shoe selling business, she didn't hesitate to start her own when the chance arose. To ensure a constant and stable service to her clientele, she's seeking a loan to get supplies on a regular basis. This will bolster the business she loves so much, and increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell shoes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria Olawole is a 40-year-old married woman with one child.  She lives in Ogbomosho, in the Oyo state of Nigeria, where she sells provisions such as candles, juice, body cream, and bathing soaps.  She further explains that she started this business 6 years ago.  Now, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more provisions for resale purposes.  She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To increase inventory by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Genoveva es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Genoveva viaja todas las semanas a la selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. abarrotes, cereales, verduras, en la ciudad D. Monterrico en donD. se queda 4 días, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Genoveva son ahorrar su dinero y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Violeta community bank. She is married, 51 years old and has 7 children. Every week, she goes to the city of Monterrico in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells groceries, a business she operates with her husband. Genoveva needs a 2000-soles loan that she will use to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She wants to save her money and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She has been in the business for 3 years. Elizabeth is 34 years old and married with 2 children and lives in Badagry, Nigeria. Elizabeth is requesting a $700 loan to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Sokneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokneang H., 26, and her husband, Mr. Titya Met, 28, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 2000 and have three sons. One of their sons is in school and the other two are still too young.

Sokneang has been a silk weaver for two years; it is a skill she learned from her husband. They sell their finished product to the middleman who then takes it to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting her first loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Nabil has been working as a car painter for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and an electric generator(because often there is no electricity) for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing his tools and building up networking. Nabil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: purchase tools and an electric motor for his work

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Samaritano esta integrado por tres personas residentes de la colonia Buena Vistas, todas ellas se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo atras, las actividades que realizan las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:
la sra. Martha Marintez tiene 48 años de edad, ella viven en union libre con el sr. Jose Paz y tienen un hijo que depende de ellos, el esta estudiando en el colegio, ellos tienen una pulperia desde hace 4 años y en estos momentos necesitan el credito para poder surtirla ya que este es el unico trabajo que ella tiene y es su fuente de ingresos para sustentar su hogar.
La sra. Luz A. tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y sus hijos ya estan todos casados, ella vive sola en su casa, dicha casa la esta construyendo, su negocio es vender ropa americana clasificada, esta ropa la compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en la frontera de Honduras El Salvador, ella necesita comprar mas fardos de ropa para venderla y asi tener mayores ganancias. la meta de ella es poder terminar de construir su casa.
la Sra. Elba M. tiene 32 años de edad, ella es viuda y en estos momentos vive en union libre con el sr, Pablo Nuñez con quien tiene un niño de 8 meses de edad, el es zapatero y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, ella necesita el credito para poder comprar fardos de ropa y tener mejores ganancias y asi poder cubrir con todos los gastos de su hijo que es recien nacido.
texts.en:
The Samaritano group is comprised of three residents of the Colonia Buena Vistas. They have all known each other for a long time. The member’s activities follow: Martha M., 48, lives in a common law marriage with Jose Paz. They have a dependent son. He is in school. They have had a mini market for four years. They now need a loan to be able to stock the store. This is the only work that she has, and it is her source of income to support her household. Luz A., 56, is single. Her children are all married, and she lives alone in her house. The house is under construction. She sells used American clothing. She buys the clothes in Tegucigalpa and sells it on the border of Honduras and El Salvador. She needs a loan to buy more bundles of clothes to sell in order to have greater earnings. Her goal is to be able to finish building her house. Elba M., 32, is a widow. She now lives in a common law marriage with Pablo Nuñez. They have an eight month old son. He is a shoemaker, and she sells used clothes. She needs a loan to be able to buy bundles of clothes and have greater earnings. This way she will be able to cover the costs of her recently born son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes, butter, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, pastas, maseca (brand of corn), cornmeal, tomato sauce, soups

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: R. Farrukh is 25 years old and, together with his wife, they have two children. Farrukh is an experienced bread baker and has been doing this business for more than seven years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home and his wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Farrukh sells the majority of his products just from his place. However, he is also running a trading place in the central local market. Now Farrukh requests 5,000 Somoni in order to purchase flour wholesale as required for his business. He is grateful for all those supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Jesus Jackeline

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Jesús es madre soltera, tiene 28 años tiene un hijo de 2 años, que lo cuida.
Jesús trabajaba limpiando casas, lo dejo por que salió embarazada    y se fue a vivir con su esposo pero a los dos años la abandono y se puso a vender cerveza y gaseosas en la puerta de su casa.
Desde que Jesús esta en Finca, ha encontrado un apoyo y una solución a su economía, tiene un negocio y puede invertir.  
Jesús necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cervezas, gaseosas y golosinas.
El sueño de Jesús es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Progresando." She is a single mother, is 28, and has a 2-year-old son she cares for. Jesús used to work cleaning houses, but she stopped doing this when she became pregnant and went to live with her husband. He abandoned her two years ago, and she started to sell beer and soft drinks in front of her house. Since Jesús has worked with Finca, she has found support and a solution to her financial problems. She has a business and knows how to invest. She needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase beer, soft drinks, and candy. Her dream is to have her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, and candy

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Saodat, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Saodat is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 38 years old, married and the loving mother of three children.

Saodat started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than 3 years, she has operated a store where she sells kid’s clothing. Her store is well-known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Saodat hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose Saodat requests 2200 Somoni. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 29 years old, married and a very hard-working young woman. Her commitment to service and friendliness attract lots of customers to her business center, a small printing shop where she does typesetting, photocopying, printing, and the preparation of cards and fliers. She runs the business with help from her husband. Anna says that the business is profitable because there are few shops in her community which perform similar services. She wants to take advantage of the loan to increase her profits. She will do this by buying a printer, a photocopier and other equipment needed for her center to operate efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a printer, photocopier and other equipment.

loans.name: Davidika

texts.en:
Davidika is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iinga,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 12 and 6 years.

Davidika started her own business selling food 7 years ago.she works 9hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Davidika`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like rice for her business.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Davidika hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy commodities like rice,sugar,cooking oil

loans.name: Mrs. Phy Meng Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consisting of 16 people is located I. Sdau Aem Village I. Takeo Province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phy M., the village bank president, is a farmer who owns 0.8-hectare of land upon which she cultivates rice. She also owns a small thriving grocery store which she wants to expand by purchasing more grocery products to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Soeung Sophun, is a policeman. Mrs. Phy M. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are yet too young to study.

Three members I. this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells provisions. She is married with six children and she is 50 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou C., 40 years old, is a rice and vegetable grower from the Pursat Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crop like cabbages, rice, potatoes, and morning glories, which she will sell to a buyer when they have matured. She currently earns an average of $4/day and has been running the business for years. Her husband who helps her with the farmwork, stands next to her in the picture. Chou C. has two school-aged children. Chou C. and her family are also facing difficulties with transportation because they have no vehicle to get around. Chou C. is therefore pursuing a loan to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es una señora de 31 años, casada hace más de 8 años,  ella y su marido trabajan en  producción de  leche cruda  así como también se dedican a la agricultura cultivando maíz, cebolla, papa y alfa alfa para el consumo de su ganado. Tienen 3 hijos que estudian en una escuela que está a 5 km de la casa donde viven.

La señora Lourdes  no tiene casa propia viven en la casa de su madre, la vivienda no cuenta con todas las comodidades. Tienen  4 cabezas de ganado lechero  con las cuales producen leche para luego entregar a  una empresa que elabora diferentes tipos de productos lácteos.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de ganado lechero, de esta manera incrementara  la producción de leche, lo cual significa  aumentar el nivel de ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y de su familia.

La señora Lourdes y su esposo tienen el sueño de tener su casa propia  y además cerca a la ciudad para que los hijos puedan ir a una escuela más cercana, su meta es ver a los tres hijos profesionales y  hacer   crecer  el número de vacas que tienes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and has been married for 8 years. She and her husband produce raw milk. They are also farmers who grow corn, onions, and potatoes, as well as alfalfa for their cattle. They have 3 children who attend school 5 kilometers from their home.

They have 4 dairy cows with which they produce milk to sell to a company that manufactures a variety of dairy products. This loan will be used to purchase another cow, and in this way increase their production of milk, which will, in turn, increase their income and improve the quality of life of their family.

Lourdes does not have her own house, but lives in her mother's home, which does not have modern conveniences. Lourdes and her husband dream of having their own home close to the city so that their children can attend school closer to home. Their goal is to one day see all three of their children become professionals. They also want to increase the number of cows that they own.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one dairy cow

loans.name: Siriam Leonor

texts.es: Siriam Leonor es una señora que ha salido adelante a pesar de la situación económica en que se vive en la actualidad nunca a parado de trabajar por que es madre soltera de dos hijos; ellos ya están grandes y se valen de si mismos. Para obtener una vivienda que fuera de ella tuvo que trabajar mucho esta es de interés social  por lo que ella quiere hacerle mejoras para que se vea bonita, su proyecto es comprar vitro para ponerlo en la sala de su casa y así dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Siriam Leonor is a woman who has gotten ahead in spite of the current economic situation. She has never stopped working because she is a single mother with two children. They are now grown and take care of themselves. In order to have her own home she had to work a lot. The house is in a public housing project, and she wants to make improvements so that it looks nice. Her project is to buy tile to put down in the living room of her house. That way she will leave a nice inheritance for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down tile

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
B. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a ger district on the outskirts of the city. Together with his wife, B. operates a home goods retail business. They began their business in 2003, and the success of their business has allowed them to build a house where they will be living in the future. B. hopes to build a shop of their own so that they can stop renting operating space. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to build a garage by their house and purchase a large amount of home goods to sell in their business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To build a garage and purchase home goods to sell

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: La Señora Gladys Martínez de 34 años de edad, mujer emprendedora tiene su venta de variedades, para mejorar los ingresos de su familia ya que procreo tres hijos los cuales tiene que apoyar junto con su esposo para que puedan cumplir con el plan de estudio para formarse  como personas de bien y con un mejor nivel educativo. Meta de la cual esperan darles a sus hijos, con la esperanza de incrementar cada día su negocio por que gracias a Dios captado  muchos clientes y ha tenido varios encargos para este mes pero por falta de dinero no logra cumplir con la demanda de sus encargo es por eso que con este financiamiento lograra la inversión en la compra de ropa, zapatos electrodomésticos. El cual espera alcanzar buenas utilidades gracias a su esposo que dio dinero para comenzar esta venta y con apoyo de la financiera esta logrando surtir su inventario como la captación de clientes. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda en hacer cuarto para cada uno de sus hijos y así no estén juntos para una mejor privacidad. Claro que poco a poco lo lograra por que todo esta caro y no se puede construir de una sola vez.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Martínez is 34 years old, an enterprising woman that sells varied products to improve her family income. She has three sons who together with her husband she needs to support so that they can continue their plan of study and become more successful persons with a better education. She plans to be able to attain this goal for her children with the hope of growing her business more each day. Thanks to God she has been able to get many customers this month and has several orders, but for lack of funds she cannot meet the demand of her orders. This loan will enable her to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes, small electric appliances. She is expecting good results, thanks to her husband who gave her money to start this sales business, and with the help of the financing she is able to increase her inventory and obtain customers. Her plans are to continue to improve her home and add a room for each one of her children so that they do not have to be always together and have more privacy. She will achieve this little by little for everything is expensive and she cannot add on all at once.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, electric appliances to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: B. Louise est née le 28 Décembre 1968 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Louise vit depuis environs 20 ans à Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Louise est mariée à HOUEZEMOUDE  François et est mère d'un enfant. L'enfant est scolarisé et vit avec ses parents à Agbato. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Louise n'a pas été à l'école. Louise vend des tissus par le système de distribution, et aussi à Dantokpa marché international du Bénin. Louise mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de bols en séries. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa que Louise s'approvisionne. Louise exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Louise sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer davantage son activité.
texts.en:
B. Louise was born on December 28, 1968 in Adjohoun, Ouémé County, Benin.  She has been living for about 20 years in Agbato in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to HOUEZEMOUDE François and is the mother of one child, who attends school and is living at home.  The couple supports the family jointly.  Louise did not attend school.  She sells cloth through the distribution system and also at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She also runs a secondary business selling sets of bowls.  Lomé, the capital of Togo, which is a country neighboring Benin, is where she stocks up, as well as at Dantokpa.  She has been in this business for about fifteen years.  Louise is a previous ALIDé client having already obtained four loans from this micro-finance institution.  These loans have been repaid.  She's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé with the goal of increase her working capital and to bolster her business further. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics (damask, Wax, Hitarget, etc.)

loans.name: Kibwagala Group

texts.en:
Chiro R. is 43 years old. She is married, has 5 children, and lives in Dar es Salaam. 

Chiro owns a pharmacy. She also sells eggs from a genge, a basic structure made of wood and tin that is location by roadside. Chiro has been in the business for 6 years and currently earns 160000 shillings a month (~$120 USD).

This will be Chiro’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, she hopes to increase the inventory of her pharmacy and renovate her genge to improve her egg selling business. 

Chiro will share this loan with her loan group, which is composed of 14 other women from her community. These women work in food sales and second-hand clothing sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.
 
In the picture, Chiro is in the middle of the front row with the bright green head scarf.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her pharmacy and renovate her egg shop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un humilde trabajador de 42 años, está casado con la siempre alegre Juana, de 30 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Luis Alexander de 13 y Luis Samuel de un año.
Su mayor anhelo es poder comprarse un terreno en la ciudad para construir una casa donde pueda instalar una tienda de comestibles, además de incrementar su producción agrícola.
Es por eso que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan a diario en su chacra al sembrar papa, arveja y maíz desde hace 10 años.
Ellos consideran que esta actividad es bastante rentable, pues después de comercializar sus productos en el mercado puede cubrir las primeras necesidades de su familia y permitirle ahorrar.
Sin embargo, lo que no le gusta de su labor es que no puede pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos, porque debe aprovechar el máximo de tiempo para trabajar en sus chacras; por otro lado, una de las cosas que más le satisface es llevar los productos recién cosechados para que su esposa los cocine y sea su familia los primeros en degustar el sabor de los frutos, recompensa de su dedicación.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que está progresando, por lo que desea solicitar más créditos posteriormente. A su vez, desea continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes aprecian el trabajo que desempeña. Para asegurar una buena cosecha esta temporada, con el dinero que solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, un saco de fertilizante y una botella de insecticida para esparcir sobre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, is a humble hard-worker. He is married to the always happy Juana, who is 30. They have two children; Luis Alexander is 13, And Luis Samuel is 1. His greatest desire is to buy a piece of land in the city to build a house where he could set up a grocery store. He also wants to increase his agricultural production. That is why he and his wife put forth so much effort everyday. They have been planting potatoes, peas, and corn on their farm for ten years. They consider this activity to be profitable enough. After selling their products in the market they are able to cover the family necessities and save. Nevertheless, what he does not like about his work is not being able to spend much time with his children because he needs to spend as much time as possible working in his fields. On the other hand, one of the things that satisfies him the most is taking his recently harvested products to his wife. She cooks them, and his family is the first to savor the crops. This is recompense for his dedication. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is sure that he is progressing, and he wants to ask for more loans later. At the same time, he wishes to continue working with the members of his communal bank. They value the work that is done. To assure a good harvest this season, he will use the money he is asking for to buy a bag of pea seeds, a sack of fertilizer, and a bottle of insecticide to apply to his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo, vive en la zona Villa Cooperativa, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en  su terreno propio, donde construye su casita  la cual adquirió con sus ahorros, junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 1 año.
 
Trabaja como ingeniero civil en la alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materiales de construcción y así  acelerar la construcción que viene realizando,  ya que por esta época de lluvias  resulta un poco dificultoso su construcción.

Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives with his wife and baby son of one year old in the Villa Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto. He lives on his own land and is building his home, which he bought with his savings. He works as a Civil Engineer for La Paz city council. The loan will go towards buying construction materials and help speed up the house building process, especially since the rainy season means construction is all the more difficult. This is Marcelo’s second loan with Impro. His successful credit analysis means he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue building his house.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Fe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 31 year old married man and father of 2 young children. In 2006, he opened a mini-market in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. His wife also works as a teacher and together they pay for their family's expenses, school expenses, hospitality etc. He offers food products, dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, and other products to his clients. 

Today, Tarek is requesting a loan of $1,000 to fill his shop with the needed merchandise to increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To fill his shop with needed merchandise.

loans.name: Nann

texts.en: Mr. Nann N., 37, sells chop-wood that he carves from the forest or buys from people who live near the forest. He has been operating in this sector since 2000 and makes around $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Lux Gnek, 37, is a mother who farms in two seasons, both rainy and dry, earning approximately $2 each day. This couple lives with their three children in Sort Nikom commune, in the province of Siem Reap. Nann N. will be using the loan to hire a laborer to repair his old house.

loans.use: To repair his old house.

loans.name: Yon Cherling

texts.es:
Yon tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus tios en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida vendiendo verduras y frutas desde hace mas de un año en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe, el ofrece todo tipo de productos frescos a sus clientes. Como esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos económicos, el trata de ofrecer productos de buena calidad y un trato amable a sus clientes para poder mantener su negocio.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y la demanda por los productos que ofrece ha ido aumentando, por este motivo el desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas verduras y frutas, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yon es un joven bastante trabajador y muy resposable, su mayor anhelo es poder tener un puesto mas grande dentro del mercado. Las personas que lo conocen le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Yon is 26 years old. He is single, and he lives with his aunt and uncle in the Guadalupe district. This district is in a coastal region that belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region. It is located one hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over one year he has been earning a living selling vegetables and fruits outside of the market in the city of Guadalupe. He sells all types of fresh products to his customers. As this is the only activity that provides him with economic income, he tries to offer good quality products and good customer service in order to be able to maintain his business. His business has been growing, and the demand for the products he sells has been increasing. Therefore, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,500 PEN. This is to help him achieve his objective. Yon is a very hard working young man, and he is very responsible. His greatest goal is to be able to have a larger stand inside of the market. The people who know him hold him in high esteem, and they consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetable to expand his business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida P. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Leonida joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
