The first dream is that she one day will be able to buy a nice house.  The second dream is to travel as a tourist to the USA and Mexico.

loans.use: Increase product availability in business

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
"Trabajando para el futuro" or "Working for the future" is a large group of 20 hopeful people trying to receive a loan. This group is a great example of the power of micro-credit, and the effects it can have on the poor. This group is all hoping to receive their 6th or 7th loans. All the previous loans have all been paid back in full and on time, and now they hope to receive an even larger loan. This group of 20 hardworking people have all started to realize that they have the ability to change their future, and have all started to experience some success. Receiving a 7th loan is not something that all borrowers end up getting to, and that is in it self a great testament to the character and hard work of this group.

Ynes J. is the group representative, and a perfect example to represent this group. Ynes is a very outgoing, hardworking mother to 3 children. She is an extremely loving mother and has done everything in her power to proviD. her children with everything she never had. Ynes has lived in extreme poverty her whole life, and decided a few years back that she wanted to change her future and the future of her family. She received her first loan from Esperanza International and started a small salon from her house. From there she kept working hard and kept increasing the services and products of her salon, and today she has a very successful business. She can finally afford to pay for all of life's basic necessities, and even some luxuries. She has never been happier than she is now, and feels like she can beat poverty. The best part is that she is a testament to her children that they don't have to accept poverty as part of their lives, and can create a better life. Ynes is very excited about the future and is happy with the changes SHE maD. in her life! She is on the right path, and ready to keep increasing her business.

Thank you for your support of Ynes, and the group.

loans.use: Buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Isabel es separada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Isabel es vende frutas variadas de manera ambulatoria cerca al cementerio de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas variadas.
Los sueños de Isabel son construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Isabel is separated, is 40 years old and has five children. Isabel sells various fruit on foot near the city cemetary, an activity that she performs every day with the help of her son. Isabel needs a loan of 1,200 soles which will be invested in the purchase of various fruit. Isabel's dreams are to build a house and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of various fruit.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario está a punto de cumplir 30 años, es soltero, aun vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de su hermana. Todos sus hermanos se fueron a Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, y le han propuesto irse con ellos, pero él prefiere apostar por el arte de labrar la tierra, como él llama a la agricultura, ya que le gusta mucho esta actividad. Años atrás solo sembraba en chacras temporales (regadas por la lluvia), y sus cosechas eran en los meses abril a mayo. Pero quiso cambiar esa realidad alquilando chacras de regadío y cambiado todas las semillas de acuerdo al tipo de tierra. Han pasado más de tres años y por fin está viendo los frutos de su esfuerzo. Ahora sus cosechas son  cada dos o tres veces por año, y cree haber aprendido las técnicas para convertirse en un gran agricultor. Sus metas próximas son de sembrar en la costa, debido a que cuenta con una buena cantidad de semillas especiales para ese clima, así incrementará su producción, con ello sus ganancias y convertirá su labor en una actividad muy rentable. Hace un año Nazario fue el presidente de su banco comunal, y cumplió muy bien con sus funciones, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus nuevas siembras en chacras costeñas.
texts.en:
Nazario is about to turn 30, he is single, and still lives in his mother's house along with his sister. His other siblings all left for Lima to look for a better future, and have proposed that he go with them, but he prefers to stay and work the land, as he refers to agriculture, since he really likes this activity. Many years ago he only farmed small plots of land (watered by the rain), and his harvests were in the months of April and May. But he wanted a change from renting land and changed all the seeds according to the type of land. More than three years have passed and he is finally seeing the fruit of his labor. Now his crops are harvested two or three times a year, and he believes he has learned the techniques to become a great farmer. His upcoming goals are to farm on the coast, since he has a large quantity of seeds especially for that climate. In this way he will increase his production which will increase his earnings and make his work a very profitable activity. Last year Nazario was the president of his community bank, and he completed all his tasks very well. This is his eighth loan with MFP and in all this time he has shown responsibility in his payments. The money he is asking for is for buying chemical fertilizers for planting his new coastal crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Mrs. Vun H., 55, and her husband, Mr. Den Yem, 57, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1970 and have three children: one son who is in grade 10 and two daughters who are silk weavers.

Vun use to be a silk weaver, but she stopped weaving and gave her looms to her daughters. They sell their finished products to a middleman who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer; besides farming he raises cows as well. Vun is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase oxen for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To add in her own money to purchase oxen for husband to raise.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 36 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Adnan has been selling aluminum. He also produces doors and windows. He requested a loan of US $2000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical tools for his work. This is the first time that Adnan has requested a loan.

Adnan is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy power tools

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa, la señora Ana M. se dedica arduamente a atender su negocio de pulpería el cual posee en su casa de habitación donde desde hace 12 años se dedica con gran ahínco a vender los diferentes productos ofreciéndolos a sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ya que le es de importancia obtenerlos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo en este momento para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the town of Chichigalpa, Señora Ana M. arduously devotes herself to the grocery business she runs in her home. For 12 years, she has devoted herself with great determination to the sale of the various products she offers to her customers.

Currently, Sra. M. has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of inventory it is important for her to obtain. In this way, she will progress in her business, where this assistance is now needed in order to proceed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Sairiniso

texts.en:
Since 1992, Sairiniso, a loving grandmother of three grandchildren, has dedicated herself to processing granulated sugar and then making from it a variety of pastries to sell in local markets. She begins her workday at early morning along with her daughter-in-law, who is also engaged in this business. Sairiniso’s dreams is to grow her business so she can offer her products personally in markets throughout the regions of her country, thereby earning greater income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to expand her business by purchasing additional equipment for processing granulated sugar. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her keep making progress in her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for processing granulated sugar.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende golosinas y canchas de manera ambulatoria en el parque de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Sandra trabaja en un restaurante como ayudante.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Sandra sueña con construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Violeta Microfinance Institute.

Sandra is a 21-year-old single mother with 1 son. She sells candy and popcorn as a street vendor at the Ayacucho city park. Additionally, Sandra works as an assistant at a restaurant.

She needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing candy.

Sandra dreams of having her own house built and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran M. is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Tehran has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise eight years ago with a starting capital of $200. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he has expanded his business over time.  It has become a family affair now, as they help him with the business. 

Today, Tehran needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2000. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to make extra effort to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Julia Herminia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís. 
Julia es casada tiene 7 hijos el ultimo tiene 12 años que esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Julia trabaja desde los  16 años, donde trabajaba  la señora  se dedicaba hacer pasteles y ella aprendió,  la señora se murió, Julia se quedo  sin trabajo, y se puso en su casa hacer pasteles ella los vende en los colegios, hospitales, los sábados y domingos limpia casas. 
Desde que Julia esta en Finca  su  capital ha crecido.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos. 
El sueño de Julia es trabajar  para comprase un carro para a ser movilidad escolar.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of Bancomunal San Luis. She is married and has seven children. Her youngest is 12 and goes to public school. Julia has been working since she was 16 years old. She learned to bake with the woman she used to work for, who baked cakes for a living. When the lady died Julia lost her job, so she started to bake cakes at home. She now sells them to schools and hospitals. She cleans houses on Saturday and Sunday. Julia’s financial resources have increased since she joined Finca. Julia has asked for a loan of 1,200 soles ($425). She will use the money to buy flour, butter and eggs. Her goal is to eventually buy a car to provide school transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Secondary borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 14 years.

lilian started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Liliani`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Lilian hopes to save more money ans expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma sells clothes, shoes, bags and under wears in her shop. She is successful in her business because she is known for her good business and competitive prices. Ifeoma is 27 years old and married with a child. Ifeoma hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more clothes and under wears to sell. She is grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and under wears to sell

loans.name: Maria Licet

texts.es: Doña Maria Licet Martínez Martínez posee un negocio de venta de mercadería en general desde hace 10 años, ella vende en los diferentes mercados y sus comarcas a precios favorables. Es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son menores de edad, su esposo trabaja como conductor de camiones en Nicaragua y Centroamérica juntos tratan de motivarse para salir adelante y colaboran para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario. La señora Maria realiza sus compras de contado en el mercado de mangua porque es aquí donde sus productos son mucho más favorables, en donde y le generan un poco mas de ganancia todos los días se levanta con la esperanza de mejorar en su negocio y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de manera muy humilde. Ella está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio. su deseo es poner un negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Licet Martínez Martínez has been selling general merchandise for the past 10 years. She offers her products at affordable prices throughout various markets in the region. She is the mother of three dependent children. Her husband is a truck driver who travels throughout Nicaragua and other parts of Central America. They both are motivated to move forward and work together so that their children lack nothing.

Sra. Maria buys her merchandise at the market in Managua because the products there are better. She hopes to earn a little more income every day, improve her business, and teach her children how to make an honest living. The loan she is requesting will be invested into her business. She hopes to be able to run her business out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en:
Amanjol, 29, lives with his wife and two year old daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Amanjol is a very busy man, owning not just one but two businesses. He operates a shoe repairing business during the day and drives a taxi at night. Amanjol began repairing shoes in 2000 after he graduated high school. He was able to save up money for a car and begin his taxi service in 2006.

Today, his taxi service earns between 20,000 and 45,000 tugrugs (~14-31 USD) each day. Amanjol works many hours every day to provide his family the things they need. He would eventually like to hire an assistant in his shoe repair shop so he can grow his earning and expand his customer base. Until that time he will keep working hard and saving money for his family’s future.

Amanjol is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase more supplies like rubber, glue, leather and nails that he needs for his shoe repair business.

loans.use: Purchase raw material.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly D. is from the village of Danlugan Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Pearly is married. To make a living, Pearly owns & operates a sari-sari"  general store, selling a variety of products such as can goods, sugar, rice, salt, shampoo, soap and other products needed in the local community. Pearly has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Pearly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pearly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pearly is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Pearly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to save the income for a future emergency. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Francisca Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Zoila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva  24 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad y fue por iniciativa propia quien decidió desarrollarse en este tipo de actividad y contando con un pequeño capital y el conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender cordialmente a sus clientes que día a día, acuden a su taller para ser atendidos y es Francisca, quien  les espera  amablemente y con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

En la actualidad, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Una de sus metas por lograr es tener un taller  de alta costura e implementarlo con maquinas industriales modernas. Es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará una maquina y una remalladora por que la que tiene ya no funciona bien, además si sobra el dinero comprará alfileres tijera y papel molde. 

Francisca, hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada, con  ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca Zoila is a member of the Hope Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

Francisca has been engaged in sewing for 24 years. With the help of a little capital, she took the initiative to utilize her sewing skills by opening a dressmaking shop out of her house. Her business is well suited for welcoming customers, whom she greets with her friendly and charming personality.

Francisca informs us that her business is doing well. Her customers place their orders in advance. One of her goals is to open a boutique selling couture fashions and manufacture the garments using modern industrial equipment. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase a sewing machine and an overlock stitcher because her current equipment is in disrepair. In addition, Francisca will use any leftover money to buy pins, scissors, and paper molds.

Today Francisca feels she is an accomplished woman and continues to strive for her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing equipment & materials
